name: Getaway at Lovers Pt. Pacific Grv
space: Very charming and romantic little house located near one of California's most beautiful locations in historic Pacific Grove. Perfect for couples on a  weekend getaway, romantic honeymoon or special occasion.This house was photographed for Carmel Magazine in Feb.09 for its Pacific Grove edition. an easy walk to many restaurants, coffee shops, antique shops,movie theater, farmers market, natural history museum, golf and the beach.  Two blocks from Lover's Point Park and beach and the coastal recreation trail where you can bike or rent surreys.  Cottage has One bedroom with queen French antique bed, down comforter, crystal chandelier,kitchen has antique wedgewood stove,and outdoor bbq and all kitchen appliances. House has hardwood and cork flooring.Down filled couch and wood burning stone fireplace in livingroom. Tile shower/tub, laundry. Outdoor deck and garden sunroom. Cable tv, Wi Fi, VCR and DVD player are available. Security deposit required. Extra cleaning may be required for stays

interaction: Phone, email or text only. I do not meet my guests in person.
house_rules: No smoking allowed on premises. No Pets. Please no heavy perfumes, colognes or lotions.
host_about:
I love living near the ocean here in Pacific Grove and walk daily with my dogs on the beach.I am a hair stylist and own a salon in Carmel, I own and renovate old houses and love to travel to tropical places. I enjoy walking to great restaurants and the  Farmer's market all within two blocks. This is the perfect location!
I hope your wanderings lead you to places you love.

name: Ocean front 6-bedroom masterpiece
summary: In May 2015, Trip Advisor chose Pacific Grove as one of the top scenic destinations in all of the United States!  We are very proud of this honor, and it came from reviews by guests who stayed at my home and others in town. You will love it here!   We operate with Pacific Grove Transient Use License #83.
space: No need to fight over who gets the ocean view in this fabulous 6-bedroom, 4-bath home! With 270 degrees of blue-water views, four of the bedrooms have full views of the Pacific and Monterey Bay. The fifth and sixth bedrooms have a quiet, courtyard view just in case somebody doesn't like to go to sleep to the sound of the waves, or watch the moon sinking into the sea at night.      We are minutes from Carmel and Cannery Row in Monterey, and Pebble Beach is our neighbor.       We have a fully stocked gourmet kitchen - and the cook gets an ocean view, too. Dining table seats 10, 14 with extension. Foosball, pinball, Legos, ping pong and lots of other toys for the kids.  Steinway grand piano for the musically inclined. Off-street parking for six cars is available.       The Spanish Bay Club is a lovely 20-minute walk away, along the world-famous Pacific Grove recreation trail. Guest club privileges for up to four people for tennis, exercise and weight room, heated pool, spa, sauna, steam,

neighborhood_overview: I call Pacific Grove "Iowa with a Beach".  It is a really friendly small town with everything you need within 1 mile of the house. We have a lovely Farmers Market, Natural History Museum, Movie Theater, shops, restaurants, wildlife and butterflies! In May 2015, Trip Advisor chose Pacific Grove as one of the top 12 Scenic Destinations in all of the United States.  You will love it here!
notes: I operate under Pacific Grove Short Term Rental License #83. A Rental Contract is required after your booking, and must be signed before the reservation is complete.  Here is a Sample Rental Contract for your review: RENTAL AGREEMENT FOR 12 GUESTS OR FEWER: On behalf of myself and the persons named on this page, I wish to rent the property specified below, and I agree that this rental is subject to the terms and conditions listed on the following pages. This is the entire agreement applicable to the rental of the property. I agree that the booking and this Agreement are not effective until my nonrefundable deposit is received by Owner.  I agree that the balance of the rental fee, security deposit, services fees, applicable taxes and any fees for excessive cleaning or utilities usage, are payable under the terms and conditions of this Agreement.   Property: 1500 Sunset Drive, Pacific Grove, CA.    There is emergency telephone service at the home: (831) (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN); the line is
transit: The Monterey Salinas Transit bus stop is one block away. In the summer, the MST trolley operates out of the same stop, and is free.
access: Everything except the caretaker's quarters, which has its own entrance and parking area.
interaction: I meet every group of guests personally to give them a tour of the house, the garage-door opener, the combination to the locks, and show them how to work everything.  It is so much more relaxing than spending your vacation trying to figure out how to work the TV components, the hot tub, or the pinball machine.
house_rules: House Rules and Information for Rocky Shores Guests Special Event Rates: Our rates go up during two events each year:  The Concours d'Elegance in Pebble Beach ($2000 per night for up to 10 guests) and Thanksgiving week ($2000 per night for up to 10 guests). In 2019, we will also have the $2000 per night pricing for the U.S. Open in Pebble Beach. House Rules and Information for Rocky Shores Guests General House Rules: * No cigar smoking on the property. Cigarette smoking is allowed in the courtyard, greenhouse and spa. Please pick up butts! * No drinks or other objects on the Steinway. * Check-in is at 3pm or later. Check-out is at 10 a.m. or before.  * Daily maid service available; please book in advance. * Guest privileges at Spanish Bay Club (tennis (2 lighted courts), exercise equipment, heated pool, hot tub, sauna, steam) available @$25 per person per day. Maximum per day is 4 people. Please let us know in advance so we can book for you. Massage treatments are also available, with
host_about: I love sharing my home with families on vacation or folks having a reunion or people celebrating a special event.

name: Pet-Friendly* Cottage Near Beach (PG Lic#0090)
summary: Our quaint, thoughtfully-stocked 300 sq ft cottage is located steps from the ocean (5 min walk), yet tucked away behind our home, affording guests ample privacy, easy parking and all the amenities of home.  Sip wine on the patio after a day of adventures while listening to the surf, and sleep soundly on our new king Saatva eco-hybrid mattress.
space: Our 1 bed/1 bath, studio-style cottage is offered fully furnished with kitchenette, organic fair trade coffee, selection of teas, and high quality organic breakfast items provided.   If you have food allergies or dietary limitations of any kind, please let us know in advance, we're happy to accommodate you!   Please note: we recently gutted the kitchenette and it now has 2 gas burners for cooking, a sink, and fridge.  Due to the small space and limited availability of petite-sized appliances, we no longer have an oven or freezer.   In place of an oven, we've just added a well-rated Breville countertop oven, which is large enough to roast a turkey, make a pizza, or do a little baking, should the mood strike.  However, if you plan to do a lot of cooking during your stay, you may prefer to seek out a property with a full-sized kitchen. Hundreds of tv channels + dvd player On Demand shows and movies  Secured Wifi  Charming private patio Complimentary toiletries Iron/ironing board Hair drye

neighborhood_overview: Hands down, the best part about our 'hood is the proximity to the ocean.  You can (usually) hear it, and smell it from our house, and see its amazing beauty within a brief walk.  On a clear night, the sunsets are breathtaking.
notes: If you look deep enough into our reviews, you'll notice that we cancelled on some of our guests during the fall of 2015, here's why:  The addition/renovation of our main house took FAR longer to complete than originally anticipated.   We let scheduled guests know of the situation in advance, and gave them an option to cancel, or receive a discounted stay.  For those that opted to cancel, we felt it was only fair to cancel on their behalf, incurring fees and penalties on our end as a result.  This is because at the time, Airbnb didn't refund their "service fees" when a guest cancelled their own reservation, they only received a FULL refund if the host made the cancellation.  Prior to our home renovation, we've never cancelled on our guests, and don't plan to in the future!  It was an unfortunate set of circumstances and we feel we handled it as best we could.
transit: We're on the MST bus line, so if you'd rather not drive, the #1 express stops right outside our gates at :21 after the hour until 7pm.  Uber, Lyft, and taxis are also available.  The walk to Pacific Grove's downtown area takes approximately 20 minutes.
access: You're welcome to the cottage and the private patio.
interaction: We occasionally socialize with guests and we are typically available for assistance should you need anything (we're happy to help you make the most of your time here with recommendations). However, there are situations where we might not be in town.  Generally, we have a caretaker in the main house if we are not going to be present, should anything go awry.  We always let guests know ahead of time when we won't be in town, and we're generally reachable by phone/email/text regardless.
house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM.  Generally, we're not able to accomodate early check-in requests, as our check-out policy is 12pm and many guests take full advantage of the extra time.   • No smoking (even outside) - living in California, we often have doors/windows open and don't want our home to smell like cigarettes. Please keep noise levels respectful - we are located in a (mostly) peaceful residential neighborhood where the main source of noise is the crashing of the surf!
host_about:
We're a mid-thirties couple that loves to hit the road.  While we adore international adventures, we also regularly road trip throughout the beautiful west.  Our most recent notable adventures were Paris and Brazil, and we're eyeing New Zealand next.  We have a new(ish) addition to our posse (Millie) and look forward to exploring the world through her eyes.

Our interests include cooking/dining, nature, travel, animals, wine, hiking, kayaking, and we're big fans of the tv shows Curb Your Enthusiasm, and Top Chef.

We moved to the Monterey Peninsula from Portland Oregon in the fall of '09 and haven't looked back.  (Okay, we admit, we REALLY miss the interesting assortment of people, and the incredible restaurants + fabulous food carts!)

We are passionate about the environment and do what we can to run a "green" household such as: recycle and compost, serve food that is organic and local, use only earth friendly cleaning/household products, etc.

We would love to host you in our charming guest cottage, a 5 minute walk from Asilomar State Beach in Pacific Grove.  We welcome people of all faiths, colors, orientations, and lifestyles to our little patch of paradise. 

We look forward to meeting you!

name: CA Dreaming w/Ocean View, King bed, 2 AQ. tix
summary: Wake to an ocean view from a King sized bed, with seals barking and birds singing. Enjoy the granite walk-in shower w/sky window. Dance to the vinyl collection, hang in the gardens or use the free Aquarium passes! ($100 value) CA/Zen blend… magical and peaceful.
space: Welcome to the California Dreaming Bungalow.  Wake up to an ocean view right from your bed and enjoy the sound of the morning birds singing. Fall asleep to the sound of the seals barking under a star filled sky. And you will sleep well on the king-size organic wool/latex mattress... it has been named the most comfortable bed in the world by numerous guests! Enjoy your private shower with a sky window that opens to the warmth of the sun. If you feel like dancing, enjoy our eclectic vinyl collection with everything from Miles Davis to The Tubes. Does this sound too good to be true? Dare I even mention the 2 free aquarium tickets?   California Dreaming is an eco-friendly bungalow with natural cork flooring, bamboo, shoji, recycled granite, and non-toxic paint. It is a Dwell-inspired, eclectic blend of Japanese Zen and California design overlooking the garden, trees and the Pacific Ocean - a truly magical, romantic, fun space!  CA Dream includes a small kitchenette with a coffee and tea ma

neighborhood_overview: This is a safe, serene neighborhood with lots of really nice people. My neighbors love Airbnb due to considerate guests.  There are a lot of small children in the neighborhood so PLEASE DRIVE VERY SLOWLY once you enter the cul-de-sac. Thanks! Make sure you have read instructions and are clear exactly where to park. Neighborhood peace is a really cool thing..
notes: Please do read the information sent with the booking. It includes suggestions and also important information regarding the bungalow.   Be aware that Zeus is not only three legged, he is also blind and pretty deaf. He's a great dog, but sometimes can get underfoot so be aware of his presence if he is near you.
transit: There is some public transportation, but it is best to have your own car.  There is a specific parking spot for your vehicle in front of our home. We ask you read the instructions before arriving so you are clear as to where to park.
access: The kitchen in the main house may be available, but this needs to be discussed before arrival.
interaction: At this point, I'm pretty good at the Airbnb dance! Each guest wants a certain level of interaction and I do my best to give you all the needed information and privacy at the same time.  You will receive a plethora ( I love that word) of suggestions that come with your reservation acceptance. I'm really happy to help any way I can with making your visit wonderful.  I am a songwriter so be aware that you may hear me playing piano during your stay. If at any point it is intrusive (you may hear it slightly in the bungalow) PLEASE let me know. I really mean this. I have another keyboard I can use in the back room whenever needed.
house_rules: Out of  the hundreds of people that we've hosted, 99% of them have been wonderful people. IF you think you might be that funky (in a bad way) 1%,  let us know beforehand and we'll suggest a nice hotel! If you have kleptomaniac tendencies, stay away from our vinyl collection.   Quiet hours in the gardens are from 9pm to 10am.  This is a quiet neighborhood and noise carries so please always be respectful of the neighbors. Read the information that is sent with your booking. Lots of great suggestions (hikes, favorite things to do, restaurants, etc…) and also where to park when you arrive.  PLEASE read! Bottom line, it's all basic stuff.  Come relax, be kind and enjoy yourself… as you can tell by the reviews, CA DREAM is pretty magical.  Prepare yourself for something special!
host_about:
Hi Fellow Airbnbers,
I have lived in Pacific Grove for fifteen years and love its peace and beauty. Before Pacific Grove, I was a longtime Bay Area resident (SF and Berkeley) and am a native Californian. I have had a variety of careers over the years, but I've always been a songwriter. You may hear me playing piano and singing from time to time. Being an Airbnb host is a perfect fit for me because I truly, genuinely full heartedly (you get the point) want guests to have a perfect stay while they're here. 
I am an old school host (seven years) who believes Airbnb is first and foremost about community. The Airbnb community has brought much joy to my life thanks to my own travels and the wonderful guests who have visited the bungalow.

name: Lovely Studio, walk to Lovers Point  Lic#0367
summary: Quiet, private, close to beach, shopping, restaurants and walking trails    Plenty of street parking  Prices for Weekly and Monthly stays are negotiable
space: Lovely studio located in the heart of downtown Pacific Grove, walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shops, antique stores, ocean kayaking, diving, and golfing.  Also,  patio, wireless, and a  kitchen. Specifically you can walk to Lover's Point, Monterey Bay Aquarium, and the Monterey Bike Path. Fantastic restaurants like Passion Fish and Red House Cafe are but a 5 minute walk from the studio. Or take a short trek to award winning restaurants such as Il Vecchio. For those who like to use public transit, there is a bus stop very nearby on the corner of Pacific and Lighthouse.  Monterey's famous  walkway is a 5 minute walk taking you directly to the Aquarium, Cannery Row, Fisherman's Wharf, Monterey Beach and Dunes. Asilomar is a short drive , alternately there is a walking path a short distance from the house.

notes: Kitchen cookware is adequate for simple meals.  For anything more sophisticated you need to bring your own.
transit: 2 minutes  to Bus.  2 minutes to laundromat. 3 minutes to Lovers Point, restaurants, walking, , etc.
access: Simple
interaction: I respect my guest's privacy but am available for any needs
house_rules: No smoking, drugs or parties, NO OVERNIGHT GUESTS.  Kitchen is restricted to light use and simple meals.  No pets. Be respectful, treat it as you would your own.
host_about: I  love art, outdoors and like going for walks around Lovers Point. This area is so beautiful and I like the ability to share it with others.

name: Top Rated,Ocean View,Spa,Fireplace
summary: Fabulous home in Pacific Grove with beautiful ocean views, huge outdoor Jacuzzi, huge stone fireplace and back deck, gas grill, gourmet kitchen, grand piano, 70" flat screen TV, free aquarium tickets, near great restaurants and kept immaculate.
space: You will love my home. It gets amazing reviews from guests. The house comes with two free Monterey Aquarium Passes. Plus the home was designed by the architect who designed the Monterey Bay Aquarium! A top rated home in Pacific Grove. I will book for 1 night during weekday nights (Monday - Thursday). I require 2 nights for any weekend. It inlcudes a high-end spa with waterfalls, powerful jets, and huge (seats 8) complete with a view of the ocean and gardens. You can hear your favorite music from the indoor/outdoor Bose sound system while sipping wine in the jacuzzi talking to your best friend, loved one, or family member. You will love it. The house now has a portable BeatBox Speaker By Dr. Dre. It is a portable, wireless, bluetooth speaker, top of the line, that works in conjunction with your IPOD, IPhone, Android Phone, or MP3 player. You can listen to your favorite music by the fireplace, by the jacuzzi, or the rooftop, ocean view deck, wherever the night takes you at my home. You w

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet. I have wonderful, very kind, and helpful neighbors. The neighborhood is away from the tourist traffic. You will feel like you are in one of the last small town ocean front communities in the US, yet very close to lots of activity that you may wish to venture to.
notes: Please note, I added a 4th bedroom. There is an upstairs loft with a queen sized sleigh bed with beautiful ocean views. I've added another gorgeous queen sized hand carved bed from India downstairs that faces the beautiful back deck with huge outdoor stone fireplace. The room bedrooms are in the same room, one upstairs and one downstairs, so the guests would have to be okay with that situation. The other two bedrooms downstairs are both separate. Additionally, there are two bathrooms, one downstairs and one upstairs by the large entertainment room. The driveway is fairly steep so elderly guests or guests with mobility issues will have to take that into account. I also suggest cars/trucks will a low suspension pull into and out of the driveway at a 45 degree angle so that your back bumper does not hit the road. I have a BMW 328i and pull into and out of the driveway at a 45 degree angle and my car does not hit the road. There is no issue with cars/SUVs/Trucks that have a higher suspensi
transit: There is a local bus system that you can use. I also have two mountain bikes that you can use. There are many hiking trails walking distance from my home and lovely biking travels that run along the beach for miles leading to Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium.
access: Guests will have access to towels, linens, coffee, coffee maker, the beach, amazing sound system, an amazing outdoor fireplace, and a wonderful tuned grand piano. You will also have access to fabulous restaurants, french, italian, vegetarian, ocean front, outdoor, and many other types of cuisines and settings. Just ask me for my top 10 list. I lived there for 12 years so I know all the very best restaurants and places to go and be entertained.
interaction: I am available via email, phone, or tex to answer any questions about the house, spa, TVs, restaurants, lightings, sound system etc.
house_rules: Please no smoking. I would appreciate if you take your shoes off in the house. Please, please shower before using the jacuzzi. It helps the filtering of the water in the jacuzzi immensely. Please be suntan lotion and free of any body oils. Thanks!
host_about: I love life. I really enjoy when guests that stay at my house have a wonderful time. I am a people pleaser. I love beautiful things. I love to travel. I enjoy the finer things in life. And, I am constantly working to make the home more amazing!

name: Ocean View Townhome at Lover's Pt.
summary: Breathtaking panoramic picture postcard views await your arrival! Our home is undoubtedly the most amazing ocean view property on the Monterey Bay and it is centrally located to everything Pacific Grove, Monterey and Carmel have to offer. City of Pacific Grove STR License #0168
space: Walk just one and a half blocks to all of Pacific Grove's great restaurants and shops. View the most amazing underwater sea creatures and wildlife at the world famous Monterey Bay Aquarium less than a mile away in Cannery Row. Take a stroll along the oceanfront recreational trail or soak up the sun on the white sand beach of Lover's Point. There is so much to do and so much to see...and you're right in the center of it all!  Our home has been professionally decorated and features beautiful furniture and accessories. From the Ralph Lauren leather chairs to the granite countertops you will enjoy luxury in every room. The living room has a large LCD flat screen TV for you to enjoy all of your favorite shows. The master bedroom has a new king size mattress. The guest room has a new queen. Both are amazingly comfortable. Each room has a new LCD flat screen TV. Linens and towels as well as a washer and dryer are provided to give you all the comforts of home. Complementary private, gated park

notes: After an accepted reservation, the guest will fill out an information form that includes contact information, vehicle information (for parking purposes), emergency contact and names of others staying in the home. The guest will also review and sign the house rules.
host_about:
We are the typical California family with busy lives that take us in all directions at the same time. When we play, we play hard and try to do it all whenever possible. Our vacation time is no different. We try to experience everything we can during the day and relax at night.

We enjoy Pacific Grove and all the activities that the area has to offer like the Monterey Bay Aquarium, the ocean and beach, Carmel, Big Sur, Santa Cruz, and all the fabulous dinning opportunities. Being a family, variety is important and Monterey Bay provides something for everybody!!

name: Beautiful Villa With Ocean View
summary: Undoubtedly one of Monterey Bay's hidden gems! Our ocean view home has a beautiful view of Lover's Point and is perfectly located near EVERYTHING Pacific Grove, Monterey, Carmel and Pebble Beach has to offer. City of Pacific Grove STR License #0129
space: Our home was professionally remodeled down to the studs in 2006 and kept as a private vacation home. Each room has been professionally decorated with Tommy Bahama furniture and designer selected accessories. It has never been available as a rental until now. It features Brazilian cherry hardwood floors throughout, custom mahogany cabinetry, custom mahogany doors and windows, new window coverings, skylights and old world textures and arches. It won the Preservation Award from the Heritage Society of Pacific Grove for restoration in exemplary fashion and retaining original exterior form and features.  The beautiful gas fireplace welcomes you into the living room and is ready to keep you warm and toasty while you enjoy the view of Lover's Point. A large LCD flat screen TV and all the channels you could ever want to watch are ready to entertain you. The gourmet kitchen has Jenn-Air stainless steel appliances and custom made butcher block counter tops. Tumbled stone tiles accent the walls.

access: For those that enjoy culinary perfection a one block walk will put you in the middle of some of the best dining Monterey Bay has to offer. Pepper's (the best gourmet Mexican food ever - and a local favorite) is literally a block up the street. You'll also find Passionfish (excellent seafood and a favorite of Rachael Ray), Fandango (try their famous rack of lamb and don't miss the Grand Marnier souffle for dessert), Joe Rombi's (for the best Italian around) and a host of other restaurants to wow your taste buds within a stroll. For the adventurous vacationer just walk out the front door and walk, run, bike or skate for miles on the Monterey Bay recreation trail. You can literally enjoy the view while walking to the aquarium, Cannery Row, Fisherman's Wharf and downtown Monterey. The hardcore bicyclists and runners can follow the trail for 18 miles from Pacific Grove all the way to Castroville with access to Seaside and Marina.  Surfers, kayakers, scuba divers and sunbathers can just walk

name: Historic John Steinbeck's Cottage
summary: 'I bought a small house and garden in Pacific Grove...' (John Steinbeck: A Life in Letters).  American author John Steinbeck wrote these words to a friend about this charming house he called home in the 1940s. This cottage was featured in Country Living:  "You'll Never Guess Which Classic American Author's Cottage is For Rent."
space: This quaint and charming home, known as The Steinbeck Cottage, has a beautiful living room with a tent cathedral ceiling. Its focal point is the fireplace, richly adorned with carvings of birds and flowers.  It has a queen sleeper sofa, a love seat, two reading chairs and a flatscreen TV. There is a large bedroom, accommodating a queen bed, a sitting area with a twin sleeper sofa, and a cozy electric fireplace. There is a fully-stocked kitchen with everything you need to cook great meals together. The dining room has a farm table and is surrounded by floor to ceiling picture windows, overlooking the garden and offering peeks of the bay. The beautiful bathroom features white subway tiles in the shower and blue Moroccan lantern tiles on the floor.   The cottage has cable TV, DVD player and wireless internet. The cottage is approximately 900 square feet. It is original architecture from the 1920’s and has short doorways throughout the cottage. Taller guests will need to mind their heads.

There is a fully-stocked kitchen with everything you need to cook great meals together. The dining room has a farm table and is surrounded by floor to ceiling picture windows, overlooking the garden and offering peeks of the bay. The beautiful bathroom fe
neighborhood_overview: The property is in a quiet residential neighborhood in Pacific Grove.  It offers plenty of street parking. As for the city, Pacific Grove has been called “Butterfly Town U.S.A.,” “The Most Romantic City in the U.S.,” “A Dreamy California Destination, ” as well as an idyllic place to get married, to honeymoon or to just hang out. Some of it is self-proclaimed, some the acclaim of people who have actually visited Pacific Grove. You will find Pacific Grove on the very tip of the scenic, tree-shrouded Monterey Peninsula with a rocky coastline and an ambiance of charm, grace and beauty.   Founded in the 1870s as a Methodist summer retreat, Pacific Grove still bears the look and feel of yesteryear.  As you stroll the residential streets admiring the charm of home after home, you will notice little plaques on many of the homes that bear the name of the original owner and the year in which it was built. To qualify for a plaque from the Heritage Society of Pacific Grove, a structure must look l
notes: The cottage is licensed with the city of Pacific Grove (#0145).
transit: The Steinbeck Cottage is centrally located and a short walk from many scenic destinations. It is located a half mile from The Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row, as well as downtown Pacific Grove.  Lover's Point beach is just one mile away and downtown Monterey is two miles away. There are many fantastic restaurants, activities and shops in the area.
access: The front yard offers a dedicated outdoor sitting area.  Guests can also enjoy views of the garden from an outdoor sitting area just right outside the back door.
interaction: While The Steinbeck Cottage is one of the three cottages on the property, it offers plenty of privacy and has its own dedicated outdoor sitting area in the front yard. For larger groups, The Steinbeck Cottage can be rented with the other two cottages on the historic Steinbeck property, The Writer's Studio (https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1325979), and The Traveler's Cottage (https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1003412).
house_rules: The cottage is licensed with the city of Pacific Grove (#0145). The maximum occupancy is 4 people in total, with a maximum of 3 adults.   Please refer to our rental agreement for full details.
host_about:
It’s nice to meet you!  Here’s a little bit about us…

This is Kevin.  I was born in San Francisco, lived in Ireland when I was young, but San Jose has been home for most of my life.  I’m an avid reader, enjoy writing, and I love history.

This is Vicky.  I was born in Vietnam and I immigrated to the US with my family when I was 2 years old.  I work in high-tech, love baking and traveling, and can be found at the gym regularly.

Together, we love exploring new things.  Whether it’s new foods, places to visit or experiences, we love the adventure of life.  Most of all, we love time with each other, our kids, family and friends.  

We chose Pacific Grove because it is a charming town with wonderful restaurants, a beautiful coastline and the historic Cannery Row.  And there’s plenty to do – sailing, whale watching, hiking, kayaking, cycling, and wonderful coastline pathways to stroll between the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Lover’s Point.  Pacific Grove also has the historic literary appeal of being the home of John Steinbeck, American author and Pulitzer Prize winner.

Besides being charming and beautiful, the cottages are distinctly unique having once been the home of author John Steinbeck. There is a rich and wonderful history to these 100-year-old cottages.  When Steinbeck resided here he formulated the plot of The Grapes of Wrath, and wrote several books including The Sea of Cortez.  This is the home he shared with his second wife, Gwyn Conger, who would become the inspiration for the lead antagonist, Kate Trask, in his epic novel, East of Eden.  In a letter to a friend, Steinbeck wrote of the cottages, “It is a pleasant little house, and we miss it… You’ll find you get a lot of thinking done in that house.” ' (from John Steinbeck, A Life in Letters).  

We are excited to share this wonderful piece of history with you and know you will enjoy your stay.

name: Pacific Grove Blue House, Walk to Town and Beach!
summary: Do you want to experience the Monterey Peninsula like a local? Do you need a centrally located home to enjoy the Concours d'Elegance, the AT&T golf tournament, or any of the other special events here? If so, consider staying at the Blue House, where Lover's Point and the Pacific Ocean are right down the street! You'll be close to the aquarium, downtown Monterey, with a short drive to both Big Sur and Carmel.
space: Our cottage is cozy, warm and inviting.  It has an open floor plan that meshes well with the white oak floors.  There are large picture windows with a bench to take advantage of the corner lot.  Our gourmet kitchen is outfitted with modern appliances, a wine fridge and granite countertops.  The bedrooms are of ample size with comfortable furnishings.  There is a queen sized bed which is latex mattress and a full sized bed in the other.  Each room has a sitting area for quiet reading.  Lounge on the sofa and light a fire in the Carmel stone fireplace.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is perfectly situated to allow access to all that the Monterey Peninsula has to offer.  The ocean is very close and is visible down the street; so close that you can hear crashing waves and barking sea lions.  Both downtown Pacific Grove and Lovers Point are just a stroll away.  If you are staying in PG on a Monday, cruise down to Central Avenue.  There you will find a quaint farmers market full of local fresh vegetables, fruit, flowers, fish and more.  Our neighborhood is quiet and residential, and our neighbors are very friendly.  The Blue House is great for relaxing with family and friends.
notes: We are not a hotel, instead we want your experience at the house to be like your home away from home. Our home is 1000 sqft. Please read the entire listing description thoroughly to see if this is the right fit for you! Please note that pricing varies depending on the season, day of the week, and is higher on special events and holidays. Due to allergies, we have a strict no pets policy. **  IMPORTANT: ( starting December 2017) this price quote does not include local Transient Occupancy Tax. The total tax will be added upon booking and charged through Airbnb. ( for the remaining month of November, we will collect TOT in behalf of the city) In order to accept reservations and host guests, the City of Pacific Grove requires that we possess a transient use license.  Airbnb will collect transient occupancy taxes from each of our guests.  This amounts to 10% of the total fee stay. License # 0189. We really enjoy hosting guests from all over the globe and making your visit to our adorable ho
transit: The Blue House is only 3.5 miles west on Highway 68 from Highway 1.  There is abundant, free street parking in our neighborhood, with the spot in front of our house generally available.  No permit is required and there are no short term parking restrictions.  Once here, the best of the Monterey Peninsula can be easily reached via car, bike, or foot.  See our guidebook for suggestions on all the different things to do from your Blue House base.
access: Our home includes bathroom towels, kitchen basics (pots, pans, cooking tools, basic pantry items and spices).  We also accommodate little guests with a high chair, bed rails and a stepping stool if needed (please request in advance).  There is a full size gas barbecue which can be found in the backyard paver stone patio.  For those that like to cook, we have planted a variety of organic herbs in the backyard that are available for your use. We offer basics for the little ones such as a pack and play, high chair, bed rails and a step stool (please ask in advance).  If you need anything else (e.g. crib) we suggest you contact Baby's Away in Monterey.
interaction: We love welcoming visitors to our Blue House!  The extent of our interaction with you is at your discretion.  We have prided ourselves on being easily reached via email, text, phone, or in person.  We will gladly answer questions about the house, give advice on local attractions or restaurants, and try our best to solve any problems that might arise during your stay.
house_rules: - You must be 25 years of age or older to book this home. The person booking this home must be one of the guests during the entire stay.  Check in is at 4 p.m. and check out is at 11 a.m. Our entire property, both inside and out, is strictly nonsmoking.  If there is any evidence of smoking, guests will be held responsible and charged for additional cleaning services. Absolutely NO drugs. During your stay in our beautiful home, you may need to operate the internet, TV, fireplace, furnace, fire pit, or other appliances.  To make their operation as easy as possible and to ensure an enjoyable visit, we have written a detailed house manual.  Prior to their stay, we ask our guests to thoroughly review the manual and confirm with us that they have done so.  For quick reference, a printed copy of the manual is also available at the house. Due to allergies, we have a strict no pets policy.  If there is evidence that animals were on the premises, guests will be held responsible and charged for s
host_about: California couple with "The Blue House," loving life on the central coast.

notes: Weather is really wonderful in this area.  It is like spring all the year around. The temperature varies little from day to night and from summer to winter.  我来自中国,我很希望有机会为祖国的朋友服务。我的家位于太平洋沿岸,这是一个非常美丽的城市,蓝天白云绿水青树海浪沙滩色彩绚丽的花,许许多多数不清的美好造成了这个城市的无比独特,当你来到这里,你会爱上她。我会照顾你的饮食爱好,也会帮助你解决语言上的困难,如果你需要,在我有时间时,也会给你交通上方便,你还可以使用我家的电话免费直拨中国的亲人和朋友。欢迎你,我的朋友们。

No. 2 bus stop is 2-minute walk from our house. You can take a bus tour out to Carmel, Monterey and Big Sur.
access: 1.The guests can use the dining room, living room, and the kitchen. You may relax in the spacious living room and enjoy reading, and leisure activities there. 2. Two free Monterey Bay Aquarium passes are available for guests who book two nights or more, upon request, on first come first serve basis. 3. Free parking on the driveway or street parking in front of the house.  4. We do not provide washer and dryer for the guests because we have to wash sheets and towels etc. from the previous guests. But there is a laundromat 2 minutes driving from our house: The Grove Laundry. Hours: 6am-10pm every day.  5. We offer free, high-speed Wi-Fi connections, giving you easy access to the Internet. We will be very sorry that cell phones of some companies will not have good reception in the surrounding area. 6. We offer hot tea, coffee and bottle water.
interaction: Bill and I are quiet. We will strive to make our guests feel at home. We are experienced Airbnb hosts, and will be happy to converse and interact with our guests to the extent they desire. Please don’t hesitate to tell me what you need, and we will be happy to be of your service.
house_rules: No smoking, pets, drugs or parties, be respectful, and treat it as yours. Please take your shoes off when you enter our house.
host_about: I live in Pacific Grove with my husband, Bill, my step-son, Tom, and my daughter, who has been studying at a university in San Francisco. We love traveling and meeting people of different cultures. After moving to this new house, we decided to host travelers in our home from time to time and share our experience with each other. Please come and visit us! We can not wait to share with you the history and charming scenic spots of Monterey Bay, as well as great hikes, varied local restaurants, featured local galleries, and many other interesting things to do in the area. We are looking forward to helping you enjoy the beauty of the historic Monterey Peninsula and surrounding areas.

name: Modern Beach House, Aquarium passes
summary: You'll fall in love with the quaint town of Pacific Grove where we built our beautiful bungalow located in an upscale quiet neighborhood. Our bungalow is steps away from the beach recreation trail leading to Lovers Pt and Monterey.  2 Aquarium passes
space: You'll fall in love with the quaint town of Pacific Grove where we just built our beautiful beach bungalow located in an upscale quiet neighborhood.   Our beach bungalow is steps away from the recreation trail that leads to Lovers Point beach and nearby restaurants.  Take the trail a little further and you arrive at the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.  The famous 17-mile Drive starts at the next street corner and leads to Asilomar, Pebble Beach, Carmel, Carmel by the Sea, and Carmel Valley. You can park your car at the steps on the right side of the driveway.   The private beach bungalow offers you a brand new beautifully built modern kitchen.  The kitchen is illuminated in the day by a remote operated skylight allowing you to adjust your room lighting.  Should you be interested in visiting the Monterey Bay Aquarium we have two guest passes for you to use during your stay. Bungalow has a Private Key-less Entrance, Full Kitchen, Bathroom/Shower, Bedroom w/ Queen bed, Laundry Room

Our beach bungalow is steps away from the recreation trail that leads to Lovers Point beach and nearby restaurants.  Take the trail a little further and you arrive at the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.  The famous 17-mile Drive starts at the next street corner and leads to Asilomar, Pebble Beach, Carmel, Carmel by the Sea, and Carmel Valley. You can park your car at the steps on the right side of the driveway.   The private beach bungalow offers you a brand new beautifully built modern kitchen. notes: We provide use of a hair dryer located in the cabinet under the sink.  We provide a coffee maker that grinds beans and provide a small supply of Peat's Coffee Beans and filters. name: Bright Beach Cottage, Downtown, Modern, Biz-Ready
summary: Featured in the blog A-Girl-In-LA (about the best California Airbnbs), this light-filled, modern, historic cottage is just steps from Pacific Grove cafes, restaurants, antique and second-hand stores, the local grocery store, and the Monterey Bay. Maple hardwood floors. High ceilings. Features a full kitchen with coffee, toaster, stove, and fridge. Remodeled bath and kitchen.  NOTE: Our city license (#0193) allows us to host up to 5 people, and ONLY 3 of them can be 18 years or older.
space: Our light-filled cottage in P.G.'s historic retreat area is just steps from shops, cafes and restaurants and a five-minute walk from Lover’s Point and the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Built in 1905 and fully remodeled in 2000, the cottage has hardwood and tile floors, maple cabinets, a modern kitchen, skylights, and an  updated bathroom with the original, claw-foot maid’s tub. The wrap-around garden features hydrangea, alstroemeria and poppies. NOTE: We are no longer able to offer free passes to the Aquarium. Our city license #0193 limits us to no more than three adult occupants (age 18 or over) at any one time; guests may park no more than two vehicles on our street.  The Queen-sized bed in the bedroom, which has an ensuite bathroom, sleeps two adults and a baby or small child. The  2 sofabeds in the living room have a twin-sized mattress each. (The loft is for owner's use only.) We provide guests with a password for our WiFi network.There is no television but there are plenty of books, bea

The wrap-around garden features hydrangea, alstroemeria and poppies. NOTE: We are no longer able to offer free passes to the Aquarium. Ou
neighborhood_overview: The City of Pacific Grove was founded as a Methodist retreat and gradually grew into a town with full-time residents, rich in history. In contrast to Monterey, which grew up around the fishing industry, PG was a retreat for city folks looking to escape the cold summers of San Francisco. Small town full of quaint Victorian architecture and cottages like ours built on lots originally sold as sites for camping tents. Next door, Asilomar Park and Conference Center designed by famed architect Julia Morgan, began as a retreat for the YWCA (Young Women’s Christian Association). The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continually operating lighthouse in the state of California.
notes: You're surrounded by great natural beauty. You can walk, run, or bike along the beach.There’s also a beautifully manicured 9-hole public golf course for those who seek a quieter workout.  This is where John Steinbeck lived and earned his reputation as a writer of such novels as Grapes of Wrath, Cannery Row, and East of Eden. We clean the cottage thoroughly after each guest and use mattress and pillow protectors for your health and safety.
transit: Walk everywhere. Ride bikes. Run.  Roller skate.  Take the free shuttle to the Aquarium. Or see the sights in your car.  Your choice.
access: We provide guests with a password for our WiFi network so you can stream movies on your laptop. There is no television but there are plenty of beaches, tide pools and otters along the shore and jellyfish as the Monterey Bay Aquarium to keep you busy. The loft is for owner's use only; disregarding this rule would jeopardize our STR license with the City of Pacific Grove.
interaction: We're eager to make sure you're comfortable and settled in. We are happy to answer questions about the little house, the friendly neighborhood, parking and public transportation. Tell us what you're looking for, and we'll make appropriate recommendations for restaurants, cafes, shops, golf courses, and museums, and how to reach them. We’re on a quiet one-way street. Please close car doors softly at night and be sure not to block our neighbors' driveways.  The local shuttle runs along Lighthouse all the way to the Aquarium.
house_rules: The city permits us to have no more than three adults (anyone age 18 or over) staying at any one time; guests may park no more than two vehicles on our street. Under no circumstances should you enter the loft; it is for our private use only. Do not remove anything from the loft. Ignoring this rule puts our STR license in jeoparty with the City of Pacific Grove. You’ll find our neighbors respectful of your privacy as we know you’ll be respectful of theirs. These little cottages are close to one another, so please be mindful of the noise you’re making. It's also the reason we don't allow smoking inside or near the cottage. We ask guests to make sure that the front door is securely locked when you go in and out. When your visit is over, we ask that you return the keys safely to the lock boxes.  There’s enough room for a family of 5. The Queen-sized bed in the bedroom, which has an ensuite bathroom, sleeps two adults and a baby or small child. The deep sofas in the living room can accommod
host_about: We're happiest at home, which we share with two loving pups (Coco and Ubu). We've lived abroad in Italy, France, Haiti and India. We speak several languages and love meeting others whose adventures have taken them far and wide. The tastes of different cultures speak to us as does the unspoken bond all global travelers feel when they discover common ground around the world. We love our neighborhood and stay involved in our community so we're current on where to sip a great latte, get a bite to eat, shop for wine or shoes, create art, rent bikes, and learn a little bit of local history.

name: Lovely House in Pacific Grove (License # 0194)
summary: This lovely remodeled home has 3 bedrooms and den, 2 bath, an office and one car garage.  The driveway can fit additional 3 or more cars. It has a secluded outdoor living space with a gas grill.  The house can easily accommodate 7 adults comfortably. Centrally located and it is 1 block from the Pebble Beach country club gate entrance and about 1 mile from the Aquarium, Cannery Row, Lover's Point, and downtown PG.
space: Welcome! Beautifully remodeled home located in the heart of Pacific Grove in Del Monte Forest.  Steps to Pebble Beach entrance, walk to Spanish Bay, a miles from the Monterey Bay Aquarium, lots of natural light, fully furnished, fully stocked kitchen, a small office, living room with fireplace, a lovely and secluded outdoor living space with a gas BBQ, and plenty of parking spaces on the premises. The master bedroom has its private bath while the other 2 rooms will share a bathroom.  Each room can accommodate 2 guests.  The master and one room are furnished with queen beds while the other room has a queen futon with a very comfortable 8" memory foam mattress. There is also a queen size pull-out sofa bed in the TV room which can accommodate more guests.

The master bedroom has its private bath while the other 2 rooms will share a bathroom.  Each room can accommodate 2 guests.  The master and one room are furnished with queen beds whi
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the small-town charm of Pacific Grove as you explore the many shops and restaurants of this Central Coast town. With the world famous 17 miles drive and Pebble Beach as your back drop, you can experience why some have called this region as the  paradise on earth. There are endless things to do such as biking or hiking through the beautiful trails along the beach; kayaking, snorkeling, or scuba diving in the Monterey Bay. Don't forget to discover the dramatic exhibits at the Monterey Bay Aquarium or historic Cannery Row. Another great area attraction for fine dining and souvenirs is the Monterey Fisherman’s Wharf where some of the country’s best seafood and clam chowder are served.
notes: City Tax: The city of Pacific Grove charges 10% Transient Tax. (license # 0194). Other Spots to Visit: Don't forget to visit McWay Falls if you have the time. You will not forget the view.  It is about 40 miles south of here.  McWay Falls is an 80-foot waterfall located in Julia Pfeiffer Burns State Park that flows year-round. This waterfall is one of only two in the region that are close enough to the ocean to be referred to as "tidefalls", the other being Alamere Falls. It is one of the few waterfalls that empties directly into the ocean.
transit: There is a local bus system that you can use. You can catch the bus in front of the house. Hiking trails to Spanish Bay and entry to the world famous 17 Miles Drive in Pebble Beach is only one block away.  Of course, lovely biking trails run along the beach for miles leading to Cannery Row, the Monterey Bay Aquarium and as far as Castroville.  Pacific Grove downtown is about a mile away. You can also take advantage of the FREE Trolley operates on a daily basis from Memorial Day Weekend through Labor Day. The route serves Downtown Monterey, Fisherman's Wharf, Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Look for the green MST Trolley signs to board along the route.
access: Guests will have access to entire house, kitchen, garage, and the peaceful backyard.  A fully equipped kitchen, dining room, office, and a living room with a fireplace and ultra high definition Internet ready TV. The house has high speed Wi-fi and cable TV with HBO, Amazon Prime free movies. Bathrooms will have all the necessary supplies for you to enjoy your stay. Backyard is a secluded area with many seatings and a gas BBQ grill. Garage: we have a one car garage that you can use to store your bicycles, golf clubs, surfboard or extra stuff.
interaction: We will strive to welcome you as guests and leave you as friends.  We are available via phone, email, or text anytime.
house_rules: Please no smoking, no pets, no drugs, and no wild parties. Only registered guests are allowed in the house.  Non-registered guests are subjected to immediate cancellation without refund.  Exterior premises are under video surveillance and any violations of the house rules may be subjected to immediate termination of the rental agreement and removal from the premises without refund. Strictly Enforced Quiet hours from 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM!!! Pacific Grove (PG) is a very quiet bedroom community, with city quiet hours noise curfew strictly enforced. After 10 PM, the neighborhood is pretty much silent. It is part of the charm of this neighborhood. When entering or leaving the property at night, please be as quiet as possible. We have installed dual pane windows to help contain the noise. To maintain your privacy and minimize disturbance to neighbors, please close the windows and keep volumes to a bare minimal during quiet hours. No wild parties, loud music, or loud TV please. Most of our gue
host_about:
I am an engineer working in the Silicon Valley.  My wife and I have been married for over 30 years.  We enjoy biking, hiking, skiing, and traveling all over.  We love the Monterey and Pacific Grove area ever since we took our two kids on a bike trailer going through 17 miles drive when they were just babies.  We bought this house in Pacific Grove and we like to share this beautiful area with other folks from all over the world. 

Our motto in life is:  work hard and play even harder.

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a beautiful small beach town with a relaxed atmosphere. There are plenty of beach access and scenic hiking/biking trails from our home.  The house is on 17 Mile Drive and backs to a little alley road that runs along a gorgeous, wooded park.  If you visit us during the months of October through February, you can witness the magic of the Monarch butterfly migration. The Monarch Sanctuary is just around the corner!  Asilomar State Beach and Conference Center, beach trails, PG Golf Links, Point Pinos Lighthouse, Lover's Point, Pacific Grove Natural History Museum, fine restaurants, and Downtown are all within walking distance.  The golf Links at Spanish Bay & PG Links, Pebble Beach, Carmel River State Beach, Carmel Mission, Monterey Bay Aquarium, and Fisherman's Wharf are all a very short drive away. Take a ten minute drive south to Carmel's white sand beaches, where you can enjoy a picnic and bonfire until midnight. Enjoy the downtown, or play a round of golf at Pebble Be
notes: •If you are arriving after dark, please note that the house is in a forested neighborhood and some street signs are hard to see at night. So please map out the route for your convenience.  •The house is on the famous 17 Mile Drive, so expect some tourist traffic during the day. The back street (almost an alley) is quiet.  •Pacific Grove Ball Park is 500 ft away. Kids games are sometimes on weekends and you could hear some cheering voices from the garden.  •The front entry has six steps and the back entry has four. •The lot has ranch style fencing and is open to the streets from the front and back. Please supervise your young children if they are out in the garden. •Refrigerator tends to fill up with good food left behind by other guests. So I recommend checking the refrigerator before going shopping.  •Deer roam around in the property and in the neighborhood. Please drive slow coming down the back street as they like to visit our yard. Please do not feed them. •Switchable night lights
transit: It is a short walk or drive to almost all the attractions in the Monterey peninsula. We are also on the 1 Asilomar-Monterey bus route (bus stops less than 100 feet away -on both directions) It will take you to Fisherman's Wharf, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Downtown Pacific Grove, Point Pinos, Light House, Pacific Grove Golf Course, Asilomar Beach and Conference Center, Senior Center, and Lovers Point.  The bus connects to Monterey Transit Plaza (MTP) where you can connect to other transportation systems that would take you south to Los Angles or North to San Francisco. Check out MST - Monterey Salinas Transit) at: (website hidden) 150 Del Monte Ave, Monterey, CA  - (phone number hidden) Monterey Bay Aquarium, Cannery Row, Monterey are all easily accessible.
access: YOU HAVE ACCESS TO THE ENTIRE HOME: • The house accommodates FIVE (5) MAXIMUM NUMBER OF GUESTS.  •AQUARIUM TICKETS: Please inquire •Kitchen items (cooking utensils, toaster, microwave, coffee girder, blender, slow-cooker, pots, pans, basic pantry items and spices). •Breakfast: dry cereal, butter, jelly, pancake mix, tea, coffee, creamer available for breakfast. Refrigerator tends to fill up with good food left behind by other guests. So I recommend checking the refrigerator before going shopping. You can put together what you like in our kitchen. interaction: •We would like to be helpful, but not intrusive. Please take care of it as your own.

The back street (almost an alley) is quiet.  •After visiting the beach, please clean up before you enter the house to protect the hardwood flooring.  A hose and a broom are provided by the back entry.  •Please ask if you want to use the fireplace or charcoal BBQ.  •Inquire about the Monterrey Bay Aquarium ticket options if you are interested •The house accommodates kids -
host_about: My husband and I love to travel like locals and meet new people. Staying at Bed and Breakfasts has made this experience possible.  We are excited and feel fortunate to offer our own home in Pacific Grove for others to enjoy.

name: The Little Blue House
summary: Quaint 105+ year old house on a quiet one way street just a short block to downtown Pacific Grove.  Beautiful stained glass windows, wood floor and fenced-in backyard.  One bedroom/one bathroom; permit allows only 3 adults (and unlimited children)  TUL permit #0187
space: Beautiful old Victorian cottage on quiet one way street.  One bedroom, one bathroom. The bathroom is off the bedroom so if people are sleeping in the living room on the sofa bed, they would have to enter the bedroom to get to the bathroom. Lovely stained glass windows in each room.  Living room has queen sofa bed and bedroom has queen bed. Kitchen has bistro/bar table and chairs.  The house is so close to cafes/restaurants and Library along with Natural History Museum, you may never use your car once here. One mile to the Aquarium along beautiful coast bike path.

neighborhood_overview: Very quiet neighborhood of quaint houses located around the cottage.   Please be thoughtful with the neighbors-- some of them are my best of friends.
notes: Parking is on 18th Street (don't block driveways please) with extra parking on Laurel. It is over 105 years old and is not modernized in any way.  City permit #0187 (this is not a concern for guests but is a city requirement).
transit: Public transit is close by at Grand and Pine.  Famed bike/pedestrian recreational trail is at the north end of the street at the beach along with kayak and bike rentals at Lovers Point.  Restaurants, coffee shops and grocery store within a two-five minute walk. Aquarium is a beautiful 1 mile walk along a rugged coastline where you can see sea lions pupping.
access: You have access to whole cottage.  It is only used as an airbnb rental. Full kitchen with coffee maker.  Bathroom has a very small shower stall so if you are large or very tall it will be uncomfortable (no bathtub).  Private fenced-in backyard. No micro-wave, no TV
interaction: It is up to the guests how much contact they would like.  Host lives just 2 blocks from the cottage.
house_rules: Please keep it quiet outside after 9 pm.  No smoking. No pets except for WORKING service dogs. No parties  Do not park in front of or block any of the small driveways of my neighbors.  You will be ticketed or towed. Quiet outside after 9 pm as neighbors live close and are very nice.  No smoking and no garbage/food down any drain. I am very firm on the NO PETS rule except for certified service dogs. I've learned my lesson the hard way and I don't mess with the universe when it tries to tell me something. This is not a party house or a place for loud gatherings.
host_about: Local artist who also works as an occupational therapist specializing in pain management.  I have not owned a car since 2009, and sail/kayak in the Monterey Bay if I'm not on one of my amazing bikes.  I live just up the street in a 110 year old Victorian where my children grew up into better adults than I am, both of whom are Junior Olympians in volleyball.  Sometimes I love sitting in the Art House or The LIttle Blue House more than my own -- peaceful and serene doesn't do it justice....

name: Walk to Aquarium,Cannery Row,Rest
summary: Our home is located up the hill on David Ave...a short 5 minute walk to the Aquarium and Cannery Row.  The home has been remodeled/upgraded. Pet friendly on a case by case basis.
space: Remodel/Upgrade 2015.  This woodsy home is on a lot with another 2 bedroom/2 bathroom cottage (Casa Amarilla), which is also available for 30 day minimum stay. For multiple family/larger or corporate groups accommodations, both homes are available to rent for the same time period. The home is approximately 1,800 square feet, 3 large bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms (1 bathroom in master suite with tub), living room, dining area, fully equipped kitchen, fireplace, and a fenced private flagstone patio/deck area, with partial views of the Monterey Bay, and forced air heating.  Duel pane windows/doors...well insulated and quiet.   Wood flooring throughout.  Vaulted ceilings, several skylights, recessed lighting, mirrored wardrobe doors, Wifi internet, basic cable.  Private paved alley entrance, with room to park 2 vehicles...additional unrestricted street parking as well. The alley is nice for morning/evening walks with friends, family, and dogs. King size bed in the master suite, queen size bed
description: Our home is located up the hill on David Ave...a short 5 minute walk to the Aquarium and Cannery Row.  The home has been remodeled/upgraded. Pet friendly on a case by case basis. Remodel/Upgrade 2015.  This woodsy home is on a lot with another 2 bedroom/2 bathroom cottage (Casa Amarilla), which is also available for 30 day minimum stay. For multiple family/larger or corporate groups accommodations, both homes are available to rent for the same time period. The home is approximately 1,800 square feet, 3 large bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms (1 bathroom in master suite with tub), living room, dining area, fully equipped kitchen, fireplace, and a fenced private flagstone patio/deck area, with partial views of the Monterey Bay, and forced air heating.  Duel pane windows/doors...well insulated and quiet.   Wood flooring throughout.  Vaulted ceilings, several skylights, recessed lighting, mirrored wardrobe doors, Wifi internet, basic cable.  Private paved alley entrance, with room to park 2 vehic
neighborhood_overview: Traditional Montery neighborhood...character, butterflies & Cypress trees.  Get out and walk the 1st State Capital of California.  Abundant Marine creatures. Something going on most every weekend. Car buffs galore.
house_rules: Absolutely no smoking inside our home. Be considerate of the neighbors.  No all night parties!
host_about:
Over the years, I have been fortunate to have rubbed elbows with some of the most talented people in the Hospitality and Real Estate professions.  Little did I know these mentors would prepare me for my Vacation Rental venture this year.

I've also discovered my inner gift for interior decorating.  Casa Amarilla has been a labor-of-love restoring and modernizing this quaint Monterey Cottage...a stone throw from the Aquarium.

My green thumb came back to life as well.  The patio and fenced garden area has blossomed this spring, and soothes one's sole at the end of an active day.  A wood burning pot belly fire-pit and charcoal BBQ enhance this spacious artistic zen-like garden, while taking in the distant Monterey Bay view...our guests favorite!

While staying at Casa Amarilla, don't hesitate to call or text me if you and your group need anything at all!

Sincerely,
Guita

name: Quiet Ocean view Cottage Lic.#0201
summary: Just steps to water!Beautiful ocean views from 3 bed & 2 bath 1900 sf recently remodeled charmer,next to deer habitat park. Highly desirable quiet location! Walk to Lovers Point & downtown. 2 serene gardens & lg yard. 2 every day Aquarium passes!
space: Birds love to visit! Such a desirable location just steps from the water with gorgeous ocean views & in good walking location to town!  Built in 1925 our home has an adorable cottage look, newly remodeled including kitchen & baths in keeping with its quaint charm.  Granite counters, upscale stainless appliances, kitchen bar, and dining table for 6.  The downstairs bath with bead board wainscoting features a lovely over sized pedestal tub with old school polished nickel fixture.  There are two darling downstairs bedrooms one with an ocean view and one with a garden view.  The living room has ocean and park views, a wood burning fireplace, and a 60 inch TV.  Also, downstairs is an office.  The upstairs master is quite large with 9 windows to view the bay from your remote control tilt up bed, or from two comfy chairs, a window seat, or from the dining table perfect for special morning breakfast or romantic dinners.  A 42 inch TV screen and the large master bath complete the master experie

Also, downstairs is an office.  The upstairs master is quite large with 9 windows to vie
neighborhood_overview: It is so peaceful and quiet.  Since we are not downtown, our lots are larger than most and being next to the park we have even more visual space.  The deer are part of our neighborhood, as well as many species of birds.  We love the changing sea and weather.  At times the bay is still and glassy, other times the surf is up and we can see surfers from our home.  We love to sit on our patio and watch and hear the surf, yet, we are just a few steps to the water and we sometimes sit on a bench by the water, and watch the sea otters play.  We have seen whales and dolphins from our home and it is quite thrilling.   We love our location as it is an easy walk to Lovers Point, downtown PG, the Aquarium, and Monterey Cannery Row.  We couldn’t have asked for a more perfect location.  We are a short drive to Old Town Monterey, the Wharfs, Pebble Beach, and Carmel.  I am a realtor and we moved to Pacific Grove in 2000 and drove all around and we both said wouldn't it be nice if this cute home becam
notes: Please note all Pacific Grove listing locations are not equal.  Downtown listings are almost always smaller lots, close together and parking can be an issue. Areas up the hill (past Lighthouse) begin to ascend and walking up hill are for the energetic.  We are in the beach track area which is a preferred area of Pacific Grove.  Close to the water and close to the golf course.  We can see and hear the white water waves.  We are not on Ocean view, which has traffic and pedestrian traffic, but the 2nd house from Ocean View making our location quiet.  Plus we are next to the Esplanade Natural Park.  Prime location.  We have only rented our entire home for special occasions and each time we have received a lovely review.  We live here on a full time basis so our home is not minimally supplied.   Two of the bedrooms do not have any personal items in them and the master is cleared out quite sufficiently for guests space.  There will be some personal items left discretely in the house.  The ga
transit: Plenty of parking all the time by our home as we are not in a congested area.  In the summer months there is a free trolly that goes by on Ocean View. Public bus stop is about 2 blocks away on Del Monte Avenue
access: After confirmation, we will give instructions for the combo key box.  All parts of the home are available to you except the garage.
interaction: We always try to greet our guests in person, however, if we are out of town, will be just an email or text away.  We send a complete document prior to your arrival via email  of all the information you might need to make yourself comfortable in our home.
house_rules: Like you would treat something of value to you. The yard and patios are fenced. Please no smoking in the house, no pets, always mindful to close the gates or the deer will demolish the gardens. We are open to early check-in and late check out discussions at time of booking.  Thank you for your consideration towards a home we love!
host_about: We love to hike, walk along the water, wine & dine, and have friends to our home.  We have been running a bed and breakfast for our friends every since we moved to Pacific Grove, just not for profit! Ha ha.  People love to come to our area and our home, and we love it too!  We have traveled all over Europe several times and love Southern Germany & the Alps.  Especially hiking there, the people and the friendliness.  We do say thought that the hardest thing about living where we do is "Where do you go for vacation?"  We just like it here so much. We are California natives so can tell you much about all of Cali.  I love to plan itinneraries for our friends and guest especially day trips to Big Sur.

name: Peaceful in Pacific Grove. Close to beach & town
space: If you want a peaceful place to sleep, this is it! The private room is located on the other side of the house behind the kitchen with private entrance through the garage.  A small hallway separates the kitchen and bedroom.  There is a Sealy Posturepedic Pillow Top queen bed on one side of the bedroom while the other side has a small cafe table and sitting area with windows looking on to a beautiful redwood tree. ( I love it because I don't have to shut the curtains for privacy unless I want to; the redwood tree stands guard.)   There are two dressers , two closets, one with shelving, and another closet for hanging cloths. A full length mirror hangs on the back of the door and there is a large mirror on the dresser as well. There is also a flat screen TV and two directors chairs. PLEASE NOTE: Your bathroom is PRIVATE but you will need to WALK THROUGH THE HOUSE to access it.  It has a full bath (bathtub with shower). Towels, soap, lotions and shampoo are provided.

Towels, soap, lotions and shampoo are provided. You have access to yo
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighborhood for walking.  It is a 5-minute walk to town which is  four blocks from  Lover's Point beach. The town is small, charming and offers a variety  of restaurants to choose from.  There is a health food store in town and a local farmer's market on Monday, plus another street fair farmer's market in Monterey on Tuesday. We have beautiful walking/biking trails around the ocean that lead to Asilomar State Beach (the Conference Grounds are an 10- minute walk right down my street), 17 mile Drive in Pebble Beach, Lover's Point beach and Fisherman's Wharf.  The Aquarium is nearby so you can walk or drive (less than a 5-minute drive ).   The local golf links are 1 mile away,   Downtown Monterey is 3 miles away, or a 20-30 minute walk from the house. Carmel is a 10-minute drive and if you have time, the 40-minute drive to Big Sur is a must! The coastline is absolutely stunning!
notes: I have two small DOGS who are friendly. Petal is a little shy in the beginning and may bark at first. Tiger Lily smiles and wags her tail at all times. They love people. So...if you don't LOVE dogs, you probably shouldn't book this room. I am an early riser and usually leave to exercise for a few hours in the morning (or I leave early for work {7am} once summer is over). If I leave the dogs behind, which I rarely do, then all doors and gates leading to the outside need to be shut. I care about the environment and I'm hoping you do too. While I truly want you to enjoy your stay,  I encourage you to reduce, reuse and recycle.  We are experiencing a major drought, so please be conscious of water use!
transit: Cabs, Uber and the Monterey Transit Bus Line are readily available. There is a bus stop 2 blocks from the house.
access: You have access to your private room and your own private bathroom. Of course, you will have access to the areas that lead to there as  well.
interaction: I am a friendly, easy going person. I would be happy to answer questions, share  suggestions  and/or give directions should the need arise when I am around.   There are so many beautiful places to walk, hike, bike, kayak, whale watch, plus a variety of restaurants, local shops, and galleries to visit.  If you prefer your privacy and do not want to interact I respect that too. If you are looking for a no-interaction stay, this is probably not the best fit because you will need to go through the house to access the bathroom.
house_rules: The basics: -Please be respectful, mindful and responsible so that everyone can relax and enjoy the experience. - NO SMOKING ON  or NEAR the premises.  - Quiet time: 10:30 pm
host_about:
I am a native of Pacific Grove. I love the beauty of the area and belonging to a community. The intertwining of nature and community gives me a  strong sense of place and a feeling of contentment. 

I am an easy going, warm, friendly person who appreciates the simple things in life: a morning walk to the beach, sipping a fresh, strong cup of hot coffee, good conversation, meeting new people, listening to  NPR radio, watching the sun go down, peace and quiet, candlelight, a good fire, the company of dogs, eating clean, whole food.  

 I especially enjoy traveling, being in nature, running, hiking, reading, laughing, learning, listening to live music, helping others and sitting down to share a meal  with family and friends.  

I work as a middle school science and ecoliteracy teacher.  I value the relationships I build with my students and my colleagues. I get excited when I'm helping students learn about the natural world and how to better take care of our planet.

I always look forward to meeting people from around the globe. My aim is to provide travelers with a clean and comfortable, casual,  environment.  When I travel, I so appreciate meeting the local people and gaining a local's perspective on where to go or where NOT go!  It's a real gift when that happens. I am  happy and open to offer up any tips, suggestions, directions, etc., from a local's perspective to help enhance your journey. Or...leave you to your privacy. Whatever works for you!

space: The cottage includes a bright and cheery floor plan that includes beautiful hardwood floors throughout the living room with a partial ocean view, dining room, kitchen and entertainment room that opens into the backyard patio area.  There are 2 bedrooms and 1 bath with 1 queen size bed and 2 twin size beds. The bathroom awaits you with a bathtub and tile floors.
description: Get ready for relaxation and tranquility in this cozy beach cottage situated two blocks away from the Pacific Ocean in the beach tract area of Pacific Grove. Nature awaits you! Newly remodeled with the latest amenities + 2 free aquarium passes. The cottage includes a bright and cheery floor plan that includes beautiful hardwood floors throughout the living room with a partial ocean view, dining room, kitchen and entertainment room that opens into the backyard patio area.  There are 2 bedrooms and 1 bath with 1 queen size bed and 2 twin size beds. The bathroom awaits you with a bathtub and tile floors. Full kitchen with use of refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, gas range/oven and coffee maker. In addition, there is a washer and dryer provided as courtesy in the garage for your convenience.  Free Wi-Fi is available as well as TV. There is no phone service. We will provide you with our telephone number and email address so you can reach us for any questions you may have. We will also
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is family friendly and very peaceful and quiet. Many residents are long time homeowners who respect their surroundings and nature.  Sunsets, Monarch butterflies, whale watching, sea otters, marine life, golfing, scuba diving, cycling, walking, relaxing and shopping are all within your reach.
transit: There is a public shuttle stop across the street from the house. Walking and cycling are other ways that you can enjoy the surroundings.  You are less than a mile away from charming downtown Pacific Grove and two blocks away from the ocean (0.16 miles walking distance). You are two streets from 17 Mile Dr. and you can walk to either the Pacific Grove Golf Links course or Lover's Point in 12-15 minutes (0.6-0.7 miles).  Cannery Row and The Monterey Bay Aquarium are only 1.9 miles away or a 35-40 minute walk.  The house has parking space for one car in the driveway and free street parking.
access: Full kitchen with use of refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, gas range/oven and coffee maker. In addition, there is a washer and dryer provided as courtesy in the garage for your convenience.  Free Wi-Fi is available as well as TV. There is no phone service.
interaction: We will provide you with our telephone number and email address so you can reach us for any questions you may have. We will also to send you an email  with a checklist of checkin and checkout,  info of the local and the personalized access code to open the front door a couple weeks prior to your arrival.
house_rules: Our rules are simple.  Leave the place the way you found it. Respect your surroundings and your neighbors. Respect nature and the environment.   California is in extreme drought, please save water when you can !!! We DO NOT allow pets or smoking on the property. Please respect that.
host_about: My husband and I are both IT professionals. I love interior design and gardening and my husband loves music and sports.

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove, nestled between Monterey and Pebble Beach exudes nostalgia of a by-gone era! Deemed one of America's last small towns, also is known as “Butterfly town USA' due to the thousands of Monarch butterfly's that winter here! This luxury executive penthouse suite will impress even the most discriminating of guests.
notes: ***PLEASE READ IMPORTANT DETAILS BELOW**** **Please read for pricing and minimum nightly stays: 4 Day/3 night minimum rental. **All major holidays and events we require a minimum of 6 nights rental (full week rental) City of Pacific Grove License No. #0041
transit: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a wealth of options abound including numerous championship golf courses, whale watching, the famous Monterey Bay Aquarium, hiking, kayaking, surfing, scuba diving, boating, bicycling, viewing Monarch butterflies at the famous free Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, fishing, wine tasting, gallery touring, shopping, fine dining, live theater and museums to name a few!
access: This exquisite property is comprised of two individual suites. A two bedroom suite and a one bedroom suite They are conveniently located in the heart of Pacific Grove and each suite includes sweeping bay views and access to a full length balcony. Each suite includes a fully equipped gourmet kitchen boasting state of the art gadgets and stainless steel appliances including gas range and custom granite counters. Both living rooms offer plenty of comfortable seating, a large flat screen TV and picture windows capturing the incredible ocean views. Off the living rooms there are French doors that open to a wrap around balcony with a gas grill and outdoor dining tables and chairs playing center stage to gorgeous sweeping views of the Monterey Bay! OUTDOORS: The balcony features a gas BBQ, a large seating area and dining tables with chairs overlooking the panoramic vistas of the Monterey Bay. For your off-site excursions, a picnic basket and collapsible ice chest are provided.
