Easy access to Aquarium, Pebble Beach, Carmel, Big Sur. Perfect retreat for couples or small families.  PLEASE NOTE: Limit of 3 adults (per license). City-wide Quiet Hours from 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM strictly enforced. This property is not a good fit for Night Owls -- the neighborhood is very quiet at night.  License # 202.
space: This bright and airy house has one spacious bedroom with ample storage space and a queen-size bed.  A Crate and Barrel queen-size full support (like a regular bed) sofa-bed in the living room that can easily accommodate 2 people.  A well-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite counter top if you prefer to make a gourmet meal for you and your loved ones.  (A gas grill is perfect for Bar-B-Que in the backyard.) Bathroom with soaking tub/shower.  ROKU 4 with Netflix, Hulu, CNN, PBS, etc. for Movies and TV Shows; 40" HighDef LCD TV; High-speed Wi-Fi internet access; and a small collection of books and DVDs/BluRays are available for your enjoyment.    Wake up in the morning, take in the fresh seaside air, sip your coffee and enjoy freshly-made bread from the local bakery.  Pack your lunch, walk to the beach, and visit the Aquarium and Cannery Row via the beautiful coastal trail from Pacific Grove to Monterey.  Take a day trip, drive through scenic 17 Miles. neighborhood_overview: Guests have access to all that Pacific Grove has to offer.  Close to downtown, coffee shops, restaurants, bakery, grocery store, ice cream shop, library, churches, etc.  Lovers Point Beach is just a few short blocks away.  Take a stroll or bike ride along the oceanfront trail to the Monterey Aquarium and Cannery Row (1.5 miles).  Walk to the museum and browse through the Farmers' market on Mondays.  Monterey, Pebble Beach, and Carmel are  within 10 minutes drive away.
notes: This house is in a historic neighborhood that was part of the Methodist Tent Retreat. Most houses here are close together.  After 10 PM, the neighborhood is pretty much silent.  It is part of the charm of this neighborhood. We have  truly wonderful neighbors with whom we have great relationships with and want to be good neighbors in return.  City of Pacific Grove Transient Use License #0202.
transit: The house is within walking distance to pretty much everything in PG.  It is one block from Lighthouse Avenue, which is the main street in downtown Pacific Grove.  Lovers Point is about 8 minutes away by walking.   If you prefer to use public transportation, the bus stop (Route #1) is located on the corner of Lighthouse Ave and Granite Street, which is 1 block away.  It will take you to Monterey Bay Aquarium, Fisherman's Wharf, Pacific Grove Golf Course, Point Pinto Lighthouse, and Asilomar Beach.   There are plenty of on street parking in front of the property, since our house is located in a very quiet residential neighborhood.
access: Entire House.
interaction: Always glad to answer questions, make recommendations, or address your needs through e-mail, phone calls, and texting.
house_rules: When entering or leaving the property at night or early morning, please be as quiet as possible.   City of Pacific Grove (PG) strictly enforces Quiet Hours noise curfew from 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM!   During Quiet Hours, please close all windows on the Sofa side of the house, including the bathroom to reduce noise to our neighbors. No parties or loud music ANYTIME.   No smoking inside property.    No pets.    Only toilet paper in toilet.
host_about: Hi, We are an Engineer and a School Teacher in the San Francisco Bay Area.  We love the Beach and the entire Monterey Bay Area -- especially Pacific Grove!  We are laid back people.  We enjoy travelling and meeting people from all over the world -- and sampling  the foods.  I like biking, swimming, hiking, Kayaking, tennis, and long walks along the spectacular Monterey coast.

name: Little Lighthouse — Ocean views & close to town!
summary: Little Lighthouse Cottage — Ocean views, on the main street of downtown Pacific Grove, newly renovated & ready to call home for your next beach vacation. Two blocks from the ocean and a short stroll to town, Lover's Point and the famous Cannery Row.
space: This darling cottage, known as Little Lighthouse, is the lower cottage in a two-unit, WWII-era Carriage House. She has stood through over seventy years of history, and gathered stories in her rooms of love, friends and family. After months of renovation, this lower cottage, Little Lighthouse, is ready for rent. It sits in the beautiful retreat neighborhood of Pacific Grove.  The quaint downtown of Pacific Grove is just a six minute stroll down the street to the right as you exit the front door. A less than 15-minute walk in the other direction takes you to historic Cannery Row and The Monterey Bay Aquarium.  Under the canopy of a stately old cypress tree, she is a resting place of tranquility, cool breezes, and is ready to embrace a host of new memories.  As you walk through the garden and into the front door, you are greeted by a cottage filled with warmth and charm. The beautiful living room is filled with cozy places to relax. There is a queen sleeper sofa, two conversation chairs,

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove offers an unparalleled quality of life. Sharing borders with the Monterey Bay, City of Monterey, Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, our town offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. We are known for our small-town hospitality and friendliness in a place we simply call 'P.G.' (from The City of Pacific Grove website)
notes: The city of Pacific Grove is very strict about occupancy and limiting guest activity while renting a short term rental. Under no circumstances could a party, get together or gathering be hosted at the cottage during the rental period. ~This property is a short-term vacation rental, licensed through the City of Pacific Grove, Lic. # 0208. All short term rental rules apply and maximum occupancy is strictly enforced ~The maximum occupancy is three adults and four people total. ~The cottage has a firm no pet policy ~The cottage has a firm no smoking/vaping policy.
transit: The location has something to offer everyone—As stated earlier, the quaint downtown of Pacific Grove is just a six minute stroll down the street to the right as you exit the front door.  A less than 15-minute walk in the other direction takes you to historic Cannery Row and The Monterey Bay Aquarium. Historic downtown Monterey and Fisherman's Wharf offer a peak into the past and several dining options. The beautiful beach and the Monterey Coastal Trail are two blocks down the hill from the cottage. Hikers, runners, and bikers can enjoy miles of trails that lead to Asilomar State Beach, Carmel, the Big Sur coastline, and beyond.
access: Guests of Lighthouse Cottage will access the house through a keyless entry system. You will be given a guest door code, specific to your rental dates, that will be used by all guests in your group during your stay. This allows for added safety and piece of mind. There is no need to carry a key or be worried of getting locked out.
interaction: While we do not live on the premises, guests can reach our family with any questions throughout their stay, by simply calling or texting any one of us. A detailed contact list is located in the cottage.

We bought a darling carriage house together in 2014 and have poured all our love and care into renovating it—to create a special retreat not only for our family, but for yours. name: Three Seas Cottage  Aquarium Tickets! (Lic#0236)
summary: We are license #0236 with the City of Pacific Grove!  Our three bedroom, two bath home with a view of the Pacific is blocks from 17 Mile Drive Country Club Gate.  It sleeps 6 and has a full kitchen and outside deck for your enjoyment!
space: We are so comfortable in our home, and as our guests we want you to be too!  There is one central living room off the kitchen with a couch that makes into a queen sofa bed.  The kitchen is fully functioning with everything you need to cook for your family.  There are 3 bedrooms, one  with a french door going out to our fabulous redwood deck with views of the Pacific!  All bedrooms have queen beds.  Two full bathrooms  are a luxury in a little cottage!  Our license from the City of Pacific Grove is #0236.  We also provide 2 guest passes to the Monterey Bay Aquarium.

All bed linens and towels are provided, along with beach towels and chairs in the garage.  Free coffee and WiF
neighborhood_overview: Our quiet neighborhood is filled with wonderful and happy people.  Please keep them happy by parking only in the garage, driveway or in front of the house and by keeping quiet hours between 10:00  pm and 8:00 am
transit: There is a bus stop on David if you need public transit.  We walk to the nearby markets and local eateries.
access: Feel free to park a car in the garage and make use of the kitchen for your meals!  All bed linens and towels are provided, along with beach towels and chairs in the garage.  Free coffee and WiFi... what else do you need?
interaction: If you are at Three Seas Cottage, that means we are at our farm which is 2 hours away.  However, we will do all we can to solve any issues promptly.  Feel free to text with any questions or concerns... and above all CHECK THE BINDER.  It has all the info you will need and more!
house_rules: Please be kind to our house and treat it like you would want someone to treat yours!  Sorry, we don't allow pets or smoking.
host_about: We are beach lovers living on an almond farm in the Central Valley and our Three Seas Cottage in Pacific Grove. We love our three kiddos, building Hot Rods, Netflix Marathons and Thrift Shops.  We are happiest when our feet are pointed toward the water... A little coffee and a whole lotta Jesus gets us through the day.

name: Lighthouse Cottage—Ocean Views & Close to town
summary: Charming cottage, with ocean views, on the main street of Pacific Grove. One of two, newly renovated cottages, ready to call home for your next beach vacation. Only two blocks from the ocean and a short stroll to town, Lover's Point and the famous Cannery Row.
space: Lighthouse Cottage is the large, main upper-cottage in a two-unit, WWII-era Carriage House. She has stood through over seventy years of history, and gathered stories in her rooms of love, friends and family.  After months of renovation, Lighthouse Cottage is ready for rent—sitting in the beautiful retreat neighborhood of Pacific Grove and the quaint downtown of Pacific Grove just a six-minute stroll down the street to the right as you exit the front door. A less than 15-minute walk in the other direction takes you to historic Cannery Row and The Monterey Bay Aquarium. Under the canopy of a stately old cypress tree, she is a resting place of tranquility, cool breezes, and is ready to embrace a host of new memories. As you walk past the gate through the rustic Dutch door, you arrive at a staircase upon entrance that leads you up to a cottage filled with warmth and charm. name: Pacific Grove + 2 Aquarium Passes*
summary: We're sorry but in consideration to our  non-smoking guests and ourselves, only non-smokers, non-vaping folks please. It's our pleasure to share our 1922 craftsman style home with you while you enjoy your visit to the beautiful Monterey Peninsula! Your private bedroom and bath are cozy and comfortable.  The aquarium, Cannery Row, and beautiful Pacific Grove are within walking distance.  Please be prepared to provide identification upon your arrival.
space: We'd love to have you stay in the guest bedroom of our craftsman style home! Ours is a three bedroom house in a quiet neighborhood. The main guest bedroom is private, quiet, comfortable, clean, and cute. You'll find a new queen sized bed, a desk, and dresser, and a closet available for your use. This room is designed for 1 or 2 guests and can accommodate a small child as well.  If the guests wish to have separate rooms our second guest room is available for the nominal fee of $15 to cover the extra cleaning. We enjoy kayaking, are avid hikers, and have several books and suggestions for local outdoor adventures available for you to peruse. We also have put together a binder of information on local activities for you as well.  City of Pacific Grove Transient Use License #0220. You'll have exclusive use of the private guest bathroom with a shower/tub combination and nice towels. We provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash for your use. We offer a continental breakfast each morning with

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a wonderful community! A quiet town of about 15,000 adjacent to Monterey, PG (as the locals call it) began as a Methodist retreat in the late 1800's. As such, it's said that PG has the largest concentration of Victorian style homes of any community in the US. Don't know how accurate that is, but suffice it to say, it's a cute, tidy little town with stunning scenery. Pacific Grove is often called "The Last Hometown," and you'll find lots of local events here such as the weekly farmer's market and annual celebrations like the Butterfly Parade, Good Old Days, and the Feast of Lanterns. There are many kid-friendly things to see and do both in Pacific Grove and in neighboring Monterey. People live here because they really want to, and the vibe here is friendly and upbeat. You can easily walk to the aquarium and Cannery Row where you can pick up the free trolley ( it runs between Memorial Day and Labor Day) that will take you all over Monterey. You can walk to downtown PG an
notes: Pacific Grove charges a 10% transient occupancy tax. Airbnb will be collecting and remitting the transient occupancy tax for all reservations booked after December 1, 2017. Guests will see a separate line item for the tax when booking. Airbnb will collect and pay the tax to the City of Pacific Grove at the next filing due date. City of Pacific Grove Transient Use License #0220. To comply with our local short-term rental ordinance, we must ask all guests for their home address and maintain a log including this information. We don't send this information anywhere; we're just required to record it. Since our living space is adjacent to the kitchen, we ask that our guests limit their use of the kitchen in the evening to using the fridge, microwave, and other simple tasks. Guests using the kitchen to cook meals is disruptive to our evening quiet routine and is not allowed. Sorry for any inconvenience. We're happy to serve you breakfast! As a rule of thumb, we say "anytime between 8:00 a.m.
transit: Pacific Grove is extremely walk-able. From our house, you can easily walk to many of the places you might like to go. In fact, we walk around town daily and vary our route; if you're interested in beautiful and interesting walks, we can definitely suggest many. It's also a great place for cyclists. We are near bus lines 1 and 2, and you can get here from the Monterey Regional Airport using two buses. Most visitors to this area will come by car. It's easy to find a free parking space on our quiet street. The preferred place for guests to park is right in front of our house. If a space is not available there, we ask that guests not park in front of the houses on either side of us but rather park across the street. Please note that in Pacific Grove, local code stipulates that cars must be parked in the direction of the flow of traffic (the right hand side of the street).
access: Our house is divided by the kitchen. The front of the house contains the guest rooms and bathroom as well as a large living room and eating area. Here you'll find comfortable couches and cable TV available for your use. You'll have access to all of this space in the front of the house. We do most of our living in the back part of the house in our own private area, but we enter and exit the house through the main door like you.  We're easy to find if you need us for anything. For privacy, we pull a curtain between the front and back of the house from dinner time til breakfast time the next morning, but it's easy for guests to access us with questions or needs by simply coming back into the kitchen. Check in time is 3:00. For the most part,  whenever you arrive is good with us.  However, guests must arrive before 10 p.m. unless you have made prior arrangements. If we happen to be out, guests can come in by using our lock box. You also have free wi-fi access during your stay.  *We have tw
interaction: We are friendly people. David is retired, and Kelly works as a public school science teacher during the day.  We're definitely around to help you with whatever questions you might have. We're both volunteer nature docents with the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary, board members with the Big Sur International Marathon, avid outdoor people, and longtime residents of this area, so we can  help you information you might want about the area.  Since we live in this house, we'll be easy to find if you need us, but as we have our own private space in the back of the house so we won't be tripping over each other!
house_rules: NON SMOKERS-NON VAPING ONLY. Sorry, if you are a SMOKER OF ANYTHING, this is not the place for you. Both of us are very sensitive to the various types smoke and vapors as well as the smells associated with smoking,  left on clothing, luggage, etc. . This listing is NOT available for guests who SMOKE ANYTHING. Non-smokers like us can smell smoke around our house for days, even if you have not been smoking at our house.  Our dog has lived here for 16 years (That's a lot of dog years!!). Please be sure you are okay with sharing your space with a friendly old dog before booking. No other pets allowed. You may borrow our two passes to the Monterey Bay Aquarium on the day of your arrival or any full day you are staying with us. You can contact us to make arrangements to borrow them on arrival day before check in time if you would like. You may not borrow them on the day you check out.  No drugs, parties, or extra people beyond registered guests. Check in time is 3:00 pm. Please check in betw
host_about:
We have lived here on the Monterey Peninsula for thirty years. We raised our four grown children here. Both of us grew up in the Bay Area. 

David is retired, and Kelly is a science teacher. We are very involved in our community as volunteers for the Big Sur International Marathon, the City of Pacific Grove, and the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary. We're avid hikers and we love to kayak. We own a little camper and typically travel a lot  each summer, camping in and around national and state parks as we explore our public lands. We've also traveled to several major US cities and have made one memorable trip to Europe, where we traveled with nothing more than a small backpack for three weeks. 

We're both very interested in nature, science, and the environment. 

We're excited to meet people from all over the world and to share this beautiful place where we live with visitors. We hope you will choose to stay with us so you can feast on Kelly's homemade muffins and have David make you a coffee drink of your choosing on our professional grade Jura Impressa S9 Espresso machine.

name: Charming ocean view cottage in PG
summary: Beautiful 2-story,  2 bedroom cottage in Pacific Grove  with a master,  living room and a family room with ocean views. There are two bedrooms - one with a queen bed and the other with two twin beds. There is also a pull out sofa in the upstairs living room.
space: beautiful setting in pacific grove!  Please note that one bedroom has a queen size bed upstairs with a great view and one is  much smaller and  has two twins (trundle) with a good view.  Thanks and have fun!!  Also the carpet is cleaned once a month.  Because of previous renters bringing dogs in against the rules there are stains that won't go away but please know that the carpet is clean. There are security cameras on the neighbor's house that i have access to so please know that I will see if you bring a dog or pet on the grounds I will charge you 500 dollars!!!!    Also please let me know how many people will be staying in house.

Also please let me know how many people will be staying in house. CHARCOAL GRILL, patio with ocean view. Laundry in garage and use house  key to open garage.  NO PETS
neighborhood_overview: The view is amazing and the town is the best!
notes: This house is not for you if you want to bring a pet!   Please note that there are 2 bedrooms.  And one sofa bed in the upstairs living room. So there are 3 sleeping areas.  Please note that the wifi rarely does not work but in the case that does not please unplug the router and plug back in first.  If this does not work the service is Comcast. Air bnb will not allow me to put a number here but (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) it if you need it.  They will need the number on the back of the router and the home phone number which is on message board.  If all that fails give me a call.  Thanks!!  Also please note that the electric fireplace is not working.  Please respect the neighbors and also no parties!!  Keep it quiet please!  My neigbors keep an eye on the house.
transit: 10 minute walk to downtown!  15 minutes  to ocean!
access: CHARCOAL GRILL, patio with ocean view. Laundry in garage and use house  key to open garage.  NO PETS.  Please do all dishes and take trash out thanks so kindly! No dishes left in sink please.
interaction: Please call me if you have any issues.  My sister lives across the street.  No pets!! We will be obliged to charge $500 dollar deduction from security deposit if pets on premises. Neighbors have security camera that I have access to and if any us see a pet you will be immediately KICKED out and fined five hundred dollars.  We do not want you if you have a pet!! EVEN IN THE YARD  Thanks for understanding! Guests have snuck them in before and they were not well trained and left messes.  Please follow house rules of washing all dishes and taking trash out. And no parties!   We will be obliged to charge for dirty dishes and trash left in house.
house_rules: Please no smoking, wash all dishes before you leave and put rubbish in the outside bins.   Please make sure all pots and pans are clean before putting them in cupboard. NO PETS!!!!!!!!   One thousand dollar deduction from security and credit card if pets are on premises. License number 0288
host_about: I am a film producer in Los Angeles.  I have had a great time with airbnb and now want to share my home with fellow travelers!

name: Walk to Asilomar
summary: Welcome to our 2000 square foot craftsman home in beautiful Pacific Grove. We are a 15 minute walk from Asilomar beach. Come and enjoy the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Pebble Beach, Big Sur and Carmel all from our comfortable centrally located home. City of Pacific Grove STR license #0266.
space: Our home is registered with the City of Pacific Grove and our current Rental License is 0266. When booking our home you may be assured that there will be no cancelations on our end due to conflict with the city.  Our home is set up for self check in with a lockbox and key. Details will arrive with your itinerary after booking is complete.  This is our primary home and we rent occasionally which means we have personal items in bedrooms, bathrooms and the kitchen. The master bedroom has two lock off closets and an empty closet for you to use during your stay. Closets in the other rooms have space available although the middle room has a lock off closet. Please feel free to use anything in our kitchen including condiments, spices, tea and oils. Anything out is available to use.  Beautiful & open living space with high ceilings and amazing light. Fireplace, outdoor gas fire place, Wifi and cable.  We prefer to book only up to 2 months in advance.  The master bedroom has an organic cotton k

neighborhood_overview: Residential Neighborhood within walking distance to downtown or Asilomar Beach. Monterey Bay Aquarium, Pebble Beach Gold Course, Pacific Grove Public Golf Links, Carmel and Big Sur
notes: We live on a peninsula surrounded by the Pacific Ocean and Monterey Bay. You may hear sea lions barking, buoy bells ringing or crashing waves when you sleep. We LOVE our neighbors and they are like family to us. Please drive slowly, three cars fit in front of our house and additional cars will need to park around the corner on 17 mile drive.
transit: We are a 15 minutes walk from Asilomar beach and downtown Pacific Grove. The recreation bike path is 10 minutes away and will take you to the Monterey Bay Aquarium along the coast.
access: The entire house except the garage and two lock off closets in the master bedroom. Hot Tub, outdoor spaces, three parking places
interaction: We will be available by phone but generally will not be there in person as we travel frequently.
house_rules: The comfort and safety of our neighbors is our priority. Please drive slowly on our street as there are pets and children. Two cars per group may park in front of the house. Additional cars may park on 17 mile Drive one block away.  Quiet hours at 10:00 pm. Outdoor lights off also. Complaint about noise from neighbors past quiet hours will require half of deposit. Our neighbors are very flexible and gracious and have never complained even with our parties. We have no chronic complainers near us, but we wanted to assure the people who share our street that we would have a clear policy for all guests.  No smoking in the house, outside OK.  Pets are fine for a small additional fee.  No candles inside or out, electric candles only.
host_about: Coastal Californian. Lover of travel, design, art, music, film, garden, food and many other forms of creativity. We design and build for a living in Pacific Grove between Monterey and Carmel. Weekends are spent hiking in Big Sur or Marin, exploring San Francisco, surfing in Santa Cruz and annual trips to the Sawtooth mountains in Idaho to ride Peruvian Paso's with family friends. Hard work pays off.

summary: Charming & cozy downtown Pacific Grove cottage sleeps 6 comfortably in 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms (3 queen beds). Located 3 very short blocks to Lover's Point, enjoy all that the Monterey Bay area has to offer from this central location!

name: Pebble Beach Paradise
summary: Spacious contemporary with two living areas, a see-through fireplace, a spectacular solarium, lushly-landscaped backyard, two master suites with Cal King beds, two guest rooms with Queen beds, and 3.5 baths.
space: This spacious contemporary has two living areas, a see-through fireplace, and a lovely solarium facing a lushly-landscaped backyard. There are two master suites with Cal King beds and two guest rooms with Queens (all luxurious Stearns & Foster and iComfort mattresses with plush bedding/linens). The kitchen is equipped with stainless appliances, a four-burner gas cooktop, oven, built-in microwave, double sink, dishwasher and a wine refrigerator. Additional features include three gas fireplaces, a wireless soundbar for music, and six flat screen TVs (two 60" with DVD in the living room and master bedroom, a 51" in the family room, and three 32" in the other bedrooms). Located on a quiet quarter acre lot, the home has a large, fenced backyard (illuminated with landscape lighting) that is perfect for entertaining in privacy. The deck has a gas barbecue, a dining table that seats eight, two comfortable chaise lounges, and a gas firepit for gathering under the stars. The home has a two car a

neighborhood_overview: Pebble Beach is heaven for golfers, but it's so much more. Dazzling, uncrowded white sand beaches. Enchanted forests. A luxurious spa, exquisite dining, and stellar events such as the Concours d'Elegance, the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am and the Pebble Beach Food & Wine.
interaction: If you have any maintenance issues during your stay, please call our 24-hour line. The number will be on your key packet and inside the home.
house_rules: We look forward to hosting you and hope you enjoy your visit on the Monterey Peninsula!  Check in time is 3 pm.  Check out time is 11 am. OCCUPANCY The Premises are located in a residential neighborhood that includes both short-term guests and year-round residents who enjoy living in a tranquil environment. Maximum occupancy (8) is strictly enforced. Special events and/or large parties, such as weddings, receptions, rehearsal dinners, large birthday/anniversary celebrations, are strictly prohibited, and are a violation of the rental property owner's rental permit. A small dinner party or gathering for no more than twice the number of guests who are accommodated at the Premises is permitted. Note: If you are planning an event during your stay, please be sure you have arranged for a venue other than the Premises (contact us for suggestions of alternate venues).  HOUSEKEEPING Departure housekeeping service includes: Replenishing soap and paper products, vacuuming carpets and rugs, cleanin
host_about: Monterey Bay Property Management has been in business for over 25 years (our office is "a splash away" from the Aquarium and Cannery Row). From studios to estates, we manage over 100 vacation rentals on the Monterey Peninsula and would love to help you find the perfect place for a few days or a longer stay. All our properties are fully furnished with cable and WiFi, and we maintain a 24 hour maintenance line - so we are just a phone call away if you need assistance while you are here.

This is one of the historic neighborhoods of Monterey, known as "New Monterey." Cannery workers lived up on this hill. When the boat loads of sardines arrived, the canneries would blow a whistle and the workers would go down to the factories. The neighborhood is full of creative people and it's reflected in the diversity of interesting shops and restaurants on Lighthouse Avenue in Monterey, and in the area surrounding Cannery Row. There are many fan
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the historic neighborhoods of Monterey, known as "New Monterey." Cannery workers lived up on this hill. When the boat loads of sardines arrived, the canneries would blow a whistle and the workers would go down to the factories. The neighborhood is full of creative people and it's reflected in the diversity of interesting shops and restaurants on Lighthouse Avenue in Monterey, and in the area surrounding Cannery Row. There are many fancy and less fancy restaurants, a few bars, a Goodwill thrift store, funky little clothing consignment shops, vape shops, tattoo parlors and massage places. It is awesome and authentic, as is Safeway, Ace Hardware, Rite Aid, Starbucks, Downtown Pacific Grove, The Motorcycle Museum, PG Art Center, Natural History Museum, Lovers Point, the beaches, Aquarium, wharves, etc.
notes: We encourage our guests to park in the carport or driveway. The carport is small, but two small to medium cars can fit side by side. Park as close to the house as possible without blocking anyone else's vehicle. To minimize possible discomfort to sensitive individuals we are requesting no pets as long term guests.
transit: It's a great place to walk or bike and there are plenty of other options including local buses with bike racks, ride shares, and several taxi companies.  The aquarium is about a 20 minute walk or five minute drive down the hill from our house. There is a free trolley in the summer that runs from the Aquarium, along Cannery Row to the Wharf and downtown Monterey and back.  You can rent a car at Monterey Airport or a little closer at Enterprise on Del Monte Avenue. Monterey also has a bus service called MST or Monterey Salinas Transit. Schedules are available on their website and are posted at some of the bus stops.
access: Guests access is granted to the room and outside paths to the bordering streets.  Kitchen use and laundry, just call and let us know, it should be no problem.
interaction: We are flexible, low-key & non-intrusive, available when needed. Call us anytime while you are our guest.
house_rules: Quiet time between 10 pm and 7 am. Smoking outside only. There's a little patio outside by the carport where you can smoke.  If you have any questions about other parts of the house or yard, please ask.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Monterey. I've driven a taxi here off and on for many years, and have really enjoyed getting to know the community from this perspective. Monterey Peninsula is a very interesting and diverse place with a lot of great people.

I like to read, go to movies, and walk on the beach with Wendy. I like meeting the people who visit Monterey, and I like to travel too. I like reading about current events, science and history. Wendy likes social media, shopping and thrift stores.

name: Our Home Near Asilomar Beach #0224
summary: Just a few blocks from Asilomar Beach, and right outside the Pebble Beach Gate entrance Our Comfortable Home is a Wonderful Place to Stay.  City license # 0224. This is Our Home,Not A Hotel. The Country Club shopping center which has a Grocery store,Rite aid, Starbucks, are very close. Restaurants are just downtown. Monterey and Carmel are both 15 minutes away! NO WEDDINGS,PARTIES,EVENTS OR GET TOGETHERS ALLOWED AT THIS PROPERTY.
space: Our home is very welcoming and comfortable. The entire house is furnished and tastefully decorated. You'll find wifi throughout the house and garden.  Each bedroom has comfortable queen size beds. The front and back gardens give privacy and quiet during your stay, with lovely forest growing throughout the area. Pacific Grove is famous for its Monarch butterflies and the diversity of birds in the area, but you are equally likely to see deer with their babies and other woodland creatures. The quaint shopping center, beaches, running track, and Pebble Beach are within walking distance.We have a large driveway for safe easy parking.The city ordinance allows 2 cars to park in the driveway.Please do not over crowd driveway with any cars that are not registered to stay in our home.

The quaint shopping center, beaches, running track, and Pebble Beach are w
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a quiet, friendly, and safe neighborhood. Walking and biking are common pastimes here since there is so much close by. If you bring your bicycles you can store them securely in the garage.People are very friendly, and there's a good reason Pacific Grove is called "America's last home town"!
notes: We've started a book and have a drawer of info on  Local Restaurants ,Things to Do around town and local attractions. It also has a section in the book where to find things in the house and WiFi access codes.This book is on the credenza in the kitchen.There are outdoor security cameras on the entrances,exits and driveway.
transit: The bus can be picked up just around the corner. The Country Club shopping center, beaches, running track, and Pebble Beach are within walking distance. There is off street parking for cars. The city ordinance allows two cars for the  6 people staying in the house.Please do not overcrowd driveway with cars not registered to the home.
access: The kitchen is fully set up for cooking nearly any meal. In the living room, you can turn on  a fire with a simple click of a button  if the evening is chilly. There is also a tv above the fireplace.The bathrooms are equipped with soap essentials, shampoo,toilet paper and a hair dryer. The house is stocked with the basics.Any other toiletries,paper goods,food,pharmacy,etc. needed can be purchased a few blocks away at the Shopping Center.The large all wood deck in the garden is perfect for coffee in the morning or cocktails and a BBQ in the evening.
interaction: You will have privacy when staying at the house. The only time we come by is if there is a problem or you have a question about something that can't  be answered over phone or text. You  can feel free to call or text if you have a questions.ONLY the guest who made the reservation can check in.Only the guests registered can be at the house. A reservation is Not transferrable to another party who has not been verified properly by Airbnb.PARTIES,EVENTS, OR GET TOGETHERS ARE NOT ALLOWED. This is strongly enforced.
house_rules: Our home is a NO Smoking home. No Pets unless discussed and approved by owner  prior to booking reservation.Our home accommodates 6 people.Unless pre arranged with the host Do NOT  sneak  extra guests in. It is frowned upon and there is a fee charged .The Jacuzzi is for adults.Please DO NOT leave your children unattended in it or bring food in the jacuzzi. If you lock yourself out Please call for an extra key.Do Not try to pry front bedroom screens out of the window to get in.It doesn't work and the screens are expensive.Garage is available for special events cars on approval prior to arrival. We love our home so please treat it gently and with respect. Otherwise the only rule is- Have A Wonderful Vacation and we hope you love it so much here on the peninsula that you return.
host_about: We Love our home in Pacific Grove. Keep in mind-it is Our Home ,Not A Hotel.We appreciate honesty when booking and staying in our home.Our P.G.City License is # 0224. We are both pilots,aviation and car enthusiasts. We are also professional business owners. We enjoy  the relaxing quaintness of Pacific Grove and having the beautiful coastline just down the street. Early morning sunrises, evening sunsets and watching the surfers are things we enjoy often and can be a magical experience.The Monterey peninsula has fabulous selection of  things to do such as, world class golf courses, Monterey Bay Aquarium,Fishermans Wharf,cycling,hiking and dining, farmers markets and festivals. We hope you enjoy staying in our home and enjoy all our peninsula has to offer. No Parties or gatherings are allowed at this house. This is strictly enforced .Please note the jacuzzi on property is for adults relaxation not children to play in.No Food or Alcohol allowed in jacuzzi. Please rinse off before entering jacuzzi as sand and dirt clog the filters. There are outdoor security cameras at entrances/exits as well as the drive way for security. Feb. 2018 At this time the jacuzzi is down for maintenance and repair.

name: Heritage Home
summary: Charming historic family home completely restored and upgraded.  Two large bedrooms, one with a Cal King bed, and one with a Queen; both beds have new Memory Foam mattresses and fresh new bedding. Pacific Grove License 0237
space: This gorgeous historic home retains its original charm and character but has been fully upgraded with attention to detail to include every convenience and amenity.  The downstairs living room catches the afternoon sea breeze, while the parlor is a cozy spot to curl up and read by the gas fireplace. The dining room with its table leads into the fully updated kitchen with a sweet breakfast nook. The remodeled downstairs bathroom and laundry room (with washer and dryer) lead out to the deck with a comfy lounge chair and seating to soak up the sunshine. Upstairs the guest bedroom with its queen memory foam mattresses shares the updated bathroom with the master bedroom which offers a California King memory foam bed.   We also spa robes. We provide a clean gas grill if you choose to BBQ.

neighborhood_overview: Pacfic Grove is  affectionately nicknamed  "America's last Hometown." Located between Point Pinos and Monterey, this gem of a town is celebrated for its Victorian Homes and its proximity to famed Asilomar Beach.  Premier golfing at Pebble Beach, Poppy Hills and Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Links, Pacific Grove Butterfly Sanctuary, outstanding Monterey Aquarium, lively Cannery Row and day trips to wine tasting in sunny Carmel Valley and beautiful Beautiful Big Sur are just  a sampling of what this town and area has to offer.
notes: If enchanted Pacific Grove and the Monterey Peninsula is your next vacation destination, we are confident that our beautiful home will help make your vacation a complete success. Our home welcomes you with warmth and hospitality. See you soon.  Pacific Grove license 0237. Note:  during weeks ( such as car week) rate will differ.   We need 48 hour notice for booking.
transit: Ample street parking. The house is conveniently located within easy walking distance to EVERYTHING! Bus stop 1.5 blocks away that goes all over Pacific Grove, Monterey and Carmel.
access: Welcome. Our home has full Wi fi access (password available to our guests.) Enjoy our 50-inch high definition TV with basic cable and Netflix in the living room.  The kitchen and pantry are fully stocked with everything you need to prepare meals. Our hot spa near the deck is available for your enjoyment.
interaction: We respect the privacy of all our guests and will be in the area should you have any questions. We want to help make your stay as enjoyable as possible, so please let us know if you want any recommendations and or course in case of emergency.
house_rules: This is a Smoke-Free home. Smoking allowed outside only. This home IS NOT wheel-chair accessible. We want you to enjoy yourself and feel at home, and request that you treat our home with respect. There is a 2 night minimum.  This home is best suited for adults without small children.

The rental comes with two free Monterey Bay Aquarium passes.
space: Classic Craftsman in the heart of Pacific Grove. Great Location!  This comfortable two bedroom duplex is just a few blocks to downtown Pacific Grove, with it's unique boutiques, galleries, coffee shops, excellent restaurants,and quaint but well provisioned grocery store.   Picturesque Lover's Point is just another short stroll away, as are several lovely parks, conveniently close for picnicking or Monarch Butterfly viewing within season.  A walk or bike ride on the coastal trail will take you to Cannery Row and the Aquarium.  A fantastic 7 mile bike trail provides a beautiful opportunity to enjoy more of the area's scenic shoreline.  We are a short  spin over to Pebble Beach, Carmel, and Monterey for more  extended shopping and sightseeing.  For day tripping, we're only about 30 minutes from Santa Cruz with it's beaches and Boardwalk Amusement Park. neighborhood_overview: Our immediate neighborhood has a quiet, sleepy town feeling.   Just a few short block takes you to downtown with a great array of shops and restaurants.  A few blocks in the other direction takes you to the ocean with a great  6 mile trail for bike riding or walking.
notes: We have two free passes for you to the Monterey Bay Aquarium. This is a quiet neighborhood, a good place to really relax.
transit: There's a bus stop just across the street and we have three bikes for your use.
access: You'll have both a front and back entrance. You will also have a driveway parking space. You have a private back yard and front porch for relaxing outdoors.
interaction: We're a phone call away and live only about 45 minutes away if you need anything, or want recommendations for local outings.
house_rules: No Smoking.  The whole property is a non smoking property.  No smoking whatsoever in or around the house. No Pets Allowed No excessive noise or late night noise. This is a quiet neighborhood. Be considerate of water use Keep gates closed at all times.  Close windows when you leave.
host_about:
We're Erlinda and Chuck, and we live on the beautiful California coast in Big Sur.   An artist and a builder, together we've created a sweet home here.  
We're a couple that loves to travel and have stayed at many vacation rental homes.  We know what it's like to feel welcomed and have a comfortable house to enjoy and feel at home in while we're on our excursions.
    Chuck has always been interested in restoring houses. He searched high and low until he found this home with good bones. He bought the property with his mother and brother in 1980 and lovingly restored it.  It has always been very well cared for since then.  Together we enjoyed furnishing and decorating the house, hanging many of my original paintings throughout.

name: 2 Cottages in Private Garden: Sleeps 4+ Kids & Dog
summary: Our rental includes both cosy 1-bedroom cottages in a private, lighted courtyard with fire pit, lounge set, pergola redwood table & double glider  - Cottage 1: Cal king, custom retro kitchen, living room, bathroom - Cottage 2: Carriage house with queen, games room, bathroom Great for couples or families to enjoy together time and private space. 15-min walk to aquarium, dining, shops, beach. Dogs (2 small or 1 large, well-behaved & crated). Transient Use License 0252.
space: This unique home is perfectly suited for two couples or a family that wants privacy but also to be in a cozy spot together. Meet in the main cottage kitchen to share a meal and relax, or retreat to your private spaces for quiet time. MASTER BEDROOM, MAIN COTTAGE Dream of marine mammals on a solid wood, four poster Cal king bed with foam mattress. There's a vintage wardrobe with drawers and hanging space for your clothing. There's also a writing desk where you can be inspired by the likes of Steinbeck and Twain. There's also an white, vintage-look log stove to keep you extra toasty at night. neighborhood_overview: The Retreat area of Pacific Grove is a community of quaint cottages that are steps from the ocean, steps to the Monterey Bay Aquarium and minutes away by car from Pebble Beach, the world famous Concours d'Elegance, a US Open golf course, Carmel by the Sea, the 17-Mile Drive and just a half-hour drive to Big Sur.
notes: Suitable for quiet retreat: Pacific Grove's "Retreat" area is known for it's quaint cottages and cozy streets.  Even though our home has a secluded, treed courtyard, it is still within ear-shot of neighbors. So please enjoy your outdoor time quietly and observe strict hush-hush hours after 8pm during the week and 10pm on weekends. RENTAL AGREEMENT The maximum number of cars per rental period cannot exceed 2, and Tenant must park only on the street in front of the premises OR on adjacent streets, Pine Avenue or Spruce Avenue. Under no circumstances can the Tenant park in front of houses neighboring the Property. Terms of the Agreement:  1. The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenant violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenant waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. Th
transit: The walkability score of this neighborhood is high! Sights, restaurants and shopping are within 10-15 minutes walking distance: including the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Cannery Row, downtown Pacific Grove, and Lovers Point beach.
access: I will provide you with a code to the key pads on both cottage doors.
interaction: I am available by text, call or email at any time to answer questions, be a guide or offer suggestions. Our local caretaker, Frank, is also available within 5 minutes, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, if needed.
house_rules: Pacific Grove Short-Term Rental Laws •Maximum occupancy for our unit is 2 adults per bedroom + 1, so 5, with no limit on children. We only allow 4 adults per stay and try to keep groups to a max of 6, including children. Do not bring extra guests. •Noise, music and amplified sound are not allowed outside. If the police are called, you and I can both be cited.  •We are allowed a maximum of 2 cars at our property because it is street parking only. Don’t park in front of neighbors. •Trash pickup is on Fri am – Put ALL bins on street in am and bring them back in after they're emptied. •No fires are allowed. NOTE: Spare the Air days for Pacific Grove can be (EMAIL HIDDEN) •Pacific Grove has severe water restrictions. Do not use outside water. We are at Stage 1 water restrictions, with garden watering only allowed on Wed and Sat. See (URL HIDDEN)  •Stay off the dunes, out of tide pools and river banks and don’t disturb butterfly nesting areas. Be extremely careful in Pacific Grove’s environm
host_about:
I lead social media for a global insurance company and my husband Sal heads up software architecture for a finance company. We have two kiddos and a dog. 

I really like being involved with AirBnB and have participated in several conferences and projects with them, because they do a good job of looping in hosts from the Bay Area.

We are grateful for our family homes on Monterey Bay and in Lake Tahoe and enjoy sharing them with other families. We would also love to share our Sausalito home, one day.

I'm always happy to offer tips on restaurants and things to do in at any one of our places.

I tweet and Insta post from the handle @tripmogul, sharing what's new and exciting on the Truckee, LakeTahoe, PacificGrove, Monterey and Sausalito hashtags. We love connecting with our guests, helping them with their plans and then hearing how their stays were. 

Looking forward to sharing our place with you!

name: Breathtaking Ocean Front 2 Bed 2 Bath Award Winner
summary: Newly renovated duplex. A landmark property with spectacular views of the Monterey Bay. Walking distance to the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Lover's Point, shopping, the recreational trail, restaurants, Cannery Row, golf and many attractions. The perfect place for Concours and Golfing Events. ** NO PARTIES, WEDDINGS, OR EVENTS OF ANY KIND ARE TO BE HELD AT THIS PROPERTY. A City of Pacific Grove Transient Licensed Property #0227
space: The ground level of this duplex  has been transformed into a luxury vacation rental offering 2 spacious bedrooms with King size beds and 2 full bathrooms plus a Queen size air mattress for an additional 2 guests if needed. This unit sleeps up to 6 people. The spacious home and courtyard provide ample room for you and your guests to enjoy time together but also offers enough space to find a quiet place to be alone. There are 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room, courtyard with fire pit, indoor laundry and a gourmet kitchen. Approximate size is 1,200 square feet offering plenty of space for sharing with family and friends.  Amenities include high-speed internet, free wi-fi, cable and flat screen TV's in bedrooms and living room. Gourmet kitchen is ideal for foodies or to grab a quick snack or pack a picnic to go. The courtyard around the fire pit is "the gathering place" to enjoy sunsets, the perfect spot to relax, visit, and view all that encompasses this one of a kind locale.  Wildlife

neighborhood_overview: A great neighborhood that is friendly, quiet, and has an exceptional ocean-view. The property is located just across the street from Cabrillo Point and the Hopkins Marine Station, which was founded in 1892 as the first marine laboratory on the west coast of North America. Wildlife flourishes in this region from whales, dolphins, many species of birds, to local families of deer and of course, the perfect resting, feeding and birthing bay and beach for sea lions and seals. The scenery is ever-changing as sailboats and fishing boats abound in the bay, passersby on the recreation trail stop to view the seals and sea lions sunbathing in their protected sanctuary, visible from Casa Gran Vista's courtyard. From the living room and courtyard, watch whales breach just off the point and dolphins frolic and play in the surf.
notes: A truly central location! Walking distance to great dining, museums, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, shopping, sightseeing and a short drive to the many Concours d'Elegance events. Watch whales, dolphins, seals, sea otters and other amazing animal life right from the property. With views to die for, this is truly a one of a kind property in one of the most spectacular places on earth - you won't be disappointed. A City of Pacific Grove Transient Licensed Property #0227
transit: We are walking distance to many attractions, fine and casual dining, entertainment, the aquarium, special events, hotels, nightlife, etc. There is parking on the street and a parking pass will be provided at check-in. Public transportation is also nearby.
access: Casa Gran Vista was built in 1925 and was one of the first two homes built on the iconic Ocean View Boulevard in Pacific Grove, California. The duplex has undergone an extensive restoration and remodel and is the 2017 P.G. Heritage "Award Winner" for Remodel/Addition and awaits your arrival. Staying true to the property's Spanish revival architecture, the bottom floor was transformed into a two bedroom, two bathroom vacation rental complete with Saltillo and Talavera tiles, hardwood floors and comfortable exterior courtyard seating. The front doors open onto a north-facing Spanish revival patio where you can unwind around a built-in gas fire pit, sip a glass of local wine, and enjoy a stunning view of the entire Monterey Bay. Across the street you can leisurely walk along the recreation trail a short 5 minutes to the world renowned Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row, where you will find both fine and casual dining, shopping and entertainment. It's a short stroll to Lover's Point and
interaction: We are available to answer questions or tend to needs if any should arise.
house_rules: We ask that all guest treat our home with the same kindness and care you would treat your own home. We have taken great pride in creating a unique and special place for all who gather here and wish to continue offering this exceptional experience to others. Check-in is after 4:00pm and check-out is by 11:00 am. Please respect theses times to avoid interfering with other guests arrival plans.  ** No party's, weddings or events of any kind are allowed at the property.

space: We are officially licensed with the City of Pacific Grove. We pay transient use tax.  Come to this small (940 sq. ft.) and cozy house during your next trip to the Monterey Peninsula! Located a minute outside of Pebble Beach (Country Club Gate) and easy access to Highway 1/Carmel, this simple getaway provides all basic amenities and is situated in a quiet residential neighborhood called  Del Monte Forest. This neighborhood is not in downtown so it's very quiet and a short drive to all the popular attractions the Monterey Peninsula has to offer, but you need a car to go to local restaurants and groceries such as Trader Joe's, Rite-Aid, Safeway and Lucky's, which are all close (all groceries are within 2 minutes). Features a cal king Tempurpedic bed,  a Japanese-style Kohler deep Greek bathtub, and 2 guest Aquarium passes.  In order to keep our house as dog-friendly, please be nice to us by letting us know IN ADVANCE if you are considering bringing your dog. Please refrain from leaving yo

Only a minute away from Pebble Beach Country Club Gate, Del Monte Forest, and 5 minutes to HW-1. This neighborhood is very quiet and close to all the popular attractions the Monterey Peninsula has to offer. Also: Trader Joe's, Rite-Aid, Safeway, Savemart, etc. all within 3 minutes.
notes: (City of Pacific Grove Transient Use License # 0223)  We are jazz musicians; if you want to go hear live jazz or take private lessons, we are happy to recommend local venues and teachers!
transit: Parking is available in front of the house. MST bus stop is a 3 minute walk away.
access: Guests can access entire house (except the garage and the shed in the back yard ), front garden and deck.  Please do not enter the back yard and the shed (owner's private meditation room).  Note: At the current state, we don't recommend children and dogs playing out in the back yard. There is ongoing construction on the side and the shed in the back yard.  The dirt is slippery, stairs are narrow with no hand rail, there is a little poison oak on the left fence mixed in with the regular ivy.
interaction: We will be off site but only 15 min away. Please feel free to call/text anytime for questions/recommendations.
house_rules: 1. Drug free & Non Smoking Drugs and smoking is absolutely not permitted anywhere on the premises. If we detect any smoking inside, we will deduct $200 from your deposit. 2. Be mindful to (Website hidden by Airbnb) free house (not scent-free house) Though we are not "scent-free home", we would like to ask our guests to not  wear strong cologne or perfumes while staying at our place.  It takes days to get strong scents removed from the bedding, pillows and carpet, and also is harmful to the environment due to extra usage of the washer/dryer. An extra fee will be charged if an overwhelming amount of cleaning is required. Thank you for understanding. 3.Dog We love dogs, however, please let us know IN ADVANCE if you'd like to bring your dog. Please tell us your dog's brief description when you inquire along with your short profile.  Please do not drop off your dog before your check-in. Please refrain from leaving your dog unattended during your stay as we want our neighbors AND your dog ha
host_about: My wife and I have lived on the Monterey Peninsula since 2002 and are in love with this place! I (Eddie) was born and raised in Monterey, while Miko is from Yokohama, Japan. We are both pianists (jazz and classical) and teach/perform in Monterey and the Bay Area. We also have one daughter in college who's currently living in NYC and a Shiba Inu (dog). Miko and I are new to Airbnb - it is such an exciting learning experience. Being here brings us close to Mother Nature and allows us to live comfortably with an artistic mindset. Our bungalow in the forest is quiet, but centrally located: 1 minute to Pebble Beach, 7 minutes to the aquarium, 5 minutes to HW1 at Carmel hill. We hope you can enjoy this feeling while staying on the Peninsula as we do!

neighborhood_overview: We are a Victorian Village with lots of visitors year around, families and some military and a large international community of people here working in languages and in the Marine Sciences.  We are located on a National Marine Sanctuary - the Monterey Bay Sanctuary and as such, no fishing or removing of any sealife from the Bay.  We have lots of local parks, a dog-park in the woods for off leash walking and a nearby historic Lighthouse that is still in use today.  Monterey Bay has a bike path and walking paths to enjoy the entire length of the Bay's beauty and nature.  A 15 min walk to the Monterey Wharf along the Bay will bring you to any fishing, whale watching, kayaking, surfing, swimming or eating at any number of restaurants with all kinds of great fresh foods.  We have local farmers markets every day of the week in every community in the immediate area as we are the Salad Bowl of the USA.
notes: This is a residential neighborhood and there is a limit on any outside noise after 9pm so please be considerate of talking loudly, music or when you are outside the house at night.  Spa use is limited to 40 mins each use, one use per each 24 hr period so the filter can clean between uses properly and stay clean and no use after 11pm no exceptions.  No yelling or fighting please.  This is a peaceful home so leave your worries and problems behind you.  Please also park considerately in front, leaving room for others.  The driveway can be blocked as it is not a useable space being built in 1920's.
transit: Parking on the street is no problem and you can walk almost anywhere in the area to shopping, dining, entertainment, groceries, movies, museums, art galleries, hiking, biking, kayaking, whale watching, charter fishing and sailing, golf.  Buses run just 1 block away to Monterey, Carmel and Seaside and there are rental cars in Monterey and the airport.  Taxis are close by as well.  You can Uber too.
access: The main house has two bedrooms;  Master bedroom at one end of the hallway has private access to the outside back deck with jacuzzi and sauna (deposit required for use). The Second Bedroom has One twin bed set up and another that is a memory foam full twin sized (brand new) bench pull out, if you give us notice for your stay and is located in the front with large windows.  The bright Black & White full bath is located between the two bedrooms and has a skylight above the shower and large tub.  The front door opens into the main living room and has seating for private reading and entertaining the whole family with our large flat Screen HD Monitor and DVD player.  (We have left our DVD's for your enjoyment, please do not remove from the property so others can enjoy them too). The dining room is immediately to the left of the entry of the house and has great 1920's windows out to the front gardens and side gardens of the house.  The French Blue & White kitchen has large farm sink with gre
interaction: Either I, or my daughter will be nearby.   This is my family home where I've raised my children.  I am happy to help guide you with things to do or give any advice by phone.  I prefer to give my guest privacy so you can enjoy the house and area with your family or friends, but I am available if you need anything or help.  I will be a phone call or text away and can offer lots of ideas for fun times or if you have a specific need for foods, services or assistance of any kind.
house_rules: • Check-in time is 3PM. NO Parties at all.   No Smoking in the house, only in the garden please and not on deck.  Do not spray ANY heavy perfumes in the house, light incense is allowed and no wood burning or candles.   Cannabis smoking is allowed if you have a medical license outside in the garden only.  Also, my garden has neighbors across the alley and behind my yard so consideration with noise and voices after 9pm please.  No use of the laundry room or facilities as I store my personal items and do not want access to this very small room off the kitchen.   If you need to wash something in an emergency, I will make an exception for a one-time use. No moving of furniture inside the house, no redecorating or changing the furniture or moving of any items to other rooms please.  No removing of rugs or any chairs to other rooms or outside AT ALL please.  I have antiques that are irreplaceable.  Do not remove anything from drawers or cupboards that are not for your use and or personal item
host_about: I am a writer and artist, chef and aromatherapist so my house is a beautiful place to visit, enjoy cooking, relaxing, dining, going to the beach and just hanging out.  I live in the area and will be happy to offer catering for any private dinners & can give you tons of info of things to do and walking to all the great local destinations.  I am a traveler and have books and lots of local art in the house to soak in and all the great smells from my garden and the sea breezes.

When you are ready to explore the beauty of the Monterey coast, take a short picturesque stroll 3 blocks to stunning Asilomar State Park and coastal preserve. License #0222

notes: There are a few stair steps and tight hallways in the house so unfortunately bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible. City of Pacific Grove TUL#0222

We are less than 1 mile to downtown Pacific Grove and only a few blocks from the Pacific Grove coastal trail and Golf Links golf course. If you decide to drive, you are 5 to 10 minutes from Monterey (aquarium, fisherman's wharf, old-town) or Carmel-by-the-Sea (beach, restaurants, charming town), 20 minutes from Carmel Valley (wine tasting, hiking, sight-seeing), or 30 minutes to Big Sur (hiking, state parks, gorgeous scenery)

interaction: Please contact us by phone, email, or text at any time during your stay with any questions you have. Ed and Kristy are normally not in Pacific Grove but we have nearby helpers who can be there in person if needed.
house_rules: Thank you ahead of time for observing our house rules. The City of Pacific Grove requires hosts to obtain a permit to operate a short term rental. Our permit number is #0222. We must comply with several city imposed rules in order to keep our permit in good standing. So we are grateful to our guests for helping us maintain our permit and our ability to rent our house by following our rules. Smoking No smoking is allowed in the house or on the property. Quiet Neighborhood Guests should respect the quiet nature of the neighborhood and refrain from making excessive noise that might disturb the neighbors. The city will revoke a host's permit after two neighbor complaints. Maximum Occupancy We are permitted for at most 7 adults. Parking We are permitted for at most 3 vehicles.  Guests can park on the driveway and on the street directly in front of the house. Unfortunately, there is not sufficient parking for an RV.  Please be considerate of the neighbors by making sure their access to their
host_about:
We enjoy spending time with our family and friends, discovering new places, and re-visiting favorite travel destinations. 

We aspire to give our guests the same kind of wonderful and special experience that we love to find when we travel.

Clean up after pets please. Garbage can outside also. 8. Using microwave and hair dryer at same time may trip a circuit breaker. Breakers are outside next to chimney in small light blue box. name: Charming Asilomar Beach Retreat
summary: Bright spacious home in the pine forest, near beautiful Asilomar Beach & Conference Grounds, 1 block to Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, 12 minute walk to beach about the same to downtown Pacific Grove. Garage is ping pong table/arena, basketball hoop and outdoor fire/chiminea and sitting area.  Private master patio with koi pond, with lush gardens surrounding the property.  This is a special home with a warm happy feeling that captures the essence of this beautiful coastal area.
space: Our home is bright, clean, comfortable and spacious. The master bedroom is absolutely beautiful with Beauty Rest Black series bed (the best!), it also has a private patio with a koi pond and a luxurious bathroom with a double-headed shower. There are several areas throughout the house that are perfect for a convenient work-space.  We have a stocked game closet with super fun family-friendly games and puzzles. Oh yeah, we also have a basketball hoop and ping pong table :) and weights in the garage so you can get a little workout in if you please. The living room doubles as the music room as it features a nice upright piano, a guitar for your use, and a basket full of other instruments! We also have a beautiful desk areas in case you need to get a little work done while you are here... a very peaceful environment! We also have two very comfortable twin air mattresses if needed for either of the rooms. The family room has a super-cozy large couch, and a full surround-sound entertainment s
description: Bright spacious home in the pine forest, near beautiful Asilomar Beach & Conference Grounds, 1 block to Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, 12 minute walk to beach about the same to downtown Pacific Grove. Garage is ping pong table/arena, basketball hoop and outdoor fire/chiminea and sitting area.  Private master patio with koi pond, with lush gardens surrounding the property.  This is a special home with a warm happy feeling that captures the essence of this beautiful coastal area. Our home is bright, clean, comfortable and spacious. The master bedroom is absolutely beautiful with Beauty Rest Black series bed (the best!), it also has a private patio with a koi pond and a luxurious bathroom with a double-headed shower. There are several areas throughout the house that are perfect for a convenient work-space.  We have a stocked game closet with super fun family-friendly games and puzzles. Oh yeah, we also have a basketball hoop and ping pong table :) and weights in the garage so you can get a
neighborhood_overview: This is a super quiet area with friendly neighbors in a beautiful Monterey Pine and Cypress forest. You'll hear the sounds of the ocean everywhere, and be prepared to see lots of deer strolling the neighborhood as well as butterflies everywhere (October through March).  In downtown PG (a 15 minute walk) you'll find adorable coffee houses (we recommend La Piccola Casa), charming restaurants (PassionFish is a favorite), and a awesome bakery (Pavel's on Forest Ave).  You'll also find a darling local theatre (Lighthouse Cinemas) that shows first run movies (and has free popcorn on Mondays and $5.00 movies on Tuesdays).  Convenient walk to grocery store (Grove Market), book store, cute clothing stores and a further 5 minute walk to Lover's Point beach. Our world famous Monterey bay Aquarium is a 45 minute walk away from the house, but it is along the most spectacular coast imaginable - and you could always take a taxi home. You'll also want to take a drive through Pebble Beach on 17 mile dr
notes: We are on a quiet street a block off 17 mile Drive and a 3 minute drive (or 15 min walk) to the gates of spectacular Pebble Beach and the Inn at Spanish Bay which has outdoor fire pits where you can enjoy cocktails as you watch the sun set to the beautiful sounds of the bag piper who comes every night to bid the day farewell.  We've got a  information book full of extraordinary local adventures for you to consider ... for Pacific Grove, Carmel, Monterey and Big Sur.  After reading the book, with all the hottest spots in the area, you'll definitely want to come back! We are fully permitted through the City of Pacific Grove and hold the license #0312.
transit: A Monterey Transit bus stop is just half of a block away towards the beach.  Easy walking (or biking, if you prefer) distance to the beach and into town. Central location allows for gorgeous walks through the forested recreation trail 1/2 block away or down to the spectacular Asilomar Beach.  Uber is an easy and less expensive way to get around the area.
access: Full access to the entire property (except our storage spaces and one side yard) - including a garage with a ping pong table/arena and washer and dryer area.  The gardens are heavenly at all times of the year, and sitting outside with your cocktail or mocktail as you listen to the sounds of the ocean and breeze through the trees is quite mesmerizing.
interaction: Beyond the area information book at the entry that we prepared for you, we'd be happy to share any recommendations on dining or activities.
house_rules: To honor our neighbors we would appreciate quiet by 9:30pm outside. And absolutely no amplified music outside... it disturbs the Monarch butterflies.  Thank you so much!
host_about:
Karen and I met at Cal Berkeley and were married on Valentines Day 30 years ago. We are camping fanatics who love live music (huge David Byrne fans), all things outdoors, travel, biking and our children (Hugh and Katherine).  We have lived happily in this precious house for over 19 years and now are hitting the road for a combination of work and play!

We love this house and are so happy to be able to share this special space with other travelers!

name: Kate's Beach Cottage
summary: Charming Pacific Grove cottage in prime location,  two blocks from the Ocean, and Monterey Bay Costal Trail, and half a block to Lighthouse Ave, with easy access to many restaurants, the movie theater and shops. Walk or bike to Lover's point, the aquarium, and Cannery Row. The cottage is registered with the city of Pacific Grove for short term rental, license #0234
description: Charming Pacific Grove cottage in prime location,  two blocks from the Ocean, and Monterey Bay Costal Trail, and half a block to Lighthouse Ave, with easy access to many restaurants, the movie theater and shops. Walk or bike to Lover's point, the aquarium, and Cannery Row. The cottage is registered with the city of Pacific Grove for short term rental, license #0234 The whole house is yours to use and enjoy. There is a bus system in Monterey/Pacific Grove,but I think walking or using the bikes we provide is the best way to get around. The Monterey Coastal Trail runs for miles, with great views all the way along. We also have four bikes and two kayaks in the garage for you to use during your stay. Guests are solely responsible for accidents or injury resulting from the use of the bikes and kayaks. Big Sur, and Point Lobos marine reserve are a short drive away with fabulous hiking opportunities.

host_about:
I'm an architect, with with a background in design, land planning and historic preservation. I have a passion for nature, family, dogs, horses, travel and adventures.

My husband Tom is an ecologist, coastal biologist and park planner. Obviously, he is also a lover of nature!

Together Tom and I have painstakingly restored two historic houses in Pacific Grove... Including our 120 year old Airbnb cottage, which we started more than 30 years ago.

We've traveled the world together and separately, drawn to near and distant locations by friends,  culture, waves, and whimsy.

Airbnb hosting has allowed me to share the cottage that I love with people who enjoying it as I do. It is a genuine pleasure meeting the terrific people who visit on their adventures!

name: Little Gem @ Asilomar,Off 17 Mile Dr. 2 MBA passes
summary: Completely remodeled in 2014, perfect base from which to explore Monterey, Carmel and Big Sur!  Walk to Asilomar state beach, 700sq ft + wonderful backyard to use! Mature Oaks and pines all around. Also includes 2 Aquarium passes.
space: This cozy and stylish Pacific Grove vacation rental has a welcoming interior in a simple and functional modern style, all the comforts of home, and is less than a mile from the beach! Located in a residential neighborhood, right off of the world-famous 17-mile  Drive, and immediately outside of Pebble Beach Pacific Grove Gate, this home is just a couple blocks from multiple parks, including the Rip Van Winkle Open Space, where you can go hiking, jogging, or looking for squirrels and other resident wildlife. Even better, public beach access at Asilomar State Beach is less than a mile west! With one bedroom and one bathroom, this cozy house has everything you will need to have a wonderful stay. Have a seat on the sofa in the living room and open the curtains to let in some sunshine. Flip on the TV and stream some Netflix and HULU  or use the Blu-ray player to have a movie night. While you're here you can also use the selection of board games, and you will also have WiFi access so you can

Have a seat on the sofa in the living room and open the curtains to
neighborhood_overview: If you are looking to be in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the tourist attractions then LittleGem is probably not for you.  But if you are looking for a "Refuge by the Sea (Asilomar)" to decompress and relax and meet some friendly locals then LittleGem will be perfect for you!  The neighborhood is designated "historic" by the City of Pacific Grove with mature California Coast Live Oaks and Monterey Pines abound.
transit: Walk to Asilomar Stated Beach Bike into Pebble Beach/17 mile Drive (free) Walkable restaurants: Roy's at Spanish Bay, Fishwife, Phoebe's Cafe at Asilomar conference grounds. If you're up for a long, refreshing walk, stroll west less than a mile to get to the beach at Spanish Bay and have Brunch at Roy's restaurant, voted best in Pebble Beach in 2015! Of course, you can also drive there if you're impatient! Go ahead and sunbathe on the shore, search for interesting rocks and shells, and watch as the sunshine glistens off the rolling waves. If you work up a hunger while walking on the beach, you will find many amazing restaurants in town. Whether you're in the mood for breakfast or lunch fare at the well-loved First Awakenings, more upscale fresh seafood at Passion fish, or something else, you'll find plenty of restaurants, bakeries, and cafes to keep you happy. Nearby are several golf courses, so if you like to golf you can check out the oceanfront Links at Spanish Bay, just down the ro
access: Entire house, front yard and backyard.
interaction: This is our vacation home, so we will not be there when you are, but we are always one call/text/email away!
house_rules: 2 nights min. 3 nights min. for long weekends. No Pets. No Parties. Noise ordinance after 10pm.

name: Gable Room - Seven Gables Full-Service Inn
summary: The Gable Room used to be the big play attic of the house and is the only room on the third and top floor of the Main House with windows on all 4 sides and ocean views from 2 sides. The room features gables with many interesting nooks and angles. Very private, very fun! The bed is a luxurious tempurpedic-type King draped with a partial wall canopy. Additional features include a romantic state-of-the art electric fireplace and a private, full, shower-only tiled bathroom with a small refrigerator in the room. The colors of this room are soft blues, golds and creams. Please note the 6' height limitation in this room. The walls slant down from the many gables. The room holds a maximum of 2 guests, including adults and children over 12. This room is NOT suitable for children under 12.

host_about:
The Seven Gables Inn is personally managed by our family. Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982. Since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Inn keeping. For all reservation questions please feel free to send me a message as I will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total twenty five individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom. Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. Each room comes with complimentary all day coffee and tea.

Every morning, savor the freshly brewed coffee and generous breakfast served in the oceanfront dining room, a specialty at our Inn. Our chefs arrive at five in the morning to make our wonderful breakfasts from scratch using the freshest local ingredients. The breakfast room itself is perched over the coastline so our guests can enjoy the view of Monterey Bay. 

In the afternoon, complimentary wine and cheese is served. Wines from local, Central Coast vineyards are paired with a variety of tasty hard and soft cheeses. In addition, we serve a variety of fruits and vegetables with custom made dips and, of course, our signature Seven Gables Inn fudge.

Complimentary evening turn down service is provided for our guests. At 8pm each evening, freshly baked cookies are placed in the main lobby along with ice cold milk for our guests before they head to bed. 

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, Susan Flatley Wheelwright, Ed Flatley and JR Wheelwright

summary: Three bedroom, three bath home, with isolated third bedroom and bath. Spacious, fully fenced backyard with large deck, outdoor dining, croquet and barbecue. Completely updated gourmet kitchen.  Easy access to shopping, beach and downtown PG. Licensed by the City of Pacific Grove, License # 0276
space: 3 separate bedrooms, each with its own bath.  One bedroom has a king bed, one a queen and one a trundle bed which converts into two twins.  Bathrooms are all updated with new tile/granite and amenities.  Gourmet kitchen with new stainless steel Bosch appliances, great for cooking gourmet meals during your stay.  Kitchen looks out on spacious, lush backyard and adjoining deck, perfect for afternoon reading and barbecues.  House is located near the Pacific Grove Trader Joes' with shopping and great restaurants within easy walking distance.  Spanish Bay and Asilomar Beach are about a miles walk, as is downtown Pacific Grove.  Easy drive to Monterey, Carmel and Carmel Valley.
