Such beauty, so many things to do, so many events, so many fine restaurants.  We hope you enjoy it!

Looking for a fun place to go for live music or great food close-by? Just ask.

name: Steps away from Lover's Point beach
summary: This cozy little beach house has everything you need for a carefree, peaceful vacation.  Complete with ocean view and just a short stroll to  the beach,   restaurants,  coastline rec trail, Cannery Row and charming little town of Pacific Grove. ...................  Special Offers:   May- 2018 -     May 9 & 10 only,3 night min waived; 2 night min applies July - 2018       July 13 & 14 only, 3 night min waived; 2 night min applies
space: This cozy little beach house is just steps away from the ocean.  Located in the area of the Monterey Bay Sanctuary, it is teeming with seabirds and marine mammals.  Ninety-four seabird species are known to occur regularly within and in the vicinity of the Sanctuary, including Brown Pelicans, Pacific Loons,  Storks and Cormorants.   The Sanctuary also has one of the most diverse and abundant assemblages of marine mammals in the world, including, whales, dolphins, porpoises, seals, sea lions and sea otters.  A  view of the bay is offered from the living room windows along with occasional sightings of whales dolphins, porpoises sea lions or sea otters playing or swimming by.  On some evenings, you can catch the moon rising over the bay casting  magical moonlight over the water.  The "Sans Souci" (without cares) is on a quiet street but not without the occasional chirps, peeps and squawks of sea birds, barking sea lions or squeaky sea otters and the sound of ocean waves. summary: This home is in great clean condition and sets in a very peaceful environment on about a half acre. The beach is less than 15 minutes walk to the west, north, and east! You can hear the surf from the back porch. Also, previously listed (Hidden by Airbnb) property 453128
space: This home is in great clean condition and sets in a very peaceful environment on about a half acre. The beach is less than 15 minutes walk to the west, north, and east! You can hear the surf from the back porch. A favorite walk to the beach is thru the Asilomar Conference Center grounds, with Julia Morgan (Hearst Castle) architecture and plenty of deer. There is a playground about a block away. In addition to Monterey area events (Golf, car shows, Laguna Seca raceway, Big Sur Marathon) Pacific Grove had many unique, small town events thru out the year.  (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: Comfortable home in the pines
summary: This is the closest Airbnb to Carmel. Short distance from downtown Pacific Grove. Near Asilomar Beach, Pebble Beach, Monterey, Big Sur. Peer through the pines for a peek across Monterey Bay to Pleasure Point in Santa Cruz, enjoying sunset.
space: Quiet, family-friendly neighborhood. 1300 sq ft, 2 bed/1 bath home plus a delightful and completely separate garden unit with private bath on the top tier of our terraced backyard.  It's a spacious home for Pacific Grove. Built in 1958 with slumpstone brick adobe and beam ceilings, the layout has a retro feel to it. Local artists adorn the walls. Comfortable kitchen and dining area.  Full set of pots, pans, utensils.  Laundry available, detergent provided.  Bathrooms are fully equipped. Childproofing, high chair, children's supplies available upon request. Outdoor patio with table and chiminea fireplace in central courtyard.  Budding native plant/herb gardens in front and back yards.  Peeks of sunset views across the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary between the trees on a clear day. Listen for the waves breaking in the distance. We recently made several upgrades to our home, including new lighting with dimmer switches, new heaters that are cool to the touch (safe for kids), new h

neighborhood_overview: A home in a family-friendly neighborhood among the pines just across the hill from beautiful Carmel-by-the-Sea and within walking distance to Pebble Beach. It's a quick 3-minute drive to downtown Pacific Grove or Asilomar beach.  Grocery stores, restaurants, and all the conveniences are a stone's throw away.  At night, after watching a colorful sunset with peeks of Monterey Bay, watch the fog roll in and listen to the waves crashing off nearby Asilomar Beach.
notes: The monarch butterflies visit from November through March.  Different whale species migrate throughout the year, including a pack of resident orcas.  Destination adventure ideas provided in welcome book. Unique suggestions from us locals. Transient Use License #0294 from the City of Pacific Grove.
transit: Near the Country Club Gate of Pebble Beach, historic Asilomar Conference Center, Monarch Grove Sanctuary, the Pacific Grove Lighthouse.   Close to bus stop for Line 2. Car rental available at airport, 15 minute drive. $10 uber to downtown Carmel. Near Highway One for short trips to Carmel, the wineries of Carmel Valley, Point Lobos State Park (i.e. crown jewel of the state park system).  And then there's Big Sur.
access: Access to the entire house and gardens except the garage and some cabinets/closet. Parking available in driveway for two cars.
interaction: The entire house is yours. We will be staying nearby so if you need special attention there's a possibility we can interact more than the baseline, which is that you will have privacy. Check the welcome book for more info and recommendations.
house_rules: Please respect our home while enjoying our space. Remove your shoes when you enter the house. No pets. Let us know about any problems or if something is broken so that we can replace or repair it. Smoking allowed outside. Please throw away your cig butts!
host_about: Lives in Pacific Grove, California. World traveler, musician, yogi, mother. Delights in picnics and outdoor adventures.

name: Sea Lion House, Walk to Beach/Shops/Aquarium
summary: Come stay at our restored craftsman home in downtown PG with views of the Pacific. Improvements for 2018 include new carpets and newly remodeled bathrooms!  It's a short walk to the ocean, beaches, great shops and restaurants in delightful downtown Pacific Grove.  Huge master suite with ocean views. 15 minute walk to the aquarium or a 5 minute drive to Pebble Beach and "17 Mile Drive."   Unlike most large homes in the area, we don't charge extra for additional people! This is a historic beauty.
space: A bottle of California wine and original photographs of sea lions, otters, whales and harbor seals greet you at this beautifully restored, custom craftsman home. “Sea Lion House,” as we like to call it, was built in 1916 and has been carefully maintained over the years.  The original, vintage O’Keefe range still cooks up great meals in the recently remodeled kitchen (with soapstone counters and warm cork flooring).  Hard wood floors and the original hard wood paneling adorn the living room and dining room.  There are 3 bedrooms, including a huge master suite with a 2nd sitting area, high ceilings and views of the ocean. There is an extra room upstairs set up as a play area for the kids.  The house has 2 ½ bathrooms and the front bathroom has the original claw foot tub too!
description: Come stay at our restored craftsman home in downtown PG with views of the Pacific. Improvements for 2018 include new carpets and newly remodeled bathrooms!  It's a short walk to the ocean, beaches, great shops and restaurants in delightful downtown Pacific Grove.  Huge master suite with ocean views. 15 minute walk to the aquarium or a 5 minute drive to Pebble Beach and "17 Mile Drive."   Unlike most large homes in the area, we don't charge extra for additional people! This is a historic beauty. A bottle of California wine and original photographs of sea lions, otters, whales and harbor seals greet you at this beautifully restored, custom craftsman home. “Sea Lion House,” as we like to call it, was built in 1916 and has been carefully maintained over the years.  The original, vintage O’Keefe range still cooks up great meals in the recently remodeled kitchen (with soapstone counters and warm cork flooring).  Hard wood floors and the original hard wood paneling adorn the living room and d
neighborhood_overview: At “Sea Lion House” you’re in the heart of Pacific Grove – close to everything – the ocean, Lovers Point Beach, boutiques, restaurants, cafes, deli, bakery, movie theater.  It’s all walking distance from the house, which is one of the things we enjoy most about it!  The neighborhood is a quiet residential neighborhood with many long-time residents.   Please note that everyone in your group will need to respect the Pacific Grove quiet hours (after 10pm), as many of the neighbors work early in the morning.  The Monterey Bay Aquarium is less than a mile away.  Carmel and the golf courses of Pebble Beach are a short 10-15 minute drive away.
notes: The sofa bed in the master suite is a European style bed that is made of two firm twin mattresses (no lumps or bumps!) that can be combined to make a queen.  Extra linens and blankets are provided.  We now offer the same Monterey Bay Aquarium discounts that local hotels offer.  Just ask and we can send you a link where you can purchase 2 for 1 tickets.  (Beware:  the use of local owners' guest passes is strictly against the Aquarium's rules.) The beds, linens and furniture in Sea Lion House are new or beautiful antiques (purchased in 2016-2017). There are Hotel Collection towels and high thread count sheets.  There is also a hot-water shower outside in the enclosed back yard to warm up in and to clean up those sandy toes after an outing to the beach or the local tide pools.  Beach chairs and beach towels are also provided! We have a new gas Barbecue grill at the house.  We ask that guests clean the grill (using the scraper provided) and ensure the gas is turned off immediately after us
transit: It’s just a few short blocks to the ocean and the promenade that enables Pacific Grove visitors to walk / run / bike / skate for miles along the shore between Cannery Row, the Aquarium and the beautiful, protected Lovers’ Point.  And even less (2 short blocks) to the shops, award- winning restaurants, galleries, cafés and movie theater of downtown Pacific Grove. By car, the historic adobes and wharf of Monterey are a few minutes drive north.  The Point Pinos Lighthouse, tide pools, Asilomar beaches and Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary are just a few minutes drive to the west.  Pebble Beach, Carmel and the spectacular coast of Big Sur are 10 min., 15 min., and 30 minutes drive, respectively.
access: You’ll have full run of the house, enclosed garden and 2-car garage (with laundry room).  We trust that you’ll care for our house, while you're there, with the same love and attention that we give to it.
interaction: We’re locals and huge fans of Monterey Bay and so provide lots of information and directions about local attractions, golf courses, beaches, restaurants and seasonal festivals. We’re also happy to provide specific recommendations to help make your stay at the Sea Lion House spectacular.  We know you’ll love it at the house as much as we do!
house_rules: * No conversations outside after 10 p.m.  PG is a quiet residential town with strict “quiet hours.”   * Parties (e.g. gatherings of five (5) people or more, not including tenants) are not permitted. * No pets allowed. * No smoking of any kind permitted. * There is a $50 charge for keys that are not returned.  (We recommend putting the keys back in the lock box whenever you leave the house, so they don’t get lost or forgotten in a pocket or a purse.) * Warning:  Parking in the garage is not recommended.  The driveway is steep and the garage doors are large and heavy and open outwards towards cars parked in the driveway.  There is significant risk of damage to vehicles from the garage doors. Always put your car in park (or in a gear) and firmly apply the emergency brake. *  The stove and the oven are original from the 1930’s.  Although it is in exceptionally good condition, it is vintage and should be treated with care.  There are 4 gas burners, one oven, with a warming rack below.  Plea
host_about: Hello, I'm your host, Christine, of Sea Lion Properties, LLC.  I'm a California native who lived in Europe (in Germany to be specific) for many years.  I work in the tech industry in the heart of Silicon Valley, but I love traveling and have stayed in many vacation homes around the world, enjoying the opportunity to have the extra space and a functional kitchen that a "real home" offers.  I love to cook and to bake and have therefore stocked Sea Lion House with the cooking tools I use. You'll want to bring all your own food though.  My other "passion" is the ocean. I'm an avid SCUBA diver and photographer and hope that you'll enjoy my original photographs around the house.  Almost all the pictures of marine mammals were taken right here in the Monterey Bay or the Elkhorn Slough (accessible from Moss Landing just a 20 min drive north of PG).

name: "Coastal Getaway"- Close to Everything
summary: Recently Listed and Perfectly situated, "Coastal Getaway" is located just 2-1/2 blocks to beautiful Monterey Bay and five blocks to quaint, downtown Pacific Grove… "America's Last Home Town". * Please Note: Minimum 5-night stay during Pebble Beach Car Week (Concours d'Elegance August 14-21, 2017)!!
space: Perfectly situated "Coastal Getaway" is located in a quiet neighborhood just 2-1/2 blocks to the beautiful Monterey Bay and five blocks to the quaint downtown of Pacific Grove… "America's Last Home Town". This property is new on the market and available now.  Enter the front door to a warm, comfortable, two-level town home with a well-equipped kitchen offering seating for six. Prepare a gourmet meal or a quick snack while enjoying conversation with friends and family. Just down the hallway is the living room with a large screen television, a dvd player, an electric fireplace and a cozy reading nook under the skylight.  The adjacent laundry room has a washer and dryer with laundry supplies for your convenience. A 1/2 bath is conveniently situated downstairs just off the kitchen. The two bedrooms are located upstairs and feature Queen size beds with sunny rooms and great views of the neighborhood and beautiful oaks that surround the property - you'll feel like you are in the treetops. notes: The property is in close proximity to great restaurants, shops, entertainment and of course the bay. Walk to the world famous Monterey Bay Aquarium, take in a round of golf or attend one of the numerous events, concerts, car week or other Monterey Peninsula attractions. There is always something going on here!
transit: Public transportation is very good and access is close by - just blocks away!
access: This property is a Duplex with a great advantage... nobody is above or below you. There are rear and front decks exclusively for your use and the location is centrally located to all great P.G. attractions.
interaction: Both Kelly and Bill are available to answer your questions about the local area. Please do not hesitate to call us at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) or at (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) .
house_rules: Upon arrival please review the Home Manual. Within the manual you will find internet access log in and pass codes. Also listed are some very basic requests and rules we ask that our guest abide by. This property is licensed by the City of Pacific Grove and as such is held to a high standard to make your stay with us a pleasant one. We have a maximum of six overnight guests unless previous written authorization is granted. We want you to enjoy your stay and we want the next guests to also enjoy their stay so please be courteous and leave the place as you would want it left for you. *Check-in is 4:00PM or later. Sorry, no early check-ins. ** NO PARTIES OR EVENTS ARE TO BE HELD AT THE PROPERTY DUE TO THE CITY OF PACIFIC GROVE'S STRICT SHORT-TERM RENTAL ORDINANCES.

name: 1/2 Block to Ocean-Sea View Cottage: 2 Bedroom Suite - Seven Gables Full Service Inn
summary: Very Private & Luxurious! Sea View Cottage is a historic, fully renovated, 1100 sq. ft. (100 sq. m) two bedroom cottage for up to 4 persons. Enjoy views of Lover's Point beach and ocean from the living room area. Everything you need for an extended getaway.  A crystal chandelier in the living room compliments the wonderful marble-top dining table and a carved walnut fireplace mantel with a gas-log fireplace. The cottage also includes a 47" flat screen HD TV with Blue Ray DVD, wet bar with refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. A set of French doors opens from both bedrooms into a private deck area and secret garden. The large Master Bedroom has a Pillow-top King bed, a gas-log fireplace, high ceilings, partial canopy above the bed and spacious private tub/shower bathroom. The smaller Second Bedroom has a Pillow-top King bed, high ceilings, partial canopy above the bed, private tub/shower bathroom and a bright eastern exposure. Please note that the room rate is based on up to 4 perso
space: Beautifully furnished, completely modern historic house that can accommodate up to 4 persons.  Included in rate is an expanded Continental breakfast overlooking Lover's Point Cove.  Also included is wine/cheese presentation for 2 hours from 4-6pm each day and cookies and milk in the evening.

access: Guests have full access to main Lobby area from 8am-10pm.
interaction: Staff are on site from 8am-10pm every day to answer questions, assist with dinner reservations and any travel arrangements that guests may need.
host_about:
The Seven Gables Inn is personally managed by our family. Our Inn welcomed its first guests in 1982. Since then, we have enjoyed every aspect of Inn keeping. For all reservation questions please feel free to send me a message as I will respond as soon as possible. 

We boast a total twenty five individually decorated guest rooms, each with their own private bathroom. Every one of our lovely rooms have views of the Monterey Bay and the beautiful Monterey Peninsula coastline. Each room comes with complimentary all day coffee and tea.

Every morning, savor the freshly brewed coffee and generous breakfast served in the oceanfront dining room, a specialty at our Inn. Our chefs arrive at five in the morning to make our wonderful breakfasts from scratch using the freshest local ingredients. The breakfast room itself is perched over the coastline so our guests can enjoy the view of Monterey Bay. 

In the afternoon, complimentary wine and cheese is served. Wines from local, Central Coast vineyards are paired with a variety of tasty hard and soft cheeses. In addition, we serve a variety of fruits and vegetables with custom made dips and, of course, our signature Seven Gables Inn fudge.

Complimentary evening turn down service is provided for our guests. At 8pm each evening, freshly baked cookies are placed in the main lobby along with ice cold milk for our guests before they head to bed. 

We gladly anticipate the wishes of our guests and endeavor to make your visit to Seven Gables Inn one that you will always remember. 

—Your hosts, Susan Flatley Wheelwright, Ed Flatley and JR Wheelwright

name: Quaint Coastal Cottage ~ Close to town and beach
summary: This darling, turn-of-the-century farmhouse sits just three blocks up from downtown Lighthouse Ave, with hilltop views of the ocean. The original farmhouse was separated into two beautiful living spaces. This is the upstairs cottage, Le Mistral. It is newly renovated and available for your next beach vacation.
space: Light and air surround you in this cozy upstairs cottage — affectionately named Le Mistral, after the cleansing winds in the South of France that attracted French impressionists for the beauty they created  and the reputation of good health they brought to travelers. Here you will enjoy beauty, relaxation, and refreshing sea-breezes in this two-bedroom cottage filled with comfort and charm.  The central location is perfect for a half-mile walk to downtown Pacific Grove, a one-mile stroll to Lover's Point Beach, and three quarter miles to The famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row. The Monterey Bay coastal trail is just six blocks down the hill and stretches for miles along the beautiful central coast.  Two unique bedrooms offer plenty of sleeping space for up to four guests. The sunny kitchen is the perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee and views of the ocean. It is fully stocked, with everything you need for an enjoyable night in.  The living room provides an inviting place

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove offers an unparalleled quality of life. Sharing borders with the Monterey Bay, City of Monterey, Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, our town offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. We are known for our small-town hospitality and friendliness in a place we simply call 'P.G.' (from The City of Pacific Grove website)
notes: The city of Pacific Grove is very strict about occupancy and limiting guest activity while renting a short term rental. Under no circumstances could a party, get together or gathering be hosted at the cottage during the rental period. ~This property is a short-term vacation rental, licensed through the City of Pacific Grove, Lic. # 301. All short term rental rules apply and maximum occupancy of four people total is strictly enforced ~Parents please note that the cottage has a free-standing gas fireplace and an open staircase. Care should be taken when traveling with small children.  ~The cottage is a smoke-free/vape free property ~The cottage has a firm no pet policy
transit: The location has something to offer everyone—As stated earlier, the quaint downtown of Pacific Grove is just a half-mile stroll down the street.  A less than 20-minute walk in the other direction takes you to historic Cannery Row and The Monterey Bay Aquarium. Historic downtown Monterey and Fisherman's Wharf offer a peak into the past and several dining options. The beautiful beach and the Monterey Coastal Trail are six blocks down the hill from the cottage. Hikers, runners, and bikers can enjoy miles of trails that lead to Asilomar State Beach, Carmel, the Big Sur coastline, and beyond.
access: Guests of Le Mistral will access the cottage through a keyless entry system. You will be given a guest door code, specific to your rental dates, that will be used by all guests in your group during your stay. This allows for added safety and piece of mind. There is no need to carry a key or be worried of getting locked out.
interaction: Guests can reach us with any questions throughout their stay, by simply calling or texting either one of us. A detailed contact list is also located in the cottage.
house_rules: SHORT TERM RENTAL AGREEMENT Le Mistral Monterey Ave., Pacific Grove, CA 93950 This agreement made is binding for the duration of the reservation (check-in date through check-out date) between the “Travelers" (hereinafter called the Tenants) and Michael Gray (hereinafter called the Landlord) concerning the short term rental of the property located on Monterey Ave., Pacific Grove, CA 93950 Total people in the renting party shall not exceed four (4) people, which includes children and infants.   Rental period begins at 3:00pm on check-in date and terminates at 11:00am on check-out date Total Rental Amount is specified in the reservation booking. Tenants agree to the Payment Schedule specified in the reservation booking. Terms of the Agreement:  1. The Landlord have the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Te
host_about: We want to welcome you to our favorite place on earth, our home by the sea. Here, life is slower and relaxation is found. We hope you fall in love with the comfort and serenity of this place, as we have.

name: Bright Family Home Near Asilomar Beach & Park 0318
summary: This is our eclectic full-time family home (City Lic #0318).  Our place is very close to Asilomar Beach (walking distance), George Washington park (across the street), 17-Mile Drive, and trails.  There are many family-friendly activities and restaurants downtown, all within walking/biking distance. You'll love the forest across the street, plus the chickens in the backyard!  We also have a piano, games, and beach toys (upon request).  Great for families with kids.
space: Our home is a little paradise with a very private backyard, complete with a great swing, a play structure, a chicken coop, and a small garden.  We even have a handmade ping pong table outside for your enjoyment.  Our house is surrounded by majestic oak and pine trees.  George Washington Park is directly across the street with a baseball field, a playground, and trails to walk in.  One block down is 17-Mile Drive, which is a great street to ride bikes on (for adults).  About 3 blocks away and through the Asilomar Conference grounds, you can walk to beautiful Asilomar Beach (0.7 mile, 12 min walk).  Fishwife Restaurant is also very close to the house (near Asilomar Beach).  Downtown Pacific Grove (15 min. walk) with lots of restaurants, movie theater, library, and park are also walking or biking distance away.  Walk on the beautiful trail around the tip of the peninsula along the coast starting at Asilomar Beach, or walk/ride on the coast trail from Lovers Point closer to downtown Pacifi

neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet neighborhood with plenty of trees and forestland.  Lot of trails nearby.  Could walk into Pebble Beach via trails either at Rip Van Winkle Park or the trail behind the Fishwife restaurant.  Trail through a neighborhood near Crocker Avenue.  Walk to Spanish Bay (Roy's deck) through Pebble Beach or on the Asilomar boardwalk.  Bonfires on Asilomar (0.7 mile/ 12 min. walk) on the Pebble Beach side is okay.  Playground and park across the street.  Walk to downtown (15 min. walk), or even to the movie theater!
notes: Our front and back yards are not manicured.  We do own a cockapoo (cocker spaniel-poodle mix), which is a non-shedding hypoallergenic dog.  The dog will not be on the premises when you stay in the house.
transit: Bus stop 1 block away.  Many things within walking or biking distance.  Uber/taxi  is also available if you don't have a car
access: Full use of entire house, including kitchen and washing machine, and backyard.
interaction: We will most likely be out of town, but are available via cell phone and our liaison.
house_rules: - Must be a family with children. - Please be quiet in the neighborhood. - Please be mindful of kids indoor and outdoor toys, and kid bikes. -  We also have a play structure in our large backyard.  You are responsible for your child's safety in the backyard and house. - Please be tolerant of normal imperfections of a family home. This is a full-time home with kids. House will be professionally cleaned, but we appreciate flexibility and tolerance as well.  It is a 1950's home in Pacific Grove, but it is our beloved home.   - You may interact with our chickens, but please be gentle with our birds!

name: Chautauqua Room - Seven Gables Full Service Inn
summary: The Chautauqua Room is on the ground level of the Beach House on the same level as the Breakfast Room and the garden/parking area. A bay window in this room looks west with a small ground level side view looking out at the ocean. The room has 2 entrances: one from the interior entry of the Beach House and a private outside entrance from the garden/parking area. The bed is a Pillow-top Queen draped with partial canopy. Additional features include an elegant crystal chandelier, small armoire, and elegant maple hardwood flooring. This is our handicapped accessible room with private full tub/shower combination bathroom done in beige marble. The colors of this room are rich greens, deep burgundy reds, and rich paisleys. Please note this room is slightly elevated above the garden level. Guests circulating the Inn will pass by this room at the garden level. The room holds a maximum of 2 guests, including adults and children. This room is suitable for children under 12.  Child Waiver signature

name: Romantic Private  Master Suite & Gardens #0427
summary: 2 Aquarium passes $100 value! Private entrance to your romantic very spacious master suite with 9 windows for viewing bay, night lights, boats, sea life (even whales) from tilt up master king bed. 2 comfy chairs for sipping champagne to celebrate or enjoying morning coffee watching whale boats. Dining table for two!Huge private bath w/shower for two with views! mini fridge,microwave,coffee pot,40’ TV,washer&dryer,private stone patio garden w/fountain,BBQ & dining table. Quiet neighborhood!
space: We are listed as private room, but it is definitely your own space and you do not have to enter or go through any shared space to get to your space.  We couldn't list it as a private unit, because the interior walls are attached to the main house.  You would not hear us in the house, unless we were in the kitchen and your bedroom door was open, then you could hear us some.  We have no children to make noise living with us and no animals. There is also no traffic noise.   You are going to love it!

There is also no traffic noise.   You are going to love it! You
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very quiet with mostly retired people living here.  The lots and space is larger than most downtown properties.  We do not have parking issues like downtown does and we do not have Ocean View street noise as we are off that main street.  We have a lovely natural park strip next to us.  There is always plenty of parking.  There is a walking trail along the beach/bay you will love walking to town and to the aquarium.  It is the nicest walk in Pacific Grove and along the ocean. We are 3/4 miles from  Lovers Point with two nice restaurants, two smaller cafes, bbq area and tables.  We are 1 mile from downtown Pacific Grove, a very quaint little town with lots of fine restaurants.  We are about 2 miles from the aquarium.  Because the walk is so beautiful and lovely, you most likely will want to walk there.  Walking in such beauty feels like just a few steps.  Lots of places to sit and relax along the way and take in the ocean, harbor seals, and sea otters, not to mention
transit: There is a city bus on Del Monte about 1 block away.  Also urber is another option.  You can rent bikes and cute little cars to get around in as well.
access: Your access is an office private entrance downstairs, and upstairs is your suite.  Your suite with bath is the only room upstairs.  Very private.
interaction: If we are here, we will greet you and answer any questions you might have.  The rest of your stay, you probably will never see us.  But, just text us and we will answer questions.  We love people and having guests, but we also respect that most people love their privacy and prefer to be left alone.
house_rules: - Private entrance & private upstairs master suite.  Washer/dryer, mini fridge, microwave, coffee pot included.  Downstairs office shared & 2nd patio picture not included shared. - This is our home and we love it.  Please respect our property.  Thank you!
host_about: We love to hike, walk along the water, wine & dine, and have friends to our home.  We have been running a bed and breakfast for our friends every since we moved to Pacific Grove, just not for profit! Ha ha.  People love to come to our area and our home, and we love it too!  We have traveled all over Europe several times and love Southern Germany & the Alps.  Especially hiking there, the people and the friendliness.  We do say thought that the hardest thing about living where we do is "Where do you go for vacation?"  We just like it here so much. We are California natives so can tell you much about all of Cali.  I love to plan itinneraries for our friends and guest especially day trips to Big Sur.

name: QUAINT PACIFIC GROVE/PEBBLE BEACH
summary: Immaculate master queen bedroom/bath AND at request, twin bedroom/private separate bath in quaint Pacific Grove.  *Second rm would be available for additional fee of $20 per person including children after 2 which must be Family.Walk to Pacific Grove, Cannery Row, Monterey Bay or drive to Carmel or Big Sur which is only 30 mi. New smart TV in master bedroom.  No TV in twin. Air bed for twin or master. License #0306
space: Our home is on a small, quiet street.  The bedroom you will be staying in is on the second floor;  a master Bedroom/bathroom and a bedroom with two twin beds with a bath across the hall.  Both available if you are a family.  There is a $20 fee for each additional person, including children. Each bedroom has three windows, and is light and airy with hardwood floors and travertine tiles in the bath.  The master bath is large, has two sinks with a bath tub, and an amazing shower.  Lots of mirrors makes it great if you are dressing for a special event.  There are wonderful local restaurants in Pacific Grove as our kitchen is being repaired. Carmel, Monterey, Cannery Row and Pebble Beach or drive down the Pacific Coast Highway to The Big Sur River Inn on the Great Pacific Coast Highway (30 mi). description: Immaculate master queen bedroom/bath AND at request, twin bedroom/private separate bath in quaint Pacific Grove.  *Second rm would be available for additional fee of $20 per person including children after 2 which must be Family.Walk to Pacific Grove, Cannery Row, Monterey Bay or drive to Carmel or Big Sur which is only 30 mi. New smart TV in master bedroom.  No TV in twin. Air bed for twin or master. License #0306 Our home is on a small, quiet street.  The bedroom you will be staying in is on the second floor;  a master Bedroom/bathroom and a bedroom with two twin beds with a bath across the hall.  Both available if you are a family.  There is a $20 fee for each additional person, including children. Each bedroom has three windows, and is light and airy with hardwood floors and travertine tiles in the bath.  The master bath is large, has two sinks with a bath tub, and an amazing shower.  Lots of mirrors makes it great if you are dressing for a special event.  There are wonderful local
neighborhood_overview: We live on a lovely cul-de-sac street in Pacific Grove which is quiet and cozy.  One block away is the the bus stop.  Two blocks away is Forest Ave. (highway 68) which, if you turn left will take you straight to Ocean Ave., the Ocean.  Turn right and you can walk or drive the trail to Cannery Row, Fisherman's Warf and Monterey.  Turn right and it will take you to Asilomar, Pebble Beach, Carmel and eventually Big Sur.  Please park in our driveway.
notes: Our home is clean, quiet and peaceful.  Our kitchen is out of order but there are tons of great restaurants in Pacific Grove, Monterey, Cannery Row, Fisherman’s Warf, and Carmel.  All fun places to go!
transit: Our bus is just a block away!
access: There is a parking spot for you in our driveway!
interaction: We love greeting our guests and then we are quiet hosts unless you need us.
house_rules: Absolutely No Smoking!  Owner has lung disease.   We have a parking spot for you in our driveway.   Kitchen is temporarily out of use.  Lots of great restaurants just blocks from the house.   One queen bed in master bedroom with ensuite master bathroom, two twin beds in separate bedroom with separate bathroom and 1 air bed.  $20 per person after first 2 people.  Second bedroom must be used by family members.  We are usually home for check-in.  If not we will text you.
host_about:
My husband and I are retired educators.  We are quiet people renting a Master Bedroom and Bathroom in the second floor of our home.  There is no kitchen as our kitchen is under construction, however,  there is a microwave and refrigerator in the room.   Pacific Grove is beautiful and there are great restaurants in town or in Cannery Row.  We are close to the Monterey Bay, and the Aquarium voted the best in the country.  Additionally next to the Aquarium is historic Steinbeck's Cannery Row.  Pacific Grove offers fine restaurants and a quaint downtown, all within walking distance.  We also live less than a mile from Pebble Beach, Spanish Bay's AT&T's Golf Tournament and only 30 miles from Big Sur, one of the most scenic drives is the world.  Visit Monterey and shop Carmel if you have time!  Time Zone  America/San Francisco  WI FI 
H

name: Ocean views and perfect sunsets
summary: This is perfect setting for a peaceful get-away. This unit is located in a small complex of only 14 units. It is quiet and a short 5-minute walk from the ocean, close to downtown Pacific Grove and a shuttle ride (or 20 minute walk) from Monterey. Great for couples and families (with kids) alike.
space: Gorgeous ocean views while you have your breakfast! The Townhouse is a 2 story unit that offers 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The lower level offers a Master bedroom with a King-size bed, a flat panel TV with built-in DVD player and plenty of closet space. Just down the hall is the guest bedroom which offers a Queen-size bed. The lower level bathroom is full size and offers both a shower/tub combination and a hairdryer for your convenience. The upper level offers a spacious living room with a Lazy Boy sofa-sleeper, dining area, built-in gas fireplace and a second TV with built-in DVD player. The kitchen is fully equipped with all full size appliances and a microwave. Perfect for families or groups traveling together. This townhouse can easily accommodate 4-6 people. Strict no-smoking, no-pet policy.

name: Guest House 5 minutes to Asilomar and Pebble Beach
summary: Lic #0335.  Peacefully located 3 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from Asilomar State Park, we are also a 1 mile stroll from historic downtown Pacific Grove. Amenities include a quiet forested neighborhood, a peek of ocean from the bedroom and 800 sq. ft. of living area. The living room features high ceilings, fireplace and quilts for cozy evenings, and paintings by local artists. Our 1/2 acre wooded lot includes apple trees and raised beds for vegetables, and white tailed deer are everywhere!
space: Centrally located for the pleasures of the Monterey Peninsula, we are five blocks from the entrance to Pebble Beach, and ten minutes drive to the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row.  Carmel  and Monterey's Fisherman's Wharf are both close by, and Big Sur is a breathtaking one hour drive down the coast.
description: Lic #0335.  Peacefully located 3 blocks from the beach and 2 blocks from Asilomar State Park, we are also a 1 mile stroll from historic downtown Pacific Grove. Amenities include a quiet forested neighborhood, a peek of ocean from the bedroom and 800 sq. ft. of living area. Your area includes a large living room with a gas fireplace and cable TV with "on demand" movies; a fully equipped kitchen (including:  stove; dishwasher; microwave; coffee maker; cooking uten
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is located in a pine and oak forest.  Between us and the shoreline (about a block away) is a row of sand dunes that shelters our garden from the winds off the ocean.  The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful, with very little traffic..  Asilomar State Park and Conference Grounds (and the Asilomar beach) is just around the corner, and the historic Point Pinos Lighthouse (built in 1855) is also an easy 15 minute walk away. The Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, which give Pacific Grove its title of "Butterfly Town USA" is right in our neighborhood and just a ten minute stroll from our place.
notes: There is a $250 security deposit for this rental.  We are sure that you will respect, and take good care of, our home while you are visiting us.  However, any damages, on-demand movie rentals, long distance phone calls or other expenses incurred by you while staying with us will be deducted from the security deposit. We have a Transient Use License from the City of Pacific Grove (#0335).  We must ensure that our rental complies with the City regulations that apply to this license.
transit: Local Bus Service: There is a bus stop for Monterey Salinas Transit two minutes from our front door.  As you walk out our driveway, turn left and walk to the intersection of Crocker Avenue and Pico Avenue.  Turn right on Pico Avenue and the bus stop bench is just a few steps on the right hand side.  Bus schedule information can be accessed by cal(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). There is also local taxi  and Uber service available.
access: Your area includes a large living room with a gas fireplace and cable TV with "on demand" movies; a fully equipped kitchen (including:  stove; dishwasher; microwave; coffee maker; cooking utensils; silverware; dishes; spices; condiments; etc.); a dining room with seating for four, a desk area and a book exchange library; bathroom with a tub/shower and extra towels; and a bedroom with a queen sized bed and a peek of the ocean.  Outside, there is an extensive garden area which includes seating next to the lemon tree.  There is off-street parking for one car, and you will have your own private entrance to the guest house. Guests have wifi access in any of the rooms of the guest house.
interaction: We greet our guests upon arrival to deliver keys and to give a brief tour of the guest house.   During your stay, we will be easy to contact if you have questions, but our guests have complete privacy. You can reach us by land-line phone at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) and by cell phone at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) or (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).  You are welcome to call between 8 am and 10 pm with questions.  Of course, if there is a true emergency, call any time.   We also check our (EMAIL HIDDEN)   If you can’t reach us in an emergency, our daughter (Audrey) lives in Pacific Grove.  Her cell phone number is (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).

name: Dolphin House * cozy fireplace  * great location
summary: Dolphin House is a quaint, light-filled beach house centrally located in a quiet neighborhood a short walk from Downtown Pacific Grove, Monterey Bay Aquarium, restaurants, the coastal recreation trail and beaches.  A binder in the kitchen provides information.  Two aquarium passes are included for your use. The house consists of a two bedroom one bath house on the first floor and a studio on the second floor.  The studio has a separate entrance and is accessible from an exterior staircase.
space: The living room has a gas fireplace which contributes to a cozy space for relaxing and visiting with friends and family after a busy day exploring the area. WIFI and cable TV is available.  Enjoy the many restaurants, cook at home in the well equipped kitchen, or use the gas Weber Grill in the backyard ( a patio table and six chairs is provided). Shop at the local, Grove Market or Nob Hill Foods, Safeway, Lucky or Trader Joe's, all less than a mile away.   Children are welcome guests,however, the house is not child proof. There are a few toys, games, and special dishes/silverware for your use. When considering sleeping arrangements, be aware that the third bedroom is only accessed by an outside staircase. Caledonia Park playground at Central and Caledonia Aves is fun for the younger set.  Dennis the Menace Park in Monterey is also a favorite.
description: Dolphin House is a quaint, light-filled beach house centrally located in a quiet neighborhood a short walk from Downtown Pacific Grove, Monterey Bay Aquarium, restaurants, the coastal recreation trail and beaches.  A binder in the kitchen provides information.  Two aquarium passes are included for your use. The house consists of a two bedroom one bath house on the first floor and a studio on the second floor.  The studio has a separate entrance and is accessible from an exterior staircase. The living room has a gas fireplace which contributes to a cozy space for relaxing and visiting with friends and family after a busy day exploring the area. WIFI and cable TV is available.  Enjoy the many restaurants, cook at home in the well equipped kitchen, or use the gas Weber Grill in the backyard ( a patio table and six chairs is provided). Shop at the local, Grove Market or Nob Hill Foods, Safeway, Lucky or Trader Joe's, all less than a mile away.   Children are welcome guests,however, the hou
neighborhood_overview: The house is a half mile walk from the Monterey Bay Aquarium (Two guest passes are provided for your use) and Cannery Row shops and restaurants. Less than half a mile in the other direction is downtown Pacific Grove with more shops and restaurants.  A binder in the kitchen shows some of your options. Thousands of Monarch Butterflies overwinter (October to March)  in Pacific Grove. You can visit the Butterfly  Sanctuary where they cluster in the trees to conserve heat when the temperature is lower than 55 degrees F.  When they sunlight warms them, they fly off to gather nectar.  You can often see them hanging in the trees or flying about.  Monterey Bay is visible from the house and less than half a mile away.  Beaches (Lovers Point for family beach  play is great), bike and walking/running trails await.  Drive a short way down Highway 1 to Point Lobos for hiking and viewing ocean cliffs or to Carmel Valley for wine tasting.  Take a whale watching cruise or try clam chowder sample tastin
notes: We are licensed by the City of Pacific Grove as a Short Term Rental. License #0262 and #0328. This means that a 10% tax on the nightly rate and cleaning fee are required.  These fees will be added to your pricing and paid to the city of Pacific Grove by Airbnb.   Each bedroom has two USB ports in the alarm clock. The sound bar in the living room below the TV enables you to play music from your phone or other bluetooth device.
transit: There is parking on only one side of the street, therefore parking is at a premium.  We park on the street to unload people and luggage, then pull into the driveway.  The sidewalk is high at the driveway and you must PULL IN SLOWLY to avoid scraping the underneath side of your car.  Guests with low clearance cars should use caution if parking in the driveway. There is room for two cars (one behind the other). To be respectful of the neighbors please park in the driveway, when possible.
access: There are two bedrooms with queen sized beds and a bathroom on the lower level.  Up the OUTSIDE staircase is a studio with one queen bed and a small bathroom with shower. The private backyard has a dining table for six (cushions in the back bedroom closet!) and a large gas Weber Grill. Great for outdoor relaxing!
interaction: You may contact me with questions anytime prior and during your stay.  If there is a problem you may contact me or our caretaker who lives close by.
house_rules: - Check-in is 4pm and check-out is 11am. 10% city lodging taxes will be added to your booking and paid to the city of Pacific Grove  by Airbnb. - Due to allergies, we have a very strict no smoking/no pets policy. If there is evidence of either on the property, guests will be held responsible and charged for additional cleaning services. - Absolutely NO drugs! - During your stay in our home, you may need to operate the internet, TV, fireplace or other appliances. To assist you with their operation, we have a detailed house manual available onsite. - Our home sleeps 6, one more person may stay for an additional nightly charge.  The house is permitted to allow no more than 7 guests nightly.   - Parking is limited to 2 cars. - This is a quiet, peaceful neighborhood, please be respectful of the neighbors.
host_about: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in the Monterey Bay Area in 1969 and fell in love with it.  In 2015 we found this lovely house.  We hope you enjoy the area and our home as much as we do!

space: Feel like you are in a treehouse in this second story studio space and have a peek of the bay. Just a mile from entrance to Pebble Beach and a few blocks from the beach. Your adventure begins with a spiral staircase that takes you to the landing of your treehouse studio space. Greeted by real queen bed, we also have a table and chairs for you to work or relax at. On Mondays PG hosts a farmer's market in the evening. Our studio is located in a neighborhood and there is ample street parking.
notes: Please note that this space has a spiral staircase to lead to the studio on the second floor. There is not an elevator for luggage or individuals. Please read the entire listing description thoroughly to see if this is the right fit for you! Please note that pricing varies depending on the season, day of the week, and is higher on special events and holidays. ** IMPORTANT: this price quote does not include local Transient Occupancy Tax. In order to accept reservations and host guests, the City of Pacific Grove requires that we possess a transient use license. Abnb is required to collect transient occupancy taxes from each of our guests. This amounts to 10% of the total fee stay and is included in what you pay to Abnb. License #0355. We really enjoy hosting guests from all over the globe an
access: Private entry and with full access to studio space.
interaction: We love welcoming visitors to our Studio! The extent of our interaction with you is based on your desires. We are easily accessible via email, text, phone or in person. Happy to offer information, answer questions and should their be any challenges that come up, we are here for that too!
house_rules: You are a welcomed guest in our home. This is not the place for parties, smoking or illegal activities. There is ample street parking, usually directly across the street, certainly along the block and even in the cul-de-sac. Please park across the street from the house.

name: Downtown, Remodeled 2br 1ba + 2 Aquarium Passes
summary: Come stay in one side of our newly remodeled adobe duplex in downtown Pacific Grove: 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, and your own private garden. It can comfortably fit 4 adults + child. Be our neighbor while you explore Monterey Bay.  We're right downtown and within walking distance to beaches, parks, restaurants and family-friendly activities. Great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). Pacific Grove Short Term Rental License #0353.
space: Your side of this duplex is a 2 bedroom 1 bath and was completely renovated in 2015 with a brand new kitchen (stainless steel refrigerator, dishwasher, gas stove and oven, redwood bar), bathroom, double pane windows, hardwood floors, forced-air heating on a Nest thermostat, recessed lighting throughout, and ceiling fans in both bedrooms for optimal air circulation. Room by room overview: Living Room: new 40" HD TV with G*Cast (stream from laptop, phone or tablet to the TV). BluRay/DVD player with streaming Apps and a few DVDs. Front Bedroom: queen bed, built-in closet with hangers, drawers with extra linens; end tables and reading lamps. Back Bedroom: twin bed and dresser, end table and reading lamp. Closet with hangers, extra linens, blankets, extra chairs, Twin Aerobed, Baby Bjorn travel crib, vacuum and beach toys. Bathroom: tub with shower. Towels, hand towels, and wash clothes provided (beach towels are also provided and you'll find those in the built-in drawers in the dining room

neighborhood_overview: Everything in Pacific Grove is just a short walk away:  -Downtown Pacific Grove: Restaurants (we love Passionfish and Jeninni for dinner; Red House for lunch; Pavel's for pastries, cookies, and bread; Bookworks for coffee and books!), Shopping (Sprout for children's clothes; The Quill for gifts and the best stationary; and the Butterfly Shop for all things PG themed; Chatterbaux for gently used children's toys and clothing), Natural History Museum (there's lots to see and interactive activities for children, plus an outdoor space for running around and searching for fossils), Farmer's Market (Mondays 3-7PM with tons of local organic produce and food vendors, so you can grab something and sit on the grass at Jewel Park and enjoy), Pacific Grove Public Library (a Carnegie Library with a lovely and well-stocked children's section).  -Lovers Point Beach: volleyball, stand up paddle board, kayak, and bike rentals. This is an especially wonderful beach for children as the waves are never too
notes: Pacific Grove has Transient Occupancy Tax of 10% which is collected by AirBnB (as of 12/1/2017). Pacific Grove Short Term Rental License #0353.  We use mattress and pillow protectors. We use all green products to clean for your safety and the environment.
transit: There's  bus stop directly across the street from our home that goes to the Monterey terminal and from there you can connect to buses going all around the Peninsula. Catch it just up the street from us to go to Asilomar (Conference Center or beach). Line 1 Asilomar/Monterey: (URL HIDDEN)
access: One side of the duplex, fenced-in side yard. There is ample street parking directly in front of the duplex. We have a keyless entry and we'll give you the code before your arrival.
interaction: We'll be neighbors so we might run into each other, but we'll always respect your privacy. If you have any questions on the home or area, feel free to text or call. Both my wife and I grew up on the Monterey Peninsula, so we have a deep knowledge that we're happy to share!
house_rules: -This is a duplex that shares a wall with my family and me. Please be considerate. -Please keep it quiet outside after 9 pm. -No candles please. -Only flush toilet paper down the toilet. We have an old sewer system that cannot handle anything else.

name: No shared space! Private room/bathroom! PGLic#0405
summary: My place is close to Carmel and Monterey, some of the best dining, family-friendly activities, Fisherman's Wharf, Pebble Beach, The 17-mile Drive, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Lover's Point Beach, Downtown Pacific Grove, Downtown Monterey, and Asilomar Beach. Point Lobos is about 10 mins and Big Sur is only 45 mins away!
space: This is really an entire place to yourself!  VERY CLEAN, large spacious bedroom with queen bed, optional roll-a-way fold-out bed that you can set up, optional sleepmat for floor you may set up. Linens, pillows and blankets provided. There is a TV w/DVD player, and cable TV w/HBO. Please see pictures for more info on room.  Private bathroom, courtyard, private parking and private entry to room with lock. Room is attached to our home but blocked from any entry/exit into main house.  This is really more like having an entire studio to yourself! There is no shared space.

Guests have private entry to their room with lock and a private courtyard with outdoor table and chairs.  THE
neighborhood_overview: We live in a very safe and peaceful neighborhood.  Pacific Grove has an extremely low crime rate. One of the safest places in America! Very family-friendly. It is a residential area, but minutes from all the fun stuff! One mile from the BEACH!  We are only a couple of blocks from Pebble Beach.  Also, there is a beautiful forest a couple of blocks away to take a tranquil walk.
notes: We have listed that there are 3 beds: The first bed is a queen size regular bed. The second bed is a roll-a-way bed that folds out. The third bed is a sleepmat that unfolds and lays on the floor.  The extra beds are found in the closet. Bedding provided. You set up and make them and put away when you are done.  For the safety of all, the property and common area outside is under surveillance.  The door leading into the main home is locked from both sides and secured with a sound barrier placed on our side.  During the day, there is a certain level of noise you would expect from a family with children.  Some piano playing may occur during the day. Tuesday mornings at 10am my son has piano lessons. We will do our best to be considerate in the early morning and late evening hours.  We provide ear plugs and a sound machine (located in nightstand drawer) in case you plan to sleep during the day or you're a light sleeper. If you are looking for complete silence during the day and need to sle
transit: We are right around the corner from Trader Joe's, Safeway, Starbucks, and Rite Aid , and lots of  restaurants. Uber and taxi friendly. Please ask us for recommendations for the best restaurants around and  fun things to do. There's a red box at Lucky's grocery store. Bus stop is a block away!  Free trolley pick up about a mile away!
access: Guests have private entry to their room with lock and a private courtyard with outdoor table and chairs.  THERE IS NO SHARED SPACE! Also, they will have their own free parking spot for up to two vehicles. Parking is to the right of our home, under the carport.
interaction: We are absolutely available for any help or guidance during your stay here!  We love to help enrich our guests stay in Pacific Grove and surrounding areas.  Josh is a lifetime local and Angi has lived here for many years.  We both can tell you nearly everything there is to do around here and how to get there!
house_rules: -No extra guests beyond who is registered. -Smoking is allowed outside on patio.
host_about: We are both veterans and have been married for 18 years now.  Josh has been running a moving business for 15 years and Angi is a stay-at-home mother.  We both love Thai, Japanese, and Mexican food!  Together we host a private room in Pacific Grove, California and love meeting new people and helping enrich their time traveling here.

name: Sea la Vie Cottage ..a gem respite
summary: City of Pacific Grove Transient Use License # 0345.  A true unique little gem awaits you in downtown Pacific Grove! Steps to Pedestrian path, dining, beach, family-friendly activities, nightlife, public transport.  You’ll love Sea la Vie' Cottage, its easy access to  interesting, worthy activities, sites and attractions with quality comfort and relaxation.  Just what you are looking for!
space: This cottage is a brand new vacation rental ! Thoughtfully restored and recently remodeled and decorated this stunning take on the original Caretakers cottage of late 20th century  gracious Holman mansion that stands adjacent to Sea laVie Cottage.  Sea la Vie' will certainly provide you with relaxing comfort amidst authentic furnishings which have predominantly been locally gathered.   An homage to the past and days gone by but still relevant and comforting.  Sea la Vie's storybook settings Is reminiscent of  the John Steinbeck era, when an influential writer or local artist may have stopped by to have an interesting chat in front of the River Rock fireplace or outside in one of the wicker chairs on the stone patio overlooking the beautiful gardens and private yard.

neighborhood_overview: Sweet local access to everything in PG.  quiet little street right at the entrance to town.  Sea la Vie Cottage is positioned aside a beautiful Villa residence, surrounded by historical. Victorian era homes and large and notorious Cypress and Eucalyptus trees which are ever populated by birds and butterflies. You may even see the occasional deer family looking for something new to forage. Pacific Grove quaint but accommodating downtown just a few steps away offers everything you can imagine the 'last small town' would have to offer as well as the embracing beauty of the Monterey Bay and its surrounds.   Top picks for things to do within walking or biking include Cannery Row, The aquarium,  Lovers Point park Asilomar Beach, Spanish Bay Butterfly Sanctuary  Lighthouse Golfing Natural History Museum Caledonia Park Washington Park Rip van winkle park Kayaking Lovers Point Pedestrian Path to Monterey and beyond.  Whale Watching Cannery Row Point Lobos
notes: We are licensed for TOT in the City of Pacific Grove license # There are so many unique features in this period style turn of the century cottage but without sacrificing a relevant aesthetic.  Modern functionality with updated custom inspired European architectural detail. You will feel you have stepped back into Pagrovian history when snuggled on the leather sofa with a warm throw in front of the river rock fireplace ( operates at the turn of a switch that is safe and effortless).  With all the modern comforts and amenities.   An additional homage to the past is inspired by applying original Pine floors which were once the paneling of the walls.   Private sitting areas on the patio and beyond in its garden help make your stay at Sea La Vie' a very special one.
transit: Walk or bike to  Cannery Row, Downtown Pacific Grove, Asilomar Beach, Lighthouse avenue.  Public transportation.
access: The entire cottage and its private fenced stone patio and garden with stone   Use herbs and artisanal salad greens from the private gardens.  Self contained.
interaction: As much as guests need.  I am local and live next door and can provide much information and assistance.
house_rules: PET POLICY UPON MAKING RESERVATION YOU MUST MAKE US AWARE IF YOUR DOG.   CHARGE IS BETWEEN $65-$150.  Depending upon weight and length of stay.   NO CATS ALLOWED.   Respectful of neighborhood.   Parking off street.   Courtesy to locals. Outside socializing hours 9:00 AM-9;00 PM weekdays 9:00 AM-11:00 PM Please place all trash and recyclables in adjacent utility/trash receptacle upon departure. Place all used linens and towels in hampers provided  Please do not place luggage or bags, shoes on bed. Please remove shoes in the Cottage.   Pets must be approved.   There is an additional fee for pets not registered and discovered.  Please don't try to sneak pets in.  We love dogs and want to prepare for your fur-person too. No animal to be left inside cottage with its human present or crated.    Please pick up after your pet.  There will be an extra charge if pet waste is left behind.  Please leave any provided pet bedding upon departure.   If it rains please place the outside cushions inside
host_about:
Living  on the Monterey Peninsula for my entire adult life.  Raised my son in Monterey.   Known to many as the concierge of the area have been actively involved in the community for many years.  
Ask me about locally hidden beaches or trails to hike off the beaten path.  
Looking for a fun place to go for live music or great food close-by? Just ask.

name: Charming Cottage near Downtown and the Beach
summary: Our small historical cottage is in the original Victorian center of Pacific Grove and is less than a block from the restaurants, cafes, bus stop and close to downtown.  The coastal recreational path and beach is walking distance.  The house is good for couples and families up to five people.  This 2 bedroom cottage sleeps 5.   License # 0346
space: There is a Cal King in one bedroom, two extra long twins in the second bedroom and a queen pullout sofa bed in the living room.  Please note the bedrooms are small and there is a built in closet in one bedroom and a small cupboard and chest of drawers in the second bedroom.

name: Central to Everything - Casa Mariposa
summary: Casa Mariposa is centrally located in the sunniest part of Pacific Grove, on a quiet street within walking distance of the Ocean, Cannery Row, Lovers Point, Asilomar Beach, Spanish Bay, Point Pinos Lighthouse, Pebble Beach, and much more.  We are near Washington Park and the Monarch butterfly sanctuary. Our place is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families.   Sorry - no pets, no smoking, and no loud parties.  Pacific Grove License #0181
space: Our home boasts many green attributes:  It has a state-of-the-art solar system installed on the roof which powers all of the home electrical needs.  It also has a sophisticated rain-water catchment system which allows us to conserve drinking water by using rainwater for the gardens.  South-facing windows capture the sun and we have energy efficient lighting throughout. We live in a nice quiet neighborhood central to everything on the Peninsula.  Two formal bedrooms (one queen and one king bed) plus a queen size sleep sofa and a roll-away bed in family room which can serve as a 3rd bedroom. Sleeps up to 6 people comfortably.   (Please keep in mind the roll-away bed in the Family Room is small and not comfortable for adults.  For kids it's fine).  Two complete baths on main level, plus half bath in upstairs master bedroom.   Bright and sunny, our home is immaculate and newly remodeled.  It has all the amenities - WiFi, DVD, cable with large screen TV, dishwasher, washer/dryer, granite co

neighborhood_overview: Casa Mariposa is centrally located in a quiet sunny neighborhood of Pacific Grove.  We are within walking distance of the Ocean, Cannery Row, Lovers Point, Asilomar Beach, Spanish Bay, Point Pinos Lighthouse, Pebble Beach, and much more.  Also near Washington Park and the Monarch butterfly sanctuary.
notes: If you enjoy classical jazz, here's a little known secret:  Every Thursday night in the lobby of the Spanish Bay Inn the legendary Dottie Dodgion Trio plays from 7pm - 10pm.  Dottie played with all the great jazz bands of old and at 88 she is still going strong.  It's free. Here are Jon and Julie’s picks for the best eating in our area: FORMAL DINING -  reservations highly recommended: Mission Ranch - Carmel   26270 Dolores St Carmel   ph(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).  Owned by Clint Eastwood. Believe it or not it is the ONLY restaurant in Carmel with an ocean view. Great place to go for sunset meal. Fine dining American fare. Nice atmosphere with the best piano bar in the region. Fandango's - 223 17th Street, Pacific Grove ph(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)  Nice old and funky mix of classic mission and modern architecture with great intimate seating in a variety of rooms. One of the best dining experiences on the Peninsula. Eclectic foods - known for their seafood and steaks. Sardine Factory - 701 Wave
transit: There is a private driveway and space for two more cars on the street.  No more than three cars total may be parked at our location.  No RVs, and no trucks over 6 wheels.
access: This house is yours to enjoy completely, as long as you respect the fact that it is our home and NOT a motel.  We live here!  This area is a quiet neighborhood and we do not allow loud parties.   The main floor consists of the large living room, large kitchen, guest bedroom and two full baths, one of which has a whirlpool bathtub.  The other has a shower.  Upstairs is master bedroom with king bed and half bath.  Outside is a fully enclosed private courtyard.
interaction: Manager - Our manager is Kine Samuels.  If you have a concern please contact her first.   Cell phone:  (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)     Email:  (EMAIL HIDDEN) Owners - Jon and Julie are the owners.  We welcome your comments and suggestions:    Office phone: (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)      Cell:  (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)     Email:  (EMAIL HIDDEN)     and    (EMAIL HIDDEN)
house_rules: QUIET - No more than 6 persons total, including children.  We live in a quiet neighborhood.  You may have friends over but no loud parties please.  If our neighbors complain it will probably be to the cops first.   PARKING - No more than 3 cars total may be parked at our home - one in the driveway and two on the street.  This is a city law.  If you have more than three cars you should park them two blocks away at the park. No trucks over 6 wheels, no large RV's, and no ATVs allowed.
host_about: Casa Mariposa is the home of Julie Martinez and Jon Kramer, globe-trotting adventurers with natural history backgrounds and a passion for Earth and all its incredible worlds and cultures.  Julie is a natural history illustrator and art instructor.  Jon is a geological engineer and solar energy developer.  Together they author adventure guidebooks.  You will see some of Julie’s art on these walls and their joint adventure guidebooks on the shelves.  Many fossils and rocks from their various geologic adventures are displayed throughout the property.

name: La Mer Cottage, our home by the sea.
summary: Welcome to La Mer, our cottage by the sea. We invite you to come and enjoy the warmth and beauty of this sweet 110-year old, farm-style cottage that we call home.  The original farmhouse was separated into two beautiful living spaces. La Mer is the larger, downstairs, main cottage. Just a few blocks from the heart of charming Pacific Grove and romantic Lover's Point Beach, our cottage offers an experience of relaxation and homey charm after a day of sight-seeing on the beautiful Central Coast.
space: Light and warmth surround you in this cozy main floor cottage — affectionately named La Mer, our home by the sea. Here you will enjoy beauty, relaxation, and refreshing sea-breezes in this three-bedroom cottage filled with comfort and charm.  The central location is perfect for a half-mile walk to downtown Pacific Grove, a one-mile stroll to Lover's Point Beach, and three quarter miles to The famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row. The Monterey Bay coastal trail is just six blocks down the hill and stretches for miles along the beautiful central coast.  Three unique bedrooms offer plenty of sleeping space for up to five guests.  The master bedroom boasts a plush, king-sized bed, the middle bedroom has a global theme surrounding a custom antique queen bed, and the garden room doubles as a sitting room with a sofa that converts to a twin. The large farm-style kitchen is the perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee around the table with your loved ones. It is fully stocked, with e
description: Welcome to La Mer, our cottage by the sea. We invite you to come and enjoy the warmth and beauty of this sweet 110-year old, farm-style cottage that we call home.  The original farmhouse was separated into two beautiful living spaces. La Mer is the larger, downstairs, main cottage. Just a few blocks from the heart of charming Pacific Grove and romantic Lover's Point Beach, our cottage offers an experience of relaxation and homey charm after a day of sight-seeing on the beautiful Central Coast. Light and warmth surround you in this cozy main floor cottage — affectionately named La Mer, our home by the sea. Here you will enjoy beauty, relaxation, and refreshing sea-breezes in this three-bedroom cottage filled with comfort and charm.  The central location is perfect for a half-mile walk to downtown Pacific Grove, a one-mile stroll to Lover's Point Beach, and three quarter miles to The famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row. The Monterey Bay coastal trail is just six blocks down the
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove offers an unparalleled quality of life. Sharing borders with the Monterey Bay, City of Monterey, Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, our town offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. We are known for our small-town hospitality and friendliness in a place we simply call 'P.G.' (from The City of Pacific Grove website)
notes: The city of Pacific Grove is very strict about occupancy and limiting guest activity while renting a short term rental. Under no circumstances could a party, get together or gathering be hosted at the cottage during the rental period. ~This property is a short-term vacation rental, licensed through the City of Pacific Grove, Lic. # 300. All short term rental rules apply and maximum occupancy is strictly enforced ~The cottage is a smoke-free/vape free property ~The cottage has a firm no pet policy
transit: The location has something to offer everyone—As stated earlier, the quaint downtown of Pacific Grove is just a half-mile stroll down the street.  A less than 20-minute walk in the other direction takes you to historic Cannery Row and The Monterey Bay Aquarium. Historic downtown Monterey and Fisherman's Wharf offer a peak into the past and several dining options. The beautiful beach and the Monterey Coastal Trail are six blocks down the hill from the cottage. Hikers, runners, and bikers can enjoy miles of trails that lead to Asilomar State Beach, Carmel, the Big Sur coastline, and beyond.
access: Guests of La Mer will access the cottage through a keyless entry system. You will be given a guest door code, specific to your rental dates, that will be used by all guests in your group during your stay. This allows for added safety and piece of mind. There is no need to carry a key or be worried of getting locked out.
interaction: Guests can reach us with any questions throughout their stay, by simply calling or texting either one of us. A detailed contact list is also located in the cottage.

name: Heart of PG Cottage
summary: This cottage is in the heart of downtown Pacific Grove. It is a half block from the town grocery store, a few houses away from cottages converted into restaurants and bakeries..  The location cannot be beat.  Step outside and you can see Lover's Point, our beach and protected sanctuary.  You are a mile walk to the Aquarium along a beautiful pedestrian path.. (Pacific Grove City STR Permit #0365.)
space: One bedroom has doors for privacy but two of the sleeping rooms have curtains instead of doors. Lots of windows make this cottage bright and cozy at the same time. It is in the commercial district where all the Victorian homes have been turned into cafes and coffee shops. A couple of blocks to the beach at Lover's Point. The bathroom is between the two bedrooms so if someone is using the twin beds in the sitting room, they'd have to cross into one of the bedrooms to enter the bathroom.

neighborhood_overview: The cottage is surrounded by Victorians that are a century old. It is a sleepy town at night with the grocery story closing at 7 and not opening until 8.  You are steps from coffee shops and cafes.
notes: There is a youth center about 150 feet away and has occasional muffled playground noise.  It is the cheerful sound of older children playing, not squealing toddlers. Parking on 17th is restricted to 3 hours during day time hours -- unrestricted at night.  You are on the corner of Laurel, which has plenty of parking.  You are very near the clock tower at City Hall and it chimes every 15" during the day with holiday songs chimed during December (non-religious songs).  We find it delightful.
transit: A public bus stop is one block away on Pine.  Everything you need is walking distance. Bike and kayak rentals are at the end of your street to the north - about three blocks away.
access: You have access to the entire house.  A small fenced yard surrounds the cottage.  There is no driveway - parking is free on the street.
interaction: I live just down the street and am available 24 hours a day, every day of the week.  You can choose to meet me or you can let yourself in and make yourself at home, coming and going as you please.

name: Lovers Point Beach House, Perfect Location
summary: Imagine, less than 30 steps from Lover's Point Beach and the Peninsula's scenic bike path is where you will find this charming and cozy beach house - vaulted open-beam ceilings, wood burning stove, and Honduras mahogany wood floors in the kitchen are just a few of the amenities. The house is fully equipped with everything you will need for your stay and is within walking distance to the Beach, Aquarium, Cannery Row, Old Fishermans Wharf, Kayak and Bike Rentals, and Endless food options.
space: The upstairs/downstairs floor plan makes it perfect for families and couples to gather. Upon entering the house on the first level there is a master bedroom with sliding glass doors leading out to a small patio in a fenced in backyard. There is laundry room, as well as, an additional bonus living area with two twin beds and a flat screen TV. This downstairs suite along with the upstairs with 2 bedrooms, a bath, and great room with T.V, fully equipped kitchen, and eating area is perfect for 2 families traveling together with kids, allowing each family to have their own space, or a 3 generational family with grandparents, 3 couples traveling together or 5-7 singles.

house_rules: AirBnB House Rules -	Shoes policy:  To ensure we keep the our home sand and dirt free , we have a no shoes policy inside our home -	Parking:  We and our neighbors love the view from the front windows and I’m sure you will too.  Please do not park in front of our neighbors home and block their views.   -	Guests under the age of 21:   We have a minimum age requirement for booking our home of 21+.  Guests under the age of 21 are still entirely welcome – they will just need to be accompanied by parents or guardians -	Check-in/out times:  Check-in is at 4pm, and check-out is by 10am. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first and we will do our best to accommodate you. -	Cleanliness:  We do a thorough professional clean between each guest stay, we kindly ask that prior to leaving, you read the check-out procedures located in the kitchen.  -	Smoking policy:  Being a family home, we also have a no smoking policy inside or outsid
host_about:
Pacific Grove is one of my favorite places in the world.  I first fell in love with this small town about 15 years ago when I accidentally stumbled upon it when I was looking for a place for dinner.  

Although I am a new host to Airbnb, I have been hosting my home in Pacific Grove for 8 years.  

I am a venture seeker.  I am an adventurer at heart and a foodie.  

I look forward to hosting you in my home!

house_rules: Our neighborhood is a quiet one and we want to respect our neighbors. Quiet hours are from 10 p.m. - 8 a.m. ( as per city ordinance ) No parties allowed! ** IMPORTANT: this price quote does not include local Transient Occupancy Tax.  In order to accept reservations and host guests, the City of Pacific Grove requires that we possess and maintain a transient use license.  Therefore, we are required to collect transient occupancy taxes from our guests in the amount of 10% of the total fee per stay.  A payment request for the tax will be provided separately by us after the reservation is made. This is not included in the Airbnb fees and is due upon arrival.  A check made out directly to the City of Pacific Grove is preferred, if you have a US checking account.  Thank You!
