We also have On Demand television, Wifi, and a desk top computer as well.  We provide shampoo/conditioner, soap, hair dryer, paper products, tin foil, Ziploc bags, etc.   We have books for all ages, a few movies, board games, puzzles, kids play t
neighborhood_overview: We are so close to everything in PG proper, but not in the very middle of it.  This means you can easily stroll to all the places of interest, yet, when you want to go home for some quiet - you can.  You won't struggle to find parking or find yourself next door to a noisy business.  Walk to award winning restaurants, cafes, grocery store, shops, beach, bike rentals, ocean front walking/biking path, aquarium.  We are also just a mile away from PG golf links and the entrance to Pebble Beach.
notes: Due to a serious (life threatening) family allergy - we cannot rent to cat owners.  We are sorry, but we cannot risk having cat owners' clothing or luggage in the home. The aquarium passes are good your entire stay for any two people but can be used only ONCE each day (do not try to share between more than two people or they will be taken and you will end up paying the price).  In/out stamp is provided so passholder can enter and exit during the same day.  Lost aquarium passes will result in a $250 charge PER pass.  (we have to buy regular tix for guests who stay until the replacement passes arrive and the replacements are not easy to get) Lost key cost is $150 which covers cost of rekeying the house.  Please use the lockbox to store keys to avoid losing one. Airbnb does not lend itself to our seasonal pricing.  Our low season pricing starts at $250 a night for 2 guests; Mid season is $300 per night for up to 4 guests (weekends are $325); High season pricing is $350 per night for up to
transit: You can walk to anything downtown PG.  Lover's Point is an easy stroll of 5-10 minutes depending on how fast you walk.  Easy to do even with young children.  The Aquarium is less than 10 min. away by bike and about 20-30 min. away on foot depending on your walking speed - all along the gorgeous ocean front path that is just a few blocks from the house at Lover's Point.  Bikes can be rented there as well.  There is a kids play park a block away.  Lappert's ice cream, Passionfish, etc. are all a stone's throw from the house.  Asilomar state beach, PG golf links and Pebble Beach are mile away.
access: Entire house is yours.  Access is via a lockbox which contains 2 keys.  In the event of a lost key, guest is charged $150 for cost of rekeying house.  We strongly recommend you use the lockbox rather than carry the key around on your person to avoid losing a key.
interaction: Owners are available by text, phone and email.
house_rules: We are very sorry but due to a life threatening family allergy, we cannot rent to anyone who owns a cat even though you are not bringing your cat.  We cannot risk cat owners' clothing or luggage being in the house.  We apologize for any inconvenience. All bookings will have 10% added via a "special offer" as Airbnb does not add in the mandatory city tax expense.
host_about: Our family had visited Pacific Grove for years before buying our on home.  Each time we were disappointed upon arrival.  Pictures always seemed far nicer and cleaner looking than the actual place we stayed.  So, we purchased our own vacation home and offer that lovely space to you for some excellent memory making.  It is clean, comfortable, quiet with easy parking.  Best of all, you do not need to pack the kitchen sink.  We provide everything you could need to make your stay enjoyable.  Just bring your clothes and any special toiletries you may wish to have.  We even have books and games for the kids to enjoy!

name: Downtown, Family & Biz friendly, Walk to Beach
summary: Walk just a few steps from this light-filled, charming, historic cottage in Pacific Grove to shops, cafes, restaurants, second-hand shops, Grove Market grocery, and the Monterey Bay. Enjoy a full kitchen with coffee, press pot, cream, toaster, microwave, stove, fridge. Walk to the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Lovers Point Beach and Cannery Row. Remodeled kitchen and bathroom. Oak hardwood floors. High ceilings. Private back garden. License #0376.
space: This light-filled, historic cottage in P.G.'s downtown area is just steps from shops, cafes and restaurants, a 5-minute walk from Lover’s Point, and a 20-minute walk to the Monterey Bay Aquarium! Perfect for a family or two couples traveling together or a business traveler looking for a peaceful, well-equipped place to stay. We fell in love with this charming cottage, and we hope you’ll call it home for a short time. Built in 1910 and remodeled in 2000, the cottage has oak and bamboo floors, a modern kitchen, and an updated bathroom with a tub/shower. The garden features honeysuckle, geraniums, succulents and nasturtium.  Our city license limits us to 6 adult occupants (age 18 or over) plus children. There's a Queen-sized bed in the Master Bedroom that sleeps 2 adults and 1 baby or small child. The second bedroom has a full-sized bed that sleeps 2 adults. The daybed in the den can sleep 2 people. The sofa in the living room folds down and sleeps 1 person. Guests may park no more than 2
description: Walk just a few steps from this light-filled, charming, historic cottage in Pacific Grove to shops, cafes, restaurants, second-hand shops, Grove Market grocery, and the Monterey Bay. Enjoy a full kitchen with coffee, press pot, cream, toaster, microwave, stove, fridge. Walk to the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Lovers Point Beach and Cannery Row. Remodeled kitchen and bathroom. Oak hardwood floors. High ceilings. Private back garden. License #0376. This light-filled, historic cottage in P.G.'s downtown area is just steps from shops, cafes and restaurants, a 5-minute walk from Lover’s Point, and a 20-minute walk to the Monterey Bay Aquarium! Perfect for a family or two couples traveling together or a business traveler looking for a peaceful, well-equipped place to stay. We fell in love with this charming cottage, and we hope you’ll call it home for a short time. Built in 1910 and remodeled in 2000, the cottage has oak and bamboo floors, a modern kitchen, and an updated bathroom with a tub/showe
neighborhood_overview: The City of Pacific Grove was founded as a Methodist retreat and gradually grew into a town with full-time residents, rich in history. In contrast to Monterey, which grew up around the fishing industry, PG was a retreat for city folks looking to escape the cold summers of San Francisco. It's a small town full of quaint Victorian architecture and cottages like ours built on lots originally sold as sites for camping tents. Next door, Asilomar Park and Conference Center, designed by famed architect Julia Morgan, began as a retreat for the YWCA (Young Women’s Christian Association). The Point Pinos Lighthouse is the oldest continually operating lighthouse on the west coast and a great place to visit. The sheltered white sand beach at Lovers Point is ideal for families with small children, a jumping off point for scuba divers and a favorite photo spot for vacationing newlyweds. Each September a popular Triathalon attracts swimmers, runners, bicyclists, and enthusiastic spectators. Close by,
notes: There's a lovely Farmer's Market on Mondays from 4pm to 7pm where you'll find delicious local produce, nuts, and fresh baked bread. The Grove Market, our local grocery, is 5 blocks away and has everything you may need during your stay. We clean the cottage thoroughly after each guest and use mattress and pillow protectors for your health and safety.
transit: The local shuttle runs along Lighthouse (half block away), and you can take it all the way to the Monterey Bay Aquarium, the Cannery, the Monterey Hotel. Or you can walk or run the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail, sharing it with bicyclists, families with kids in strollers, and folks walking their dogs.
access: The entire cottage is your domain. Laundry with new washer and dryer. A Well-equipped Kitchen. Front Porch. Back Garden. Wifi. Direct TV.  We provide a lock box so you can enter and exit at your convenience. The cottage is free standing, so you share no walls with anyone else. There's also an extra lock box in case you lose your key.
interaction: We're eager to make sure you're comfortable and settled in. We live only 2 blocks from the cottage and are always available by phone or text to answer any questions about the house, the friendly neighborhood, parking and public transportation. We provide recommendations and information for restaurants, cafes, shops, golf courses, and museums, and how to reach them.
house_rules: - You’ll find our neighbors respectful of your privacy as we know you’ll be respectful of theirs. These little cottages are close to one another, and you may want to be mindful of the noise you’re making. It's also the reason we don't allow smoking inside or near the cottage. We ask guests to make sure that the front door is securely locked when you go in and out. When your visit is over, we ask that you return the keys safely to the lock boxes. Please leave the guests passes to the Aquarium on the kitchen counter for the next guests. If you inadvertently take the passes with you, we ask that you return them to us next day air at your expense.
host_about: We're happiest at home, which we share with two loving pups (Coco and Ubu). We've lived abroad in Italy, France, Haiti and India. We speak several languages and love meeting others whose adventures have taken them far and wide. The tastes of different cultures speak to us as does the unspoken bond all global travelers feel when they discover common ground around the world. We love our neighborhood and stay involved in our community so we're current on where to sip a great latte, get a bite to eat, shop for wine or shoes, create art, rent bikes, and learn a little bit of local history.

name: 7th Heaven in Pacific Grove, CA
summary: Pacific Grove`s 7th  Heaven - Vacation Rental
space: Wake up...open the French doors and smell the ocean breeze! 7th Heaven is located 7 houses away from Pacific Grove’s beautiful coastline and recreation trail, and within short walking distance to downtown Pacific Grove, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and Cannery Row. This historic home offers ample relaxation space with two comfortable bedrooms and an awesome upstairs loft/attic with ocean views from the skylights. The loft is great as a game-room or a cozy movie night with the family. Airbnb does not include the required collection of taxes due to the city of Pacific Grove. The required collection of taxes is 10% of the rental and cleaning amount. Please be prepared to pay for the taxes at the time of the booking.  STR number #0281

name: Asilomar Ocean Retreat
summary: Our spacious retreat, on a private half-acre, is a short walk to Asilomar beach.  The great room has soaring ceilings, a spacious dining area, a kitchen bar and couches looking onto the gardens. The cozy living room has a wood-burning fireplace. The game room has a foosball table and brochures about area attractions. The lounging spaces and chef’s kitchen will tempt you to hibernate, but our guide also tells about the best walks and restaurants, and fun things to do.  Our license number is 0034
space: The great room provides a central gathering space for cooking, eating and lounging. The living room provides a more intimate space for watching T.V. or for gathering around the fire. The four bedrooms, with French doors onto the gardens, provide private spaces. The kids can enjoy playing foosball in the game room, shooting hoops in the driveway or exploring the wooded back yard. Dogs are welcome, with prior notice. (There is a $50 pet fee. ) Our retreat is a perfect place for you to relax and reconnect with family and friends.

neighborhood_overview: Walk a few blocks to the Asilomar State Park and beach entrance. From there, you may stroll the beach and miles of coastal paths. Asilomar Beach is perfect for tide-pooling and is also the only beach in the area that welcomes dogs. We are walking distance to the beginning of 17-mile drive, one of the most scenic drives in the world and to the Monarch Sanctuary, where thousands of monarch butterflies winter after their migration from Canada.  Downtown Pacific Grove, with its quaint shops and excellent restaurants, is a 6-minute car ride away.   Nearby Lovers Point offers a protected sandy beach, great for kids, swimming, and snorkeling. Directions to all these places are in our guide, which we mail to you before you come. Downtown Carmel is only 15 minutes away. If you want to venture further afield, Big Sur is an hour's drive along the stunning coast road.
house_rules: Children of all ages are welcome. We accept dogs but not cats.

summary: Charming private get-away within walking distance to Lover's Point, Asilomar State Beach, Downtown Pacific Grove, Washington Park,  Lighthouse, and Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, and of course the Monterey Bay Aquarium (2 guest passes provided). Cannery Row is just a short hop away. 17 Mile Drive begins a block away towards George Washington Park. Ocean peak view from the upstairs bedroom, and clear view of the Monterey Bay. Live oaks on property providing an enchanted forest feel. License#0417
space: Beautiful fenced yard, private location, restored 1920s home with modern amenities and plenty of charm. Gourmet Kitchen.

Complimentary guest passes (2) to Monterey Bay Aquarium. They're on the dining table near the front door. If it's dark out never fear: press the Schlage button [top of the keypad] and it will light up the keypad. Enter the code, door
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighbors, and occasional deer in season.
notes: Private/Secluded side yard for making smores.
transit: Walk 0.7 miles down cedar to the world famous Lover's Point, or just over a mile to the Monterey Aquarium in the same direction on the famous coastal trail (approx 1.3 miles away). Heading the other direction you will cross George Washington Park where you are likely to see deer many months of the year, and head down Pico Ave towards Asilomar State Beach (also less than a mile). Downtown Pacific Grove is a very short walk away.
access: Complimentary guest passes (2) to Monterey Bay Aquarium. They're on the dining table near the front door. Check-in procedure is as simple as showing up, finding the front door [faces Pine, cant miss it!] and entering the provided code on the smartlock. If it's dark out never fear: press the Schlage button [top of the keypad] and it will light up the keypad. Enter the code, door unlocks. We keep an actual keyring with the side/door key on a keyring by that side door hanging on the coat-hanger on the wall there if you find using the side door more convenient. Please remember to drop it off here as you leave. To lock the sidedoor behind you, just use the key you'll find on that coathanger near the sidedor. To lock the smart lock behind you just close the door and push the 'schlage' button on the top of the keypad. Super easy, you'll hear it whir and then close behind you. Opening will require the code to be entered, but to lock just hit that 'schlage' button on your way out.
interaction: Getting access to the house is as easy as possible. The front door is a smart-lock and you will be given a unique code. Backdoor has a separate lock that you will be able to use throughout your stay.
house_rules: NO smoking at all, please.  The gas fireplace is the process of repair and cannot be used at this time. Our neighbors are welcoming/friendly but please keep the charm of the neighborhood intact and not ruin our welcome by being excessively loud past approximately 9pm.  We also request you remove your shoes while in the house. We recently replaced/resurfaced all the flooring. House slippers or socks encouraged! The upstairs area has a separate thermostat/furnace on the wall. If guests are staying upstairs you'll want to set the thermostat to something comfortable as the downstairs furnace doesnt seem to quite warm the upstairs up sufficiently -it will be a couple degrees cooler than whatever is set downstairs in colder months. For those who plan on bringing their furry friends - well behaved pets are welcome.  We have a doggie dining set and treats in the kitchen, and a dog bed in the master bedroom.  Pets are NOT allowed on beds, chairs and couches. If it's in the fridge--help yourself
host_about:
Long term Californian from the Bay Area , but originally SoCal. Surfing is my favorite hobby feel free to ask me about local spots and even Santa Cruz or spots further still. Getting to know the local mtb spots like Fort Ord and Toro Park [across the road there], also familiar with further spots like Santa Cruz mtns and the spots off Skyline Dr. on the peninsula.

I hope you enjoy your stay and expect that you will have a good time in our spot in Pacific Grove.

name: Pacific Grove Casa Del Mar
summary: This home on Ocean View Blvd. sits directly across from the Pacific Grove Coastal Trail and just a short walk away from Monterey Bay Aquarium (3 blocks), Cannery Row, Downtown Pacific Grove and Lover’s Point. There is a fantastic ocean view with no obstructions from the open space living room, kitchen and dining area. Wake up and watch the waves from two of the three bedrooms.
space: This 1700 sq. ft., one story home, is easily accessible from the carport, which has space for three cars. It is walking distance to great restaurants and bars but has a wonderful kitchen that is great for staying in and enjoying the view. Watch for otters, seals and whales... lots of activity in front of this house (Casa Del Mar). This is a 3-bedroom, 2 bath luxury home. The master bedroom (The Butterfly Room) has a Sleep Number bed and an attached bathroom with a soaker bathtub, separate shower, double sinks and a walk in closet. Wake up to see the ocean while lying in bed. Fall asleep watching the flat screen LED Smart TV. The back bedroom (The California Room) has a king bed with a memory foam mattress, it can also be split into two XL twin beds. There is a flat screen TV and DVD player in this room. name: Pacific Grove Retreat
summary: PG Retreat is bright, sunny, and centrally located.  Just a few minutes walk to beach, walking trails,  Pacific Grove golf Links, Spanish Bay,  Asilomar, The Light House and The Butterfly Sanctuary!  Our home has a fenced private yard so great for kids to play, and although we love furry friends, no pets please!  Great meeting place for families and friends! Walk to downtown, the beach or golf! Beach chairs and beach toys available for family fun at the beach! Quiet but yet close to everything!
space: The entire house is available to you including an outdoor fire table, great for roasting marshmallows with family and friends!!  We have several throw blankets available for your use should anyone feel the need!!!  Our yard is very sunny so great for sitting and enjoying the outdoors!!!

interaction: We are available anytime if questions arise during your stay!!  We enjoy hosting and appreciate hearing from you, so please feel free to contact us!!  Upon your arrival you will find an informative binder of some of our favorite spots and activities in the area!!  Our home is quiet but yet close and walking distance to many great spots in Pacific Grove!!!
house_rules: - We hope you will enjoy your stay in Pacific Grove and thank you ahead of time for staying, and observing our house rules.  The City of Pacific Grove requires hosts to obtain a permit to operate a short term Rental.  Our permit number is 0263.  We must comply with several city imposed rules in order to keep our permit in good standing.  So we are grateful to our guests for helping us maintain our permit and observing these house rules. - Quiet hours past 10:00 p.m. and before 8:00 a.m. - Please park in designated areas.   Driveway, side of home, or front of home.    (no more than (4) cars please) - Absolutely no smoking in our home, please. - No pets on premises. - Please do not leave any wet towels or linens on hardwood floors. Thank you

name: Monarch Garden Cottage 30 Day Rental
summary: Completely furnished private studio guestroom located on the 1/3 acre gardens of a historic Craftsman home just a few blocks from Monterey Bay and the Aquarium.  This 200 sf "tiny house" was completely renovated in 2015 and has lovely amenities.
space: The comfortable memory foam bed is a "short queen",  queen size in width and double in length,  the perfect size for "tiny house" living.  Our Comphy brand bedding makes for a luxurious night's sleep.  Wireless WiFi is easy to access however there is no television...relax and enjoy getting away!  There is plenty of parking on the street and covered storage for bikes.  Located just 4 blocks from the Bay.

neighborhood_overview: We are just 6 blocks from The Aquarium and Cannery Row.  5 minute drive to historic Monterey and Fishermans Wharf.  15 minute drive to Carmel.  Pacific Grove is a charming town with local shops and restaurants to explore as well as the coast line of the tip of the Monterey Peninsula.
notes: The studio cottage is in our backyard, so we will see you sometimes coming and going and will say Hello!

summary: Escape completely to peaceful Pacific Grove.  This super clean, well-stocked, cozy post-adobe duplex is waiting for you. An easy walk to Trader Joe's and 10+ restaurants. You have access to one whole side of the duplex with two bedrooms and one bathroom - very private. Peaks of the ocean from upstairs (a mile away) and private backyard patio space with laundry room. Games and books - Enjoy the games - take a book/leave a book.  Beach items - toys, chairs, towels and umbrella are available upon request. There are two bedrooms and a full bathroom with bathtub. neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is right on the Pacific Ocean and if you are looking for peace and quiet then you have found the right place.   Our home is located in an great part of town - easy access to In-Shape, Trader Joe's and tons of restaurants in walking distance.
transit: Plenty of off street parking.  Bus stop is only half a block away.
access: This AirBnB unit is part of a duplex.  Both sides of the duplex are AirBnB rentals.  Each unit has complete privacy and is completely self contained.   Each unit has it's own parking area.  This unit (1139) has parking in the front near the steps to the front yard gate.  Additional cars can park on the wood chip area in front of the house - accessed via the neighboring driveway (which is fine to use).   There is a shared laundry room on site with brand new full size washer and dryer.  Soap, etc. is provided.  Each unit has an outside table and chairs for dining out on the back patio.  Each unit has it's own dedicated fenced front yard.
interaction: I am typically available for assistance should you need anything and happy to help you make the most of your time here with recommendations, however, there are occasions where I might not be in town. I always have a local caretaker who can be reached. We always let guests know ahead of time when we won't be in town, and we're generally reachable by phone/email/text regardless.
house_rules: AirBnB House Rules - Shoes policy: Please live ALOHA – go barefoot.  Please leave your shoes outside and help us keep the home clean.   - Parking: Plenty of off street parking.  - Guests under the age of 21: We have a minimum age requirement for booking our home of 21+. Guests under the age of 21 are still entirely welcome, however, must be accompanied by parents or guardians who will be responsible for them. - Check-in/out times: Check-in is at 3pm, and check-out is by noon. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first and we will do our best to accommodate you. - Cleanliness: We do a thorough professional clean between each guest stay, we kindly ask that you leave it as clean and tidy as possible.   AirBnB only requires/requests hosts to wash the sheets and towels.  That is not good enough for me.  We go the extra step and every blanket and mattress pad is washed in between every guest.  In addition, every mattress has a
host_about: Moved to the Monterey area in early 90's and will never leave.  We love living by the ocean and it has been an amazing place to raise a family.  Hope you enjoy your stay here in our little slice of heaven.

name: Seashell in Pacific Grove, CA
summary: Pacific Grove`s Seashell Vacation Rental 1 Bed 1 Bath
space: “The Seashell” is located on a quaint Pacific Grove street with a peek of the Bay decorated with a charming “seashell beach” theme. You`ll feel like a local in this one bedroom, one bathroom downstairs duplex. You’ll be within a four block walking distance to downtown, the iconic ocean side walking and biking trail, The Monterey Bay Aquarium and Monterey`s famous Cannery Row. Downtown Pacific Grove, with its wonderful restaurants, movie theater, and first class shopping are also within walking distance. A great feature of the bedroom is a patio door that opens directly onto a beautiful rose garden where you can sit and enjoy the afternoon sun or taking your coffee or tea. The fireplace can be enjoyed from the dining and living room areas to create an ideal ambiance for a romantic meal, followed by curling up on the cozy sofa for a movie with the 40” Smart TV with an updated cable package and Wi-Fi. neighborhood_overview: Quick access to everything the area has to offer, all while tucked away on a quiet Pacific Grove street.
notes: This property is located in a quiet, residential area where most of the residents live full-time.  Please respect your neighbors and their right to quiet enjoyment of their properties. ▪   By local ordinance, "quiet time" is between 10 pm and 8 am. Loud music and noise are prohibited. ▪   Overnight guests shall not exceed the property’s scheduled occupancy. ▪   No large groups, gatherings, receptions, or events are allowed. ▪   Please park in designated spaces (the garage, carport, or driveway as applicable). If you need to park on the street, please be very careful not to block the driveways of neighbors. ▪   Please put all trash in the containers provided.  Be sure the lids are secure, to prevent our local wildlife from raiding the containers!
transit: Public transportation is available and very close. We also have plenty of Uber vehicles always in circulation around the peninsula.
access: Laundry, Wi-Fi, Off-Street Parking
interaction: We are only a phone call, email, or a short walk to our office.  We`re here if you need us!
house_rules: TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT  Pacific Grove Rentals, dba, (agent for the landlord) and GUEST NAME and his/her guests are jointly liable for the terms of this agreement. Pacific Grove Rentals makes this agreement as agent on behalf of the owner and guest to rent the premises as a temporary guest under the terms listed. This rental agreement is unique to the registered guest and may not be sublet or otherwise assigned to any other person. 1. RESERVATIONS  All reservations require a 50% deposit to reserve. Balance is due 45 days before arrival. Reservations made within 45 days of arrival will require payment in full at the time the reservation is made. Pacific Grove Rentals permits the payment of rent by use of a credit card such as Visa, MasterCard, Cashier’s Check or Money Order. A valid credit card must be on file, even if the initial deposit is not paid by credit card.  2. ARRIVAL/DEPARTURE TIMES  Check-in time is 3:00 p.m. and check-out time is 10:00 a.m. ANY GUEST CHECKING OUT LATER THAN
host_about:
Rhonda is the managing broker of Pacific Grove Rentals. Their goal is to make your stay with them pleasurable enough to leave you longing to come back! They love where they live and can't wait to share it with you!

name: Pacific Grove Willis House, Walk to Town and Beach
summary: Enjoy the remodeled Willis House in the heart of Pacific Grove and experience the Monterey Peninsula like a local. Downtown PG is a four-block stroll and Lovers Point Park & Beach is another four blocks. A bike ride or short drive takes you to Asilomar State Beach, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and the towns of Monterey, Pebble Beach, and Carmel. Enjoy the Concours d'Elegance, AT&T golf tournament, Jazz Festival, and other marquee events. Or take a road trip to Big Sur or a whale-watching cruise.
space: Our historical house was built by William Willis in 1904 and remodeled by us in 2017. You'll find inviting human-scaled rooms, wood furniture, and bright common areas with plenty of windows. The kitchen has a gourmet gas range, ample cooking equipment, modern appliances, engineered stone countertops, and a separate dining area. The bedrooms at the rear of the house, away from the street, are quiet and have blackout curtains and comfortable furnishings. One bedroom has a queen bed and the other has two twin XL beds (which are the same length as a queen bed). The house is 1100 square feet.
description: Enjoy the remodeled Willis House in the heart of Pacific Grove and experience the Monterey Peninsula like a local. Downtown PG is a four-block stroll and Lovers Point Park & Beach is another four blocks. A bike ride or short drive takes you to Asilomar State Beach, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, and the towns of Monterey, Pebble Beach, and Carmel. Enjoy the Concours d'Elegance, AT&T golf tournament, Jazz Festival, and other marquee events. Or take a road trip to Big Sur or a whale-watching cruise. neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is situated centrally on the Monterey Peninsula between the towns of Monterey and Pebble Beach. Our neighborhood is residential, quiet, and filled with well-maintained older houses and cottages of vernacular architectural styles, particularly Victorian, Craftsman, Stick, and Shotgun. It's an easy four-block walk to downtown's restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, banks, shops, art studios, and churches. You'll also find a grocery store, first-run movie theater, hardware store, pharmacy, library, natural history museum, and post office. Four blocks from downtown (eight blocks from the house) is Lovers Point Park & Beach, where you can relax on the sand or grass, or rent bikes, kayaks, standup paddleboards, or family surreys from Adventures By The Sea. Surfers and divers will find outfitters in Monterey. In Pacific Grove's commercial district (distinct from downtown and a one-mile drive from the house), you'll find larger stores and chains such as Safeway, Trader Joe's, Rite
notes: Please read the House Rules to determine whether this house is right for you. City of Pacific Grove License 0386.
transit: Almost all our guests arrive by car, but some walk or bicycle for all or most of their stay. Both downtown Pacific Grove and the ocean are a short stroll away. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 1.7-mile coastal walk or bike ride, the Pebble Beach gate is a 1-mile bike ride, and Carmel Beach is a moderately hilly 8-mile bike ride. Costco and Target in Sand City are a 6-mile bike ride mostly on off-street bike paths. Avid cyclists notwithstanding, longer trips (Point Lobos, Big Sur, Carmel Valley) require a car.
access: Park in the single-car driveway on the side of the house. Enter through the side door by using a personal 4-digit code that we'll provide prior to your arrival (no key is needed). You have full use of the house except for the attic and the office, both of which are used for personal storage and are locked.
interaction: We live in the detached cottage next door but the extent of our interaction is up to you. You can reach us by email, text, phone, or in person (just knock on our door). We've lived in Pacific Grove for more than 10 years and are happy to answer questions about the house, the town, and the area. We'll do our best to solve any problems that might arise during your stay.
house_rules: BOOKING. You must be 25 or older to book this house, and be one of the guests during the entire stay. No more than four overnight guests are allowed. CHECK-IN. Keyless self check-in at 3:00 PM or later. Unlock the side door (near the driveway) by using the four-digit code that we provide prior to your arrival. This code is erased after checkout. CHECKOUT. Check out by 11:00 AM. Our cleaning schedule is such that we don't allow late checkouts. PARKING. Pull in to the single-car driveway next to the house (to the right of the house when viewed from the front). Please park in only the driveway. If you bring a second vehicle, park in front of the house or yard. TWO VEHICLES MAX. Guests are limited to two vehicles by town ordinance. NO OVERSIZE VEHICLES. Our driveway can't accommodate recreational vehicles (RVs) or tow trailers, and local laws prohibit parking such vehicles in certain areas at certain times. If you have questions prior to arriving, call Pacific Grove City Hall or search onl
host_about: I spent much of my life in New York and San Francisco but now I take pleasure in small-town living. I find peace when I'm in the wilderness, on an uncrowded beach, or in the ocean. Hosting to me is more a way of life than a business. I enjoy meeting people and hearing their stories, but I also appreciate their need for privacy. Should we pass each other during the course of your stay, feel free to ask a question, chat, or just wave hello.

host_about: Local artist who also works as an occupational therapist specializing in pain management.  I have not owned a car since 2009, and sail/kayak in the Monterey Bay if I'm not on one of my amazing bikes.  I live just up the street in a 110 year old Victorian where my children grew up into better adults than I am, both of whom are Junior Olympians in volleyball.  Sometimes I love sitting in the Art House or The LIttle Blue House more than my own -- peaceful and serene doesn't do it justice....

name: NEW! 3BR Pacific Grove Villa - Walk to Beach!

Boasting 2,200 square feet of beautifully appointed living space, this Mediterranean style 2-story villa features a balcony with an ocean view and a spacious backyard area with a large hot tub, outdoor seating and a fireplace. Just steps from the beach and downtown, this home ensures a rejuvenating retreat for all!

Walk up the stairs on the left of the garage and make your way to the front yard, where vibrant greenery and lush plantings invite you up another set of stairs and into the lovely home. Step inside to be greeted by the unique floor plan, where all of the bedrooms of the home are located on the first floor, and the living room and kitchen are on the second floor.  Wander around the first floor to find each inviting bedroom, which each feature comfortable beds that you’ll happily snuggle up in at the end of each exciting day. Head upstairs to make yourself at home in the open concept living area, sitting area, den, dining area, and kitchen. neighborhood_overview: Whenever you’re not relaxing in the comfort of your home-away-from-home, make a point to explore the surrounding areas of this ideally-located home! Take a short 10-minute stroll to the beach and soak up the sun by the sandy shores. Walk or bike along the ocean trail, which leads to Monterey, where there is an abundance of attractions, such as the Monterey Bay Aquarium and numerous restaurants. The home is also within walking distance of downtown Pacific Grove, where there are many great restaurants and shops to suit everyone’s tastes and interests. The golfers of the group will be especially ecstatic to find that the Pebble Beach Golf Course is just a 10-minute drive away from the home!
notes: Key Residence Features: - Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, balcony with ocean views, backyard with large hot tub, fireplace, outdoor furniture, BBQ grill, central air conditioning, cable TVs, 2-car garage, wireless internet access, and much more - Great location - 10-minute walk to the beach, downtown Pacific Grove, and shopping, and just a 10-minute drive to Pebble Beach Golf Course!
interaction: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is on a mission to make vacation rental easy for guests. Every property in our network has been vetted and verified so you can book with confidence. If you have questions prior to your trip, we are happy to assist you 7 days a week. During your stay, your designated Guest Contact will be available 24/7 to help with any issues that may arise.
house_rules: Policies: - No smoking - No pets allowed - Small events, parties and large gatherings are considered with prior homeowner approval (please inquire with Evolve for additional information) - Must be at least 25 years old to book - Additional fees and taxes may apply - Photo ID may be required upon check-in - Long-term rentals are accepted, please inquire within for pro-rated pricing
host_about:
Hi, we’re Evolve! We’re a next-generation vacation rental management company and we’re here to help you find the perfect home for your getaway.

All of our properties adhere to our 4 Core Property Standards, so you’ll always arrive to a home that’s Safe, Clean, Guest Ready and As Advertised.

If you have any questions about our properties (or would like help finding one), please do reach out. We’re real human beings and we’re available to assist you 7 days a week!

name: By The Sea - STR License Number 0412
summary: Our place is located one block from Monterey Bay and the recreation trail. We are walking distance to the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Cannery Row, and downtown Pacific Grove. We are a longer walk or a short drive to Fisherman's Wharf. Monterey, Carmel, Pebble Beach are all a 10 minute drive away. Walking distance to many shops and restaurants.
space: We do have wi fi and if you need to work on a lap top, the dining table will work well for that.

We do have wi fi and if you need to work on a lap top, the dining table will work well for that. Guests have full private access to the apartment - living room, dining area, bathroom, kitchen, two bedrooms. Our space is a duplex. We live on the top floor and are just a text away if you need anything. We are on a very quiet street one block from the ocean, a few blocks from the Monterey Bay Aquarium, walking distance to Cannery Row, Downtown Pacific Grove, and a further walk to Monterey's Fisherman's Wharf.

host_about: I grew up in Pacific Grove and my husband and I settled here in 1993. Our primary day to day work includes doing dog rescue, publishing a magazine called Coastal Canine, and doing pet photography. We can't think of any better place in the world to live than the Monterey Peninsula and look forward to helping others enjoy this beautiful area.

name: Mermaid's Delight
summary: Mermaid's Delight is our cozy, welcoming two bedrooms, one bath beach bungalow retreat.  Our home is listed on the Pacific Grove Historical Society proudly with a plaque on our door "Callie Thomas ". We do hope that you enjoy our “get-away” place as much as we do.  We are just a few steps from the Monterey Bay Sanctuary our major cross street is the famous Ocean View Blvd.  Enjoy the tranquility and the time to un-plug from the hustle & bustle of our busy lives.   Permit #0407
space: We do have on-site parking available for two vehicles plus as an added convenience. (to the left of the house is plenty of additional parking) The upstairs master bedroom (with ocean views) has a queen bed and desk that looks straight out to the ocean. Open the side windows in the evening and hear the sounds of the crashing waves and the roar of the ocean.  It literally sounds like you are on the beach!  The master bedroom has its own private electric fireplace that provides heat as well as the comforts of a home.  The downstairs bedroom has a  brand new oversized memory comfort twin size bed and and a trundled bed (pull out the 2nd mattress below) with a new comfort mattress as well.  There is a sitting area with a flat screen TV with cable to enjoy movies and such. The bathroom tastefully decorated in two tone paint with wainscoating, with separate stall shower, is on the main level of the bungalow. It has a newer vanity with marble counter top.   Granite countertops with bar stool s

neighborhood_overview: This is an historic retreat area with adorable beach bungalows along the prettiest coastline California has to offer.  Lover's Point is just a few houses away with a beach great for small children.  There's a snack bar there with amazing veggie burgers.  Bikes, surreys and kayak rentals are located there as well.
notes: This world-famous locale is loaded with restaurants, cafes, coffee houses, museums, the Monterey Bay Aquarium, the Carmel Mission and sites of early California history.  And on the water you can go kayaking, boating, and whale watching.
transit: Bike, surreys and kayak rentals are at Lover's Point beach.  From there you can ride to Cannery Row, a mile away and see seals pupping on the beaches.  Downtown is a few blocks walk from the house with delightful century old Victorians along the way.
access: Wishing you much fun, relaxation & adventure as you explore our beautiful area! (The small downstairs closet and a pantry in the hallway are for the owners use only.)  Please contact our manager Joy to arrange your visit she would be glad to assist you in your travels!
interaction: The manager, Joy, is available by text, email, or phone 24 hours a day and lives very close to our house.  She can meet with you if needed but otherwise, you are free to enjoy your vacation.
house_rules: - Please be quiet in the patio area after 9PM
host_about: We love the ocean and living so close to it. It is a go to place to relax, unwind and have fun!

name: Dream Cottage in Pacific Grove, CA
summary: Pacific Grove`s Dream Cottage 2 bedroom 1 bath
space: Dream Cottage is exquisitely located within 5 blocks walking distance to Lover’s Point, the beach and the ocean side walking/bike trail. From here you can head off on a short jaunt to the Monterey Bay Aquarium and famous Cannery Row or in the other direction to Asilomar Beach. In just 2 blocks, you are on Lighthouse Avenue and downtown Pacific Grove’s quaint shops and restaurants.From your doorstep you are only steps away from lovely local treats. Venturing in your car, you are just 3-5 minutes from the renowned Asilomar Beach where you can walk, picnic or sit and soak in the day. The Pacific Coast Highway, Big Sur, Nepenthé and the majesty of Highway 1 can comprise a wondrous day trip of gorgeous vistas to remember forever. This cottage is bright and cheerfully decorated and offers all the comforts to make you feel right at home and all on a roomy corner lot. Reservations made within 45 days of arrival will require payment in full at the time the reservation is made. Pacific Grove Rentals permits the payment of rent by use of a credit card such as Visa, MasterCard, Cashier’s Check or Money Order. A valid credit card must be on file, even if the initial deposit is not paid by credit card. 2. ARRIVAL/DEPARTURE TIMES  Check-in time is 3:00 p.m. and check-out time is 10:00 a.m. ANY GUEST CHECKING OUT LATER THAN 10:00 A.M. WILL BE CHARGED A LATE CHECKOUT FEE OF $75.00. Should guest continue to occupy the premises after the effective date of departure, guest will be considered to be “holding over” and will pay a rent amount equal to twice the daily amount rental amount and the cost of alternative housing for guest displaced by my holding over and any additional housekeeping charges may be charged to the credit card. name: NEWLY REMODELED Pacific Grove Home w/spa (#0406)
summary: Our newly remodeled home is a short walk from the bay, Lovers Point, and downtown Pacific Grove, and just a mile from the Aquarium along the coastal trail. It offers a sunlit open floor plan, 2 bedrooms with ample closet and drawer space, a large fenced backyard with hot tub,  generous off-street parking and a bit of an ocean view. A bright, spacious new kitchen with island, large dining table, and cozy living  and  family rooms with fireplaces make for a casual and comfortable retreat. #0406
space: Our single-story home features all new finishings, kitchen appliances, a hot tub and many other amenities thanks to a major renovation.  We're in a quiet neighborhood across the street from the Pacific Grove Golf Course, with a peek of the bay just 400 yards away.  There's ample parking in a large driveway and on the street in front. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 20-minute coastal walk or quick bike ride away. Pacific Grove is tucked in between Pebble Beach/Carmel and Monterey with four miles of California's most beautiful, rocky shoreline. The Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary offers spectacular wildlife, including myriad seabirds and a thriving population of sea otters, seals, sea lions, and even whales. The coastal trail is perfect for running and biking. Downtown PG is charming and a short walk away. You can rent kayaks or bikes at nearby Lover's Point. A large, private backyard with patio is great for barbecues. The front lawn is artificial turf with a golf cup and flag for
description: Our newly remodeled home is a short walk from the bay, Lovers Point, and downtown Pacific Grove, and just a mile from the Aquarium along the coastal trail. It offers a sunlit open floor plan, 2 bedrooms with ample closet and drawer space, a large fenced backyard with hot tub,  generous off-street parking and a bit of an ocean view. A bright, spacious new kitchen with island, large dining table, and cozy living  and  family rooms with fireplaces make for a casual and comfortable retreat. #0406 Our single-story home features all new finishings, kitchen appliances, a hot tub and many other amenities thanks to a major renovation.  We're in a quiet neighborhood across the street from the Pacific Grove Golf Course, with a peek of the bay just 400 yards away.  There's ample parking in a large driveway and on the street in front. The Monterey Bay Aquarium is a 20-minute coastal walk or quick bike ride away. Pacific Grove is tucked in between Pebble Beach/Carmel and Monterey with four miles of
neighborhood_overview: PG is an often-overlooked coastal gem. Its tree-lined streets and Victorian architecture still evoke faint echos of its 19th century days as a Methodist retreat. Our neighborhood is also the shoreline of the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary, and our home is just across from the Pacific Grove Golf Links, adding wonderful open space. It's a short, easy walk to both downtown "PG" with its quaint B&Bs, coffeehouses and restaurants, as well as the Coastal Recreation Trail and the beach at Lovers Point where you can rent kayaks, bicycles and surreys.  Our street is wide and the driveway is large enough for large vehicles and even an RV. We're also convenient to major and local events, being a short drive or bike ride from the Concours d'Elegance,  AT&T tournament, Jazz Festival and other Peninsula special events. Pacific Grove has its own hometown events well worth taking in, from Good Old Days in April to the Butterfly Parade in October. The monarch butterfly sanctuary is a short walk
notes: It is a residential neighborhood so we do hope, and ask, you respect the neighbors' quiet and privacy.
transit: We have a spacious driveway that could easily fit 4-5 cars and/or an RV (PG doesn't allow overnight parking of RVs on-street.)  There is a bus stop just a two blocks down the street if needed, though the entire community is very walk-able, with easy access to a variety of shops, restaurants and coffee bars.
access: The entire home other than the master bedroom and garage is available to guests. Our kitchen is well-equipped and stocked with all you'll likely need in the way of spices, condiments, etc, and you're welcome to use most all of what you find in the fridge and cupboards. The large family room has a queen sofabed and can be closed off for privacy as a third bedroom.
interaction: If we're in town, we'll be available by phone or in person right away, or will get back within 4-6  hours at the most if we're not available when you call. If for any reason we're out of town and not readily reachable by phone, we will have a local property manager you can call should you need anything.
host_about:
Hank and I have raised three daughters (now all in their 20's) in this home.  In 2016 we decided to undergo a major remodel to turn our house from child-centric to a comfortable open living space to enjoy and entertain.  We're loving it and hope you do too!
We're active 60-somethings who love the sport of triathlon and its individual components of running, biking and swimming. The Monterey Peninsula is a great place for active people.
We love traveling (you'll see the world map with our family's various travel spots), both domestically and abroad.  Our newest purchase is an RV to explore the U.S.

name: NEW! Charming 3BR Cottage Walk To Town & Beach!
summary: #0379. Welcome to a charming, cozy 3 bed, 2 bath updated Victorian cottage in desirable downtown location & a short stroll to beach! Quaint neighborhood, easy walk to Lover's Point beach & scenic recreation trail! Sleeps up to six guests-ideal for 3 couples, 4 singles, or small families. Walk to beach, cafe's, fine restaurants, boutique shops, parks, theatre, farmer's & local market. Walk scenic path to Cannery Row, Monterey Bay Aquarium, Fisherman's Wharf, sailing & whale watching adventures!
space: Charming & updated 3 bed, 2 bath cottage built in the Victorian style with a covered front porch that provides a quiet perch to watch the sunrise while enjoying your morning coffee & watching the world go by! Overlooking front flower garden, a charming tree-lined street & a beautiful old oak tree, this is the quaint & coveted neighborhood for locals & travelers alike. In town location, walk to cafe's & beach from this vacation home which offers the best Pacific Grove has to offer. While still maintaining it's exterior Victorian charm, the cottage has been modernized over the years & provides a warm & welcoming home base with all the comforts of home. Steps up to the front door from the street level to the the interior of the cottage offering a cozy 1306 sf (approximately) single level with private & enclosed patio area with BBQ off kitchen. Overlooking front flower garden, a charming tree-lined street & a beautiful old oak tree, this is the quaint & coveted neighborhood for locals & travelers alike. In town location, walk to cafe's & beach from this vacation home which offers the best Pacific Grove has to offer. While still mai
neighborhood_overview: This historic "retreat" neighborhood of Pacific Grove is highly coveted and sought after by second home owners & vacationers from around the world. Attracted by the many charming Victorian houses that comprise this neighborhood & the close proximity to the beautiful beach & town, this neighborhood is a walkers paradise so park the car & enjoy all the nearby activities. This neighborhood is filled with quaint cottages that surround a lovely tree-lined central park where people can enjoy picnicking & even basket ball. For younger children, the park offers hours of play time on the various play equipment. Located in the heart of town, walk to a day at the beach or the Monterey Recreation Trail for a great afternoon of fun. In summer, you will discover the beach in a protected cove that often provides a calm sanctuary for water play & next to the beach, the trail offers biking and walking along a spectacular coastline where sea otters frolic in the kelp & whales and dolphins may be observe
notes: The garbage is collected every week early on Tuesday mornings so please empty all garbage cans & recycle items in the outside cans on Monday afternoon so the gardener or Richard can take them out to the street curb for the early morning removal. He will also collect the empty garbage receptacles on Tuesday & return them to there spot behind house. Every third Wednesday of the month, the street cleaners ask for cars to be moved to park side of the street for early morning street cleaning. These details will be in the notebook.
transit: Off street parking is available in the neighborhood. Limit to two vehicles. Public transportation is within easy walking distance to the property.
access: The entire house is available.
interaction: Upon arrival, either my husband Richard or I will be here at the property to greet you & give you the keys. Occasionally, we will have a property manager to greet if we are unavailable. Also, when we aren't sailing, we live nearby & will be available to offer help throughout your stay if there is anything you need or any questions regarding the cottage. In addition, I have put together a helpful guidebook full of information about the area including favorite restaurants, hiking spots and other points of interest in our historically rich area.
house_rules: - No smoking allowed anywhere on property. - No candles or other flammables allowed on premises. - In general we ask that our guests be aware of noise levels as the house is in close proximity to neighbors. The city of Pacific Grove has a strict 10pm noise ordinance as well. - No gatherings or parties. Please no one on premises other than renters. - Weber gas grill: Please carefully read directions in house binder. - If there are accidental spills on furniture or rugs during your stay, please let us know right away and we will have a professional cleaning service attend to it. Please do not attempt to clean on your own. - Please use the beach towels when going to the beach. Please do not take bath towels to the beach. - Upon departure: please clean counter tops in kitchen and bathrooms & load dishes in dishwasher. Please take garbage and recyclables outside to garbage cans. Lock all doors & drop key through front door mail slot.
host_about: My husband Richard & I have lived on the Monterey Peninsula for over 50 years and raised our family here in Pacific Grove. We are life long travelers & sailors and have logged many miles throughout the years sailing along the coasts of California, Mexico, Central America & throughout the South Pacific to New Zealand & back to California. We love the adventure of meeting new people from around the world & learning about their way of life, their unique perspectives & cultural histories. We have always considered ourselves lucky to return to our home port of Monterey & Pacific Grove as we consider it to be one of the most scenically spectacular places in the world. Pacific Grove is a very special coastal community to us because it offers a small town feel along with this stunning geographic beauty and offers many interesting outdoor activities that we enjoy. A favorite activity just steps from our cottage is our 18 mile bike & walking path where we go to enjoy an evening walk & watch the sunset & sometimes we rent a surrey to take our granddaughter along the spectacular coastline to the Monterey Bay Aquarium & stop to enjoy a picnic along the way at the park along Ocean View Blvd which makes for lasting memories. We enjoy good food & often dine at the fine restaurants in downtown Pacific Grove, nearby Cannery Row, Carmel By-the-Sea, and south to Big Sur. We also enjoy hiking in Point Lobos, Big Sur, & Carmel Valley's Garland Park & of course sailing on beautiful Monterey Bay where whales can be spotted year round to name a few of our favorites places to relax in nature. Just around the corner from Lover's Point Beach & Park, our cottage offers all that makes Pacific Grove a destination to enjoy. Our beach house offers a casual & relaxing get-a-way to share with family and friends & we look forward to offering this special place to fellow intrepid travelers from around the world.

Its a short 1/2 mile walk to watch the sunset at Pico Beach.   Located in a quiet area close to town and beaches.  Convenient to Pebble Beach, Carmel, Monterey, Big Sur and all that Pacific Grove has to offer. We are fully permitted through the City of Pacific Grove and hold the license #0303
space: You will enjoy your stay in our open and spacious home. Our place is very clean and has all the amenities you will need to feel at home. We are walking distance to beautiful beaches and our quaint historic downtown.

We love Mt biking, skiing, music, playing in the ocean & lakes, food & drink and most importantly having fun with our family & friends. We're happy to share our home with you while we're out on our adventures.

name: Pacific Grove Stunner
summary: For your comfort, we offer the master suite with a King-sized bed in our PG home. The room boasts a vaulted ceiling with French doors that open onto an outside atrium. Additional beds are available for a family of three or four. Although it is listed as "Private Room,"  a 2nd bedroom is available upon request. No spaces are shared except the kitchen. Message us for more details. (City of Pacific Grove License #0413, expires 3/31/2019. )
space: The home is located in the most desirable area of Pacific Grove, about three blocks from the Lovers' Point, one block from the municipal golf course, and two blocks from downtown Pacific Grove. Pacific Grove is often called Butterfly Town, U.S.A. because it is an annual nesting spot for migratory monarch butterflies as they travel south for the winter. There are many historic spots, and fine dining establishments throughout town, and in nearby Monterey and Carmel, too.

In addition to the master suite, the guests can also use the dining room and livin
neighborhood_overview: This abode stands in a quiet, highly-desirable residential neighborhood just three minutes' walk from the Pacific Ocean beach at Lovers' Point. The area is highly amenable to foot traffic, and one can easily stroll the streets to reach downtown restaurants and shopping spots. The weather is typically moderate, with temperatures ranging between cool and warm, but almost never very hot or very cold. The Pacific Ocean attenuates the local climate, giving it a pleasant atmosphere throughout most of the year.
notes: 1. Additional fee will apply for a family with three or four guests, $25 per person, per day for the 3rd and/or 4th guests.  2. You will be welcome to enjoy our backyard patio, and to stroll the paver path amidst the surrounding garden.  3. We offer free, high-speed wi-fi connections, giving you easy access to the Internet. Most domestic cell phones get good reception in P.G. and the surrounding area.  4. We offer hot tea, coffee and bottle water. 5. The hosts have lived on the Monterey Peninsula for over 25 years and are very familiar with the local area.
access: 1. In addition to the master suite, the guests can also use the dining room and living room. You may relax in the spacious living room and enjoy reading, and leisure activities there. Our guests also have access to the back and side yards, and the outside patio and garden.  2. Laundry facilities are available for the guests to use.  3. Two free Monterey Bay Aquarium passes are available for guests who book two nights or more, upon request, on first come first serve basis.  4. Free parking on the driveway or street parking in front of the house. 5. Extra storage space is available in the garage for the guests who need to store their bikes and other large equipments.
interaction: We will strive to make our guests feel at home. We are experienced Airbnb hosts, and will be happy to converse and interact with our guests to the extent they desire. In any event, they will have complete privacy in their expansive master bedroom suite, and should feel completely at home. If you intend to enjoy fine dining, the hosts are familiar with several local restaurant owners and will happily arrange a dining reservation for you (we will get you V.I.P. treatment!!).
house_rules: 1. FREE Monterey Bay Aquarium passes: Upon request, we will provide two free passes to our guests who book two or more nights with us on first come first serve basis. 2. While using the kitchen, please do not fry with oil to avoid grease.  3. No smoking, no drug and no pets on the property and in the house, please.
host_about: I am a married female, living with my husband in an expansive home just off Highway 68 between Monterey and Salinas, California. We enjoy waking up with the morning sun reflecting off the bluff walls across the scenic valley, and the smell of the multitude of plants and wildlife that surround us. As you can tell, we love the great outdoors and feel immensely fortunate to enjoy our lovely 5 acre property. I am a cruising aficionado and have taken various jaunts to Mexico, Hawaii, the Caribbean and Europe. Seeing the world, and communicating with new friends from different places and cultures give me a sense of internal satisfaction. Between us, my husband and I speak several languages and have seen most of the states and many foreign countries. We savor the opportunity to curl up with a good book, and have a generous library of all kinds of books throughout the house.

name: Bright room with loft
summary: Bright airy room with loft, one full bed on lower level and a twin mattress in loft.  Guests are free to use remainder of home, which includes living, dining, kitchen, laundry, storage room, yard, and 2 bathrooms.  Parking is available on the street.
space: This room has one full size bed and a twin size mattress in a small loft.  The maximum number of people it can really accommodate is two, but I would accept two adults and a child in the loft.  The loft is NOT suitable for a child too small to navigate a ladder.  The loft has limited headspace and does not allow an adult to fully stand up in it. Guests will have mostly private use of one bathroom. We have two cats.

We are in and out of the house, going about our daily lives, guests are welcome to use the kitchen and fridge for their own food, and relax in the living space.  Laundry is available upon request.
neighborhood_overview: The Monterey Peninsula is a stunning location on the central California coast.  Monterey is home to a great hip downtown scene, New Monterey is home to the kitschy Cannery Row and the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Pacific Grove is a very small and quiet little town with great beach and an awesome coastal trail that borders the coast for miles, Pebble Beach is home to 17 mile drive and also beautiful coastline, Carmel is a beautiful village with great shopping and a gorgeous white sand beach.  Big Sur and wine tasting in Carmel Valley are only a short drive away!  Lots to see and do in this area!

name: 3743 Pelican Peaks - Ocean Views ~ Walk to Aquarium, Beach & Downtown!!
summary: Welcome to Pelican Peaks! Sleeps 4 adults  With beautiful ocean views and the beach just steps from the front door, this Pacific Grove home is truly a bay lover’s dream come true.
space: Welcome to Pelican Peaks! Sleeps 4 adults  With beautiful ocean views and the beach just steps from the front door, this Pacific Grove home is truly a bay lover’s dream come true. The 2-bedroom, 2-bath cottage is a few minutes’ walk from the Monterey Bay Recreation Trail and Andy Jacobson Park, and is within easy walking distance of the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row as well as a variety of restaurants on Pacific Grove’s Central Avenue. Downtown Pacific Grove is just a 5-minute car ride away, and 15 minutes to either charming Carmel-by-the-Sea or golfing and dining in Pebble Beach. The flower-covered home, originally built in 1925, has been enlarged and updated to create light-filled rooms that mix colorful vintage and contemporary furnishings. Hardwood bamboo floors throughout the main level unify the open floor plan that includes a kitchen, living room and dining area. Upon your arrival you will be greeted with complimentary cheese and wine or sparkling cider, passes to the re

Guest will be charged for any wait time for cleaners or managers waiting to service, clean or inspect the home at the time of your scheduled departure deadline if you are still occupying the home past the deadline.  •	NO SMOKING POLICY: This is a strict non-smoking property.  •	AUTHORIZED OCCUPANCY/GUEST LIMIT:  You agree to have no more than the allowed number of guests for occupancy. If more than the stated number of guests are found to be occupying the unit the Managing Agency has the right to terminate this contract and will vacate the premises immediately ensuring the return of all keys. •	USE: Guest agrees
host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: 3749 Victorian Sanctuary by the Sea - Updated,Spacious, Close to Town & Beach
summary: 5 bedrooms, 4.5 bathrooms, walk to downtown, pet friendly,
space: Welcome to Victorian Sanctuary by the Sea! Sleeps 11 adults & 3 children Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home! One of Pacific Grove’s most celebrated historic homes - just a short walk from downtown, the beach, and the monarch butterfly groves - allows you to host your large family gatherings in the gracious style of bygone eras. The 5-bedroom, 4.5-bath home with distant ocean views has been restored and updated, keeping its beautiful Victorian detailing while also adding modern conveniences. Built in 1880, it was the home of Pacific Grove’s first doctor, and is the recipient of a Heritage House Award. Four bedrooms have en suite baths. High ceilings with crown moldings, vintage fixtures, and a secret wine cellar in the kitchen are just a few of the vintage delights to be found in the 2,900-square-foot residence. The décor is a mixture of antique and contemporary style, enhanced by original ar

space: Welcome to “The Guest House”! Sleeps 4 adults. Walk to the Monterey Bay Aquarium from this outstanding location.  Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets when you book this home! name: 3105 The 17th Street House ~ Beautifully Restored Victorian, Top Floor Master
summary: 3,000 sf, 5 bedroom, 3 bath vacation home sleeps up to 8 adults and 2 children (2 Kings or 4 Twins, 1 Queen, 1 Full, 2 Twins.  Only suitable for 4 couples plus 2 children in twins in different rooms from one another.
space: Welcome to “The Seventeenth Street House"!   The house has a year-round 3 night minimum, accommodates up to 8 adults and 2 children age 12 and under with a maximum of 3 cars. The Pacific Grove Vacation Rental Permit for this house limits the number of parking spaces to 3 cars on the street. There is no off street parking. Car pooling may be necessary to accommodate the City parking requirement. Well-behaved, crate trained dogs accepted upon Owner approval. This spacious  3,000 square feet, 3-story home has been completely remodeled with great attention to detail. The Seventeenth Street House is a perfect home for family reunions; however due to the sensitivity of our neighbors and limited parking, the home is not available for wedding parties or wedding groups. It is located in the charming seaside community of Pacific Grove -- known as "Butterfly Town USA" because it is a stop in the migration of the Monarch Butterfly. It is also called  "America's last hometown" for its small-scale,

name: 3729 Ocean Park Sanctuary ~ Walk to the Beach, Restaurants & Shopping!
summary: Queen master, 1-2 twins, 1-2 twins or king, queen sleeper sofa, two single day couches in den. 1,536 sf, Pets ok.
space: Welcome to Ocean Park Sanctuary! Home sleeps 7 adults and 1 child Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home! Life’s a beach at this charming historic house in the heart of America’s Last Hometown, only a short walk to the bay, the Monterey Peninsula Recreation Trail, and shopping and dining in downtown Pacific Grove. Perfectly situated for surfers, kayakers and beachcombers, the blue-and-white 1,800-square-foot home built by Benjamin Barber in 1908 has been updated with whimsical coastal décor with a Hawaiian vibe, hardwood floors throughout and mini electric fireplaces in each bedroom. The back patio is an ideal gathering place for family and friends, with a ping-pong table, fire pit, gourmet gas grill, and patio seating. space: Welcome to Sea Glass Sanctuary! Home sleeps up to 9 adults and 1 child age 12 or under. summary: Welcome to Sea Palm Sanctuary! Sleeps up to 9 adults and 1 child Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home!   A sophisticated setting with expansive water views and bay lights make this a special property in Pacific Grove, where you can sit outside on the large covered deck with overhead heaters and watch the whales and waves, or entertain friends and family in the oversized fenced living space that backs up to Pacific Grove Municipal Golf Course.
space: Welcome to Sea Palm Sanctuary! host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

name: 3703 La Gloria Cottage-by-the-Sea ~ Walk to Town and Beach! Beautiful Design!
summary: 3 bedroom, 2 bath home near downtown Pacific Grove.  Walk to beach and all downtown restaurants and attractions. Home sleeps up to 6. 1 K, 2 Q
space: Welcome to La Gloria Cottage-by-the-Sea! Home sleeps 6. Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home! Restaurants, shops and art galleries are just steps away from this historic house in the heart of Pacific Grove, a lovely two-story residence that offers easy access to all the best that “America’s Last Hometown” has to offer. The 1,500 square feet pet-friendly home, a winner of the Pacific Grove Heritage Design Award, has been extensively remodeled so that while it retains its gracious past, it also offers modern conveniences at its spectacular location. Just a 3 minute walk to award-winning Passion Fish Restaurant  and a 10 minute walk to the beach or to the butterfly groves, it’s also only 5 minutes by car to the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row, 10 minutes to shopping in Carmel-by-the-Sea, and 15 minutes to golf and fine dining in Pebble Beach. summary: 1350 sf, 3 bedroom, 2 bath vacation home sleeps 6 (K in Master, Q, K/T Combo)
space: Welcome to “Seadance”! Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home! You will enjoy panoramic views of Monterey Bay from multiple rooms in this 1-story, mid-century Pacific Grove home called “Seadance”.  Natural beauty surrounds this 1350 square feet, 3-bedroom, 2-bath house, just a stone’s throw from a gorgeous 15-mile coastal walking trail. The entry has a covered porch, where you can enjoy morning coffee or sunset cocktails while basking in the 180-degree panorama. The front yard is landscaped with succulents and natives - including the electric-pink ground-cover that flourishes in the area. The sliding-glass front door opens to a living room with a wall of windows, hardwood floors and a brick gas fireplace. summary: 1592 sf, 4 bedroom, 2 bath vacation home sleeps up to 8 adults + 2 children (K, 3 K/Tw, Q Sleeper Sofa)
space: Welcome to “Seaside Sanctuary in the Pines”!  Home sleeps up to 8 adults and 2 children. Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home! Just a hop, skip and a jump from the beach, this light-filled family home in Pacific Grove echoes the seashore theme in its interior, with soothing blues, aquas, driftwood grays and browns. The 1592 square feet, 4-bedroom, 2-bath house offers plenty of flexibility for families and pet owners, with a large fenced yard for both kids and dogs, and plenty of sleeping areas. From here, you can walk to Asilomar State Park and beach in just a few minutes. Also nearby is the incomparable 17-Mile Drive and the shops, golf courses and restaurants of Pebble Beach, and it’s also close to Pacific Grove’s quaint downtown area, full of boutiques, art galleries and antique shops. space: Welcome to Jewel by the Sea!  Home sleeps up to 8 adults and 2 children age 12 or under. Ask our Reservationists about two days for the price of one admission tickets to the Monterey Bay Aquarium when you book this home! With the look of Old California on the outside and stylish elegance inside, this 4-bedroom, 3-bath home in the heart of Pacific Grove offers the best of everything in one place. name: 3263 Villa by the Sea ~ Stunning Ocean Front Location! Walk to Aquarium!
summary: 1,800 sf, 3 bedroom, 2.5 bath vacation home sleeps 6 adults comfortably on King-Master and 1K and 1Q Guest Rooms
space: Welcome to "Villa by the Sea"!  Home sleeps up to 6 adults. This custom European-style 3-bedroom, 2.5-bath luxury home, just steps from Monterey Bay, will make you feel like you are on the Mediterranean, with fantastic views of whitewater, sailboats, sea life and the mountains beyond! This 1,800 sq ft home is just minutes to downtown PacificGrove, Cannery Row and the famous Monterey Bay Aquarium and a short drive to Carmel or Pebble Beach. A walking and bike path along the shoreline extends from Cannery Row to Lover’s Point, past the famed succulent carpet of pink blooms, around Pt. Pinos with its trademark lighthouse, all the way to Spanish Bay and world-famous Pebble Beach. Upon your arrival you will be greeted with complimentary wine and cheese, passes to the renown Spa on the Plaza in downtown Monterey, tickets for a wine tasting at Scheid Vineyards’ tasting room in downtown Carmel-by-the-Sea and a basket of local information.
